loans.name: New Life 2020-A Group

texts.en:
This small group's leader is Jokudu M.. She currently sells bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jokudu is 35 years old and is married to a security guard. She has three children in school, ranging in age from eight to sixteen years old. Each week Jokudu makes approximately 240 Sudanese pounds in profits. With her loan, Jokudu hopes to increase her sales.

Jokudu is joined in her small group by Tabu P., Jackline N., Rose D., and Joice K.. Tabu P. sells charcoal and wants to buy more charcoal for sale. Jackline N. sells cosmetics at a shop and wants a loan to open up a new restaurant. Rose D. sells charcoal and wants to open up a clinic. Joice K. owns a small shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory to expand and create new businesses

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng R., 58, is married and she lives with one of her five children in The Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1979, she has been working on her rice field to earn a living and is able to make $1.30 per day. She is assisted by her children. Her husband, Nun Sok, 59, owns a plot of land growing vegetables to earn a profit of around $3 each day. She is asking for a loan of $400 to make two investments. She would like to invest $300 in her husband's farm, and also use $100 to purchase fertilizers for her rice farm. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To invest in farming

loans.name: Muzayam

texts.ru: Саидова Музаям жительница города Вахдат.Возраст  39 лет,замужем , имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее. Клиентка более 10 лет занимается куплей продажей овощей.Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью ,так как муж клиентки временно не работает. Музаям скупает у местным крестьян вощи и реализует из в розницу на местном рынке. В данный момент она хочет расширить свой бизнес.Клиентка решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muzayam S. lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. She is a high school graduate. For more than 10 years Muzayam has been selling vegetables. Her business helps her sustain her family. Her husband is currently unemployed. Muzayam buys vegetables from local peasants and sells them at the local market. She would like to expand her business and is applying for a loan that she plans to repay in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 31 year old man. She lives in a small village near Saida in southern Lebanon. He is a farmer who plants bananas. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mohrusor

texts.ru: Хисарова Мохрухсор жительница Гиссарского района. Возраст 32 года , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района. Торгует одеждой. Кредит решила получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mohrusor H. lives in the Gissar district. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She works in sales. She sells clothing from her stall in the district's central market. She decided to take out a loan in order to increase sales volume and bring in seasonal goods. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia A. is a petty trader who trades in yams in the community market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is 40 years and married with four kids, all of whom are in school.

Sophia treks to Techieman, a farming community, to buy from the farmers and retail to her customers. She wants to use this loan to buy more supplies of yams to serve her customers. She dreams of expanding her business to include additional foods, such as plantain and cassava, to meet the needs of her customers and make increased income. She said with the loan, she can make enough profit to stock her inventory when there are price hikes. She also wants to save part to keep her kids in school.

Sophia is a member of the community group Obatanpa Trust Group ("Obatanpa" means "good mother"). In this group, members support one another and guarantee each other's loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bulk tubers of yam from local farming communities

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Mrs. Vin L. lives in Pdau Chum Koeut village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Chuong Chab, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. In this plantation, they face some problems because they do not have enough money to amend the field to make their crops more productive.

In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Vin L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds, and hire laborers to work on the field. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom helps her parents on the plantation while two others are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds, and hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Turgunboi

texts.ru: Тургунбой 60-тилетний мужчина, отец 6 детей, жена пенсионерка.Сам Тургунбой работает в энергосбыте своего  Б.Гафуровского района,электриком.Он опытный мастер своего дела, кроме своей работы он также подрабатывает на вызов своих соседей.Из-за проблем со светом всем необходима помощь электрика.Благодаря своей работе он прокармливает свою семью.Кроме этого Тургунбой занимается откормом скота.Для приобретения несколько голов баранов он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Turgunboi is 60-years-old father of 6 children. His wife is retired. Turgunboi is an electrician. He works for the regional electric company. Turgunboi earns an extra income by servicing his neighbors. The money he makes as an electrician, Turgunboi spends to provide for his family. In addition, he raises cattle. Turgunboi needs this loan to purchase several sheep.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna B. est une  veuve de 50 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Elle vit au village d’enfants SOS de Sanankoroba (VESOS) où elle est directrice d’enseignement préscolaire. 
Afin d’augmenter son revenu, Madame Maïmouna B. intègre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel après 3 prêts de groupe  tous   correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, 55 pagnes wax à Bamako et à Conakry (capitale de la Guinée) où elle envoie souvent sa fille pour  son approvisionnement.
Les articles sont vendus aux femmes du village de Sanankoroba et de Bamako, elle vend au comptant et à crédit et compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 46.000FCFA  qu’elle utilisera pour payer rembourser les intérêts du prêt  et investir le reste dans son petit commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maïmouna B., age 50, is a widow and the mother of four children. She lives in the children village SOS (VESOS) in Sanankoroba, where she's a preschool director. To increase her income, Mrs. Maïmouna B. joined the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. She's seeking her first loan, following three group loans that were repaid without problems. With this loan, she intends to buy 55 Wax pagnes (colorful African cloth) in Bamako and in Conakry (the capital of Guinea), where she often sends in her daughter to get supplies. The items are sold to the women of the Sanankoroba village, and in Bamako. She sells for cash or on credit, and intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 46'000 (ca US$ 90), that she will use to repay the loan, and to invest in her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell 55 Wax pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita K. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rita is 30 years old and is married, her husband being a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Mrs. Sath Prum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sath P. is the president of a village bank in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. There are ten people in her village bank. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Sun Tork, owns a small business making rice wine to sell. This couple has four children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia M., tiene 31 años de edad, reside en el reparto el Carmen en la ciudad de Managua, madre soltera de dos hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, que cursan sus estudios, su negocio es una miscelánea que con muchos esfuerzos y ahorro inicio con ahorros propios, y la necesidad de sobresalir adelante para alimentar a sus hijos, este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en comprar granos básicos, carnes y productos de limpieza. Sus planes es poder vender variedades de productos que sastifagan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Karla Patricia M. is 31 years old and lives in the Carmen neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is the single mother of two children, 8 and 9, who are students. With much effort and with her own savings and from the necessity to move forward and feed her children, she began to sell miscellaneous items. This is her fifth loan through Afodenic, with which she is going to buy basic grains, meats, and cleaning products. She plans to be able to sell a variety of products which satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meats, and cleaning products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 44 years old, is married and has three sons who attend primary school and junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Elizabeth's husband runs a provision store.

Elizabeth is a yam trader. She distributes to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also sells at the lorry station. Elizabeth procures yam tubers from Kintampo, a nearby market, at an relatively effective price, but she hopes to obtain a loan to procure goods in bulk. She has been in business for over 10 years.

She is hopeful about expanding her business and wishes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy yam tubers in bulk

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 52 años, vive en su casa propia con su última hija de 16 años. Desde hace más de 16 años vende productos lácteos (yogurt, mantequilla y quesos), se inició con poco, pero ahora reparte a los clientes regulares que tiene en las ferias comerciales cercanas a su localidad. Generalmente vende al crédito, reparte sus productos y luego de un tiempo, acordado con el cliente, regresa para el cobro. Con este tipo de trabajo realiza viajes constantes a las zonas aledañas a su ciudad, tanto para abastecerse, como para vender sus productos. Hasta el momento sus ventas han dado buenos resultados y puede sostener ella sola la economía de su casa, por lo que tiene planes de seguir con la misma modalidad de trabajo. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se retiró por una temporada de su banco comunal, por motivo de viaje, pero ahora se reintegra porque sus compañeros conocen que es una persona responsable en sus pagos, además que ella misma se compromete a seguir trabajando así. El dinero que está solicitando es para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería en quesos y mantequilla.
texts.en:
Irene is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her oldest daughter who is 16. For more than 16 years she has been selling milk products (yogurt, butter and cheese). She began with little but now she distributes to regular clients at the markets in her area.

Generally she sells on credit, delivers her products, and after a time agreed upon with the client, she returns to collect payment. With this type of work she is constantly traveling to the small towns around her city, both to stock up and to sell her products. Up until now her sales have been producing good results and she can meet all her household expenses, so she plans to continue working the same way.

This is the 6th time she has had a loan from MFP. She had withdrawn from the communal bank for a while because of travel, but she has now returned because her fellow members know that she is responsible with her payments and she promises to continue this way. The loan she is requesting is to purchase a larger quantity of cheese and butter.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Зиеева Мавчуда проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 51 год. Разведена, имеет 3 детей. Мавчуда более 4 лет занимается торговлей, она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует продуктами питания. Клиентка просит кредит, для того чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Mavchuda Z. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 51 years old. She is divorced and has three children. Mavchuda is in a retail business for more than four years and has a vendor spot on the market where she sells food products. The client is asking for a loan to increase her sales and circulation of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation of goods

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Yam P., a modest villager living in the province of Banteay Meanchey, Cambodia, is divorced and takes care of three children studying in the local public school. She collects duck eggs from local rural farmers and then sells them in bulk to a market seller for a profit of around $6 each day which she uses to care for her family and pay for her children’s school fees. Yam P.’s current income is not enough for her family’s daily expenses, so she hopes to earn additional revenue by using a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to order gas to sell.

loans.use: To order gas to sell.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean S. C., 28, has four young children and lives in Battambong Province with her husband, Tun Narith (pictured).  C. stays at home and looks after her children.  One of her children is enrolled in a local primary school while the rest stay at home because they are too young to attend school. Her husband is a construction foreman and generally earns an income of US $7.5 per day to cover the family expenses.  C. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer as a mean of transporting builders their work sites.

loans.use: to purchase a bike and trailer

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok M. H., age 37, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she sells fruits and groceries in front of her house, typically earning a gross income of US $12 per day. Her husband is a civil servant, earning US $3 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, H. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, H. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase more and varied kinds of groceries to expand her business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia Q. C. trabaja con nuestra institución hace muchos años ex integrante del grupo solidario san juan, se dedica a la venta de condimentos en diferentes mercados de la ciudad. Vive con su esposo y tres de sus cuatro hijos. El esposo es albañil contratista. El prestamo sera invertido en la compra de mercaderia.
texts.en:
Lidia Q. C. has worked with our institution for many years. She is an ex member of the San Juan supportive group. She sells condiments in different markets in the city. She lives with her husband and three of her four children. Her husband is a building contractor. The loan is to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, chili, oregano, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is engaged in hog raising business. She is requesting to avail a loan of PHP4, 000 because she wanted her business to maintain and somehow expand into poultry business. She is planning to purchase additional piglets.  The loan she is requesting will be of big help to the pursuance of her business into progress thus she is working hard. Moreover, the business is also of big help to their family needs.

Belinda is now 37 years old. She is a hog raiser from the village of Flores Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Eduardo who is a farmer and they are blessed with three children who are all studying. Their eldest is already in college while the other two are already in their high school. She is hoping to support their studies until they complete their education in college. Hopefully through her business and with the help of her husband, they could continuously support their educational needs.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Nouv

texts.en: Mrs. Nouv P. lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare field of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is far from an irrigation system. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump machine and hoses. Her husband, Mr. Srey Pheap, is a construction worker. This couple has six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a laborer; one is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine and hoses.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 31-year-old married man with two children. Since 2001 he has owned a van he uses to make deliveries to neighboring villages. He works on call for clients, and his delivery service is in great demand. 

Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1,200 to replace his van’s motor. His wish is to improve his business and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To replace his van's motor

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en: Mwajabu N. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a grocery in Kitunda ward of Dar es Salaam selling both soft drinks and food including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice, Coca Cola products and Pepsi Cola.  She is a married woman and has three children: one in primary school, one in secondary school and one in college education. She has been in business for three years. She has constructed a residential house. Her business income is used to pay for school fees, meet the family's daily demands and for business capitalization. She needs a loan of 600,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Pablo Esnider

texts.en: Don Pablo is single, 53 years old, and has worked as the financial director of the San Antonio Supermarket for 16 years. He also relies on his taxi business to generate additional income. He has sons who are more than 18 years old, but he always provides them with support. He is taking out his first loan in order to put in a ceramic floor in his house. The floor is tiled now, but it is in poor condition, and in this way he will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To install tiled flooring in his home

loans.name: Soba Soba Butamisi Safi Group

texts.en:
B. Safi is thirty-eight years old and is married with six children of whom five are going to school. She also looks after three orphans of whom two are schooling.

Safi owns a bakery that she has been operating for over six years. Due to insufficient capital, she is using the loan to purchase bread ingredients such as cooking oil, baking powder, wheat flour, etc., to improve her business.

Safi is a hardworking businesswoman whose future hope is to prosper and to raise her children to a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase bread ingredients such as cooking oil, baking powder, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is single. He has a transportation business in his home town of Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Igor offers transportation services all over the territory of Ukraine. He’s known as a very careful and experienced driver which is why he always has many clients. Igor started this business 8 years ago. Presently, his monthly income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Igor is requesting an 11,000 Grivnya loan to do some maintenance work on his car and purchase a turbine. This business is the main source of income for Igor. He works really hard to make some savings and hopefully buy an apartment of his own some day. Igor has repaid all previous loans without any problems.

loans.use: To buy a turbine and do some repair work on his car.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn S. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 44 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Marilyn owns and operates a business providing rice processing to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up on yams and rice for her restaurant and resupplying her cafeteria

loans.name: Hav

texts.en:
Mrs. Hav C. lives in Pouthi Reamea village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Mat San, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family living.

The rice field has some problems because it has infertile soil but they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Hav C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to improve their rice production.

This couple has three children, two of whom are attending the local public school while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel for her rice field

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery P. D. A. D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive en el cual vive en compañía D. sus tres hijos D. 21, 18, y 16 años D. edad. Nery posee una tienda D. abarrotes, en los cuales comercializa productos D. primera necesidad como pastas, pan, huevos y otros más los cuales son fundamentales dentro D. un hogar. Ella cuenta con 5 años D. poseer el negocio, el cual le ha permitido ir mejorando su economía familiar, la cual en muchas ocasiones es bastante mala, sobre todo porque muchas veces ella no cuenta con todos los productos que las personas buscan lo cual le baja en gran manera sus ganancias. Es por esta razón que Nery solicita un préstamo a integral, con el fin D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para poder surtir su negocio con esos productos tan necesarios que no posee, así mismo con el deseo D. poder aumentar la cantidad D. los que ya posee. Nery desea mejorar su negocio, sobre todo porque ella es madre soltera, y debe velar por sus hijos cada día, esto a pesar que uno D. los hijos mayores trabaja, esto no da abasto con los gastos del hogar, razón Por la cual Nery posee la esperanza D. poder mejorar su situación gracias a este préstamo.
texts.en:
Nery P. D. A., 38, lives in San Salvador department with her three children, who are 21, 18 and 16 years of age. Nery has a grocery store where she sells basic items like: pasta, bread, eggs and others that are basic in any home. She has had the store for 5 years and it has make it possible for her to improve the family's economic situation which, on many occasions is quite bad, above all because she often lacks all the products that customers are looking for and this lowers her profits. For this reason, Nery is asking Integral for funding in order to be able to stock her store with the items she doesn't have as well as to increase quantities of those items she does have. Nery wishes to improve her business, above all because she's a single mother and must watch over her children every day; even though one of her older children is employed, this is still not enough to meet all household expenses. Nery hopes to be able to improve her situation thanks to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia S. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family with her restaurant/eatery business, livestock and play station machine. She lives in Brgy Tagbino, Vallehermoso, Negros Occidental with her 49-year-old husband, Benjamin, who works as a foreman in a construction firm.  They have three children who are between 5-21 years old.  One of them is already married.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her restaurant/eatery, livestock and play station business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Clemencia is now borrowing PHP 16,000 as additional working capital for her restaurant/eatery. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Clemencia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: José Patricio

texts.es:
El señor Patricio R. tiene la edad de 45 años, casado y con 3 hijas y 2 hijos todos en edad escolar, él es originario del pellizco Occidental ubicado a 4 km de Chichigalpa.
Don Patricio es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 1 año y donde se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, desde el año 2006 trabaja con Ceprodel obteniendo hasta la fecha 6 créditos, cinco de ellos para mejoramiento de vivienda y el ultimo que lo solicito para pagar el alquiler de tierras y compra de insumos, ya que también se dedica a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Patricio is 45 years old, married and has 3 school-aged daughters and 2 sons. He is originally from an area 4km from Chichigalpa. For the past year he’s been working as a security guard for the Chichigalpa city hall. He has been affiliated with CEPRODEL since 2006 and has had six previous loans, five of which he used for home improvement, and the sixth to lease some land and buy farming supplies. He also works as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lease farmland and buy farming supples

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 29 years old and married with one child who is in school. She runs a clinic where she conducts tests to earn a living.  She also earns extra income from selling milk and eggs. Her husband is a businessman. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has benefited by saving her money with her group members(named Five Star), enabling her to access loans because the members are her guarantors. She dreams of opening a hospital in the future. She has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more medical clinic equipment.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment

loans.name: Geysel Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  Señora.   GEYSEL DEL CARMEN S. G., Labora como Secretaria Ejecutiva en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería UNI.
Ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y   estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado tres  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres  créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de una pared   de su casa de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
La Señora. GEYSEL DEL CARMEN S. G., Labora como Secretaria Ejecutiva en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería UNI. Ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, hierro, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de una pared de su casa de habitación. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, a 37-year-old married  father of two children who go to school, practices dairy farming to earn a living, while his wife is a hair dresser.  He was previously employed in a hotel before he ventured into business.  Joseph joined Faulu Kenya in a group called Ikinu Rehema so that he could access working capital.  He successfully serviced his first loan which he used to buy a dairy cow, a purchase that marked his entry into dairy farming five years ago.  The hardworking Joseph is now requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy a dairy cow, and he hopes to construct a zero grazing unit with a capacity for carrying many cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mrs. Heng Kith Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has fifteen people who live in Sampan Leu village in Kandal province.  Heng K. is the village bank president, selected by the other members.  Each will use a piece of the loan for different purposes.  She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to sell to support their family.  Their field is infertile and it is far away from an irrigation system.  So to improve production, Heng is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline and to cover the cost of renting a machine to plow her field.  She is a mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a casino club.  Another is a cane seller.  The youngest attends a local public school.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, gasoline and rent a plow.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 60-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is a father of twelve children. He has been working since 1980 as a home painter, and he also owns a grocery store where he sells canned food, groceries, candies, beverages, biscuits and lots more. His clients are people from his region and its surroundings. Ibrahim says that he is committed to both his businesses and is proud of his experience. He notes that it has been a challenge to secure financing for both his businesses. Today, for the second time, Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to install stands in his shop. Ibrahim works hard to provide the best for his big family.

loans.use: To install stands in his shop

loans.name: Rotchie

texts.en:
Rotchie A. is from the village of  Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rotchie owns and operates a store where she sells fish and shrimp. Rotchie has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rotchie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rotchie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rotchie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rotchie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sris

texts.en: Mrs. Sris C., who lives in Andoung Kien village in Takeo province, is 27 years old. She is a gasoline seller at her home while her husband, Mr. is a farmer who owns two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family moreover he owns a pump machine for rent to farmers. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve production, Mrs. Sris C. is seeking for a loan to buy more gasoline to resale. She is a mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline to resale

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris C. is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd. She is 38 years old. Maricris is married and has 6 infant children. To make a living, Maricris owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maricris has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricris joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,800 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricris is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maricris from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Cheikh A.tidiane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh Ahmed Tidiane S. habite à Yoff Ngaparou. Il est âgé  de 64 ans. Il est marié et père de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 9 et 26 ans.
Monsieur S. a opté son choix sur l’activité de commerce pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Par conséquent il pratique la vente de gaz dans un local de son quartier depuis plus de 30ans. Auparavant  il a travaillé comme agent administratif à l’ONCAD entre 1983 et 1990.
Monsieur S. est sociétaire de la caisse de l’UIMCEC à Yoff depuis mai 2003. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destiné a l’achat de bouteilles  de gaz  dans le but de renforcer sa boutique et d’accroitre  le niveau de ses bénéfices. Son souhait est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et aussi de leur donner l’occasion d’hériter  en lui une activité productive.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh Ahmed Tidiane S. lives in Yoff Ngaparou. He is 64 years old, married and the father of 7 children aged between 9 and 26. Mr. S. chose to become a trader as a way to meet his family's needs. He has been selling gas in his neighborhood for over 30 years. Previously, he was an administrative worker at ONCAD, from 1983 to 1990. A member of the UIMCEC savings bank in Yoff since May 2003, he is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs to buy bottles of gas in order to increase supply in his store and to make a higher level of profit. His wish is to improve his family's living conditions and also to give them the opportunity to inherit a successful business activity from him.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Nooretet Enole

texts.en:
Nooretet Enole K. is 34 years old. She supports six members of her family. She has been rearing cattle for the last eight years. She buys young heifers during the dry season when they are not very costly, then places them in her farm which she has fenced for grazing. After the rainy season, when the bulls have fattened, she sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

She learned about KADET LTD. from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her second loan. She is planning to buy four more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit, she intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

Her future dream is to become a large-scale farmer in cattle rearing. 

She is a hardworking woman and is determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To buy four more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit

loans.name: Moung's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan.  Moung S. was selected the group's leader.  They all live in Preak Thmei village, Kandal province.
 
Moung is a banana and flour seller in the local market.  Her husband works as electrician.  They are able to earn a small income to support their family.  In order to increase their income, Moung decided to ask for a loan.  She wants to buy more bananas and flour to sell.  This couple has three school age children, who also help staff their mother's business.

loans.use: Buy more bananas and flour to sell.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
This is Abraham B., 46, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Judith B., a storekeeper, and is the father of a college aged young adult and two high-schoolers. By the grace of God, Abraham has managed to support his child's schooling up to the college level. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his family's every day expenses.

Abraham operates a variety store and also an egg wholesaling and retailing business. He imports eggs from poultry farms, brings them to the capital and then sells them for a few pesos profit for each egg. Eggs are one of the staples, having a multitude of uses as bread ingredients, viands paired with rice, or as bread fillings.

To help him continue his business, he is requesting a loan of 18000 PHP. He will be using the loan to buy more quantities of eggs to be sold and to replenish stocks for his variety store. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his businesses.
  
Abraham hopes that all of his work will enable him to renovate his house soon. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy assorted grocery stock and eggs to be sold

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya where he has been farming for twenty years. He sells his horticultural products to the local market. He is also employed. 

Edwin is 40 years old and married with six school-aged children. Four of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 25,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for rabbit-keeping. The proceeds from the sale of rabbits will assist him in paying school fees for his children. His biggest challenge has been a lack of reliable market for rabbits. In the future, he would like to expand his farming and be the leading supplier of rabbit meat in central Kenya. He says that with the help of Juhudi, small-scale farmers have hope of creating wealth from their small pieces of land.

loans.use: For rabbit-keeping

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A. is from the village of Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, is married, and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2001, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her thirteenth loan from PMPC. Myrna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and have working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: G.s. Jimenez Hernandez Group

texts.es: La señora Celia Inecilia tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad de 28 31 y 35 años de edad. La señora se dedica a la producción y comercialización de pan dulce y simple, los cuales los vende en zonas aledañas de El Rosario y Santa Teresa. La señora tiene 5 años de estarse dedicando a este negocio, el cual surgió en principio porque su mama le enseño a elaborar pan, ella tenía una venta y la tuvo que cerrar por que la gente fiaba y no le pagaba, por lo que tuvo que cerrarla y empezar con otro negocio. Ella solicita este crédito por primera vez a Fundación León 2000 con el objetivo de comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de pan, siempre pensando en que los precios de estos materiales pueden incrementar de precio.  Otro integrante del grupo es don José Luis el cual tiene 25 años de edad, es casado tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad. El señor se dedica a la producción y venta de pan simple y pan dulce. El señor inicio este negocio hace 3 años, por la misma falta de empleo que aqueja al país, buscando una forma de mantener a sus hijos. El señor, solicita este crédito para invertirlo en comprar materia prima para la elaboración de pan antes que suban los precios.
texts.en:
Celia Inecilia, 57, is married and has three adult children who are 28, 31, and 35 years old.  She bakes sweet bread to sell in areas adjacent to El Rosario and Santa Teresa.  She has been in this business for five years.

The business started because her mother taught her to bake at the beginning.  She had a bakery but had to close because she would sell on credit and then wouldn’t get paid so she had to close and start a different business.

She is asking for her first loan from Fundación León 2000 to buy raw materials to make bread always keeping in mind that the price of these materials can rise.

Another member of the group is José Luis, 25.  He’s married and has two children who are 10 and 3 years of age.  He bakes simple and sweet bread. He started the business three years ago due to the lack of employment opportunities in the country and needing to have a way to support his children. He is asking for the loan to buy raw material to make bread before prices for these materials go up.

loans.use: To buy bread baking supplies.

loans.name: Los Genios De La Alcancia Comunal Group

texts.es:
LOS GENIOS DE LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL

Maruja tiene 41 años de edad recientemente es la presidenta de la alcancía comunal	                                      
“Los Genios de la Alcancía Comunal” este grupo esta conformado por 7 vecinos q están comenzando a trabajar con Edaprospo-Prosperidad y decidieron ponerle ese nombre a su alcancía comunal por que en el grupo tienen derecho de opinión y todos acordaron ponerle el nombre de “Los Genios de la Alcancía comunal”.
Maruja es madre casada de 4 hijos los cuales 2 son dependientes y 2 son independientes Maruja para ayudar a su espeso con los gastos del hogar comenzó a vender ropa hace 25 años, Maruja comenzó vendiendo mercadería q le pertenecía a su vecino  y luego compartían las ganancias asta q Maruja comenzó a comprar y vender su propia así a podido construir su casa y mantener a sus hijos, Maruja adquirirá (comprara) mas productos de venta (ropa) con el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Los Genios de la Alcancia Comunal
Maruja is 41 years old.  She recently became the president of the 'Los Genios de la Alcancia Comunal' (The Geniuses of Communal Banking) communal bank.  The seven members of this group are all neighbors who are just starting to work with Edaprospo-Prosperidad.  They decided on this name for their group because in the group they have the right to their opinion and they all agreed to give it the name 'Los Genios de la Alcancía Comunal'.

Maruja is a married mother of two children, 2 of whom are dependent and 2 of whom are independent.  To help her husband with their household expenses, Maruja started selling clothes 25 years ago.  Maruja started selling merchandise that belonged to her neighbor and they shared the profits until Maruja started to buy and sell her own goods.  This has enabled her to build her own home and support her children.  Maruja will buy more products to sell (clothes) with her loan.

loans.use: To acquire supplies (clothes)

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: L. sra. Elena García, D. 38 años D. edad es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en casa alquilada junto a su pareja Frithz D. 41 años y sus 02 queridos hijos  George  D. 11 años y Sofía D. 07 años D. edad, conforman una bonita familia llena D. armonía. El negocio D. Elena, es muy visitado por sus compradores, porque ofrece ropas novedosas D. primera calidad. Su bazar D. ropa esta situado en L. ciudad del distrito D. kimbiri, donD. viene trabajando como 08 años en este negocio; gracias al apoyo D. su pareja elL. pueD. viajar con tranquilidad para adquirir más mercadería para su bazar, es así que su pareja cumple un rol  muy importante en el negocio D. Elena. Este negocio le genera buenas ganancias, gracias a ello pudo comprarse un lote D. terreno donD. más adelante planea construir su casa y brindar una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos. Con el tiempo espera ampliar su stand D. ropa y así satisfacer las peticiones D. su clienteL.. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y asegura que no dejará D. pagar sus cuotas, En su banco comunal es una socia muy venerada por aportar ideas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería para abastecer  su negocio y desarrollarse en este rubro.
texts.en:
Elena García is 38 years old.  She is a very hard-working woman who lives in a rented house together with her partner, 41 year-old Frithz, and their two beloved children: 11 year-old George and 7 year-old Sofia.  Theirs is a beautiful family which is full of harmony.

Elena's business is very popular with her customers because she offers good-quality, fashionable clothes.  Her clothes stall is located in the city, in  Kimbiri district.  She has been working in this business for 8 years.  Thanks to her partner's support, she can travel peacefully to acquire more merchandise for her business.  Her partner plays a very important role in Elena's business.

This business makes Elena good profits which has enabled her to buy a plot of land where she later plans to build a house and proviD. her children with a better quality of life.  Over time, she hopes to expand her clothes stand and thereby satisfy her customers' demands.

This is Elena's second loan with MFP and she assures us that she will not fail to make her repayments.  She is a very well respected member of her community bank as she brings many ideas to it.  She will use her loan money to buy more merchandise with which to stock her business and make progress.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to satisfy her customers' demands

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La Sra. Ana se dedica a la confección  de cortinas para galpones de cría de pollos para una  empresa conocida de la ciudad desde hace tres años, ella confecciona las cortinas por cantidad para luego entregar a la empresa quien le paga inmediatamente después de la entrega, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como chofer,  debido a que viven en lugar alejado vieron por necesidad la compra de una motocicleta para su transporte, cuentan con vivienda propia, tiene dos niños  quienes colaboran en los quehaceres de la casa ya que sus padres trabajan todo el día, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Ana's job for the past three years has been making curtains for chicken sheds for a well-known local company. She makes the curtains in bulk to later be sold to the company, who pays her immediately upon delivery. Her husband works as a driver, and since they live in a remote area they have found it necessary to buy a motorcycle for transportation. They have their own home and two children who help out with the household chores since their parents work all day. Ana is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena P. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Magdalena is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Magdalena raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Magdalena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase medication for her livestock. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Magdalena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medication for her livestock

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hugo Enrique

texts.es:
Hugo de 26 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, se dedica a criar cerdos y posee una tienda, él vive con su esposa Luisa y tienen una hija de 3 años de edad. El negocio tiene 4 años  de existir, lo atiende de 7:00am a 8:00pm,  la crianza de cerdos es un oficio que aprendió junto a sus padres.
El está solicitando un préstamo para surtir la tienda y también quiere comprar cerditos, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para mejorar el negocio y adquirir más cerdos para crecerlos, espera ir superando las dificultades económicas y que su situación sea mejor cada día.
Los objetivos de Hugo es seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, ya que de él depende su familia para los cuales desea darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
Hugo is 26 years old and resides in Corinto in the Department of Morazán. He raises pigs and manages a store. Hugo lives with his wife Luisa and their three year old daughter. His business has been in existence for four years and he manages it from 7am to 8pm. Raising pigs is a trade he learned from his parents.

Hugo is requesting a loan to restock his store, but he also wants to buy piglets. This loan will be a great help in improving his business and acquiring more pigs to raise. He hopes to overcome his financial difficulties and improve his situation each day. One of his goals is to continue investing in his business since he relies on it so that he can provide his family the best.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store & acquire piglets

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Age:                            22
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      2
Business:                    Planting and harvesting taro for sale
Loan purpose:              To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives
Weekly profit:              300 Samoan talas (WST)

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.7 out of 3
Level of Education:                             1.6 out of 3
Level of Total Household Income:        1.75 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.6 out of 3

Loreta owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Loreta needs a loan of 1500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST per week) to improve and/or expand the business.

Loreta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Loreta's 2nd loan with SPBD.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded South Pacific Business Development to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem.  Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive updates on SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale up to 3--the higher the number, the better off the person.  The metrics are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Yam T. is 27 years old and her husband, Heng Sroun, is 26. They are from Kompong Tom province. They work from home making furniture which they also sell. Most of their output consists of beds and cupboards, which they accumulate and sell as sets. They also order baskets from the other villagers and sell them to make additional income. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. The couple has one child who is in school. In order to increase her income, Yam T. has applied for a loan to buy additional beds for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional beds for resale

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with two children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from the sale of gasoline and electronic re-loading.

Mary Ann aspires to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha, a married woman with two school-going children, lives with her family in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family. For the past four years, Jerusha has operated a clothing business, selling wholesale, retail, at the market, and door to door in her neighboring community.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her business, and will purchase dresses and socks with the Kshs 20,000 loan she is requesting. Jerusha, who faces the major challenge of high transportation costs as she goes about selling clothes, dreams of establishing her own selling stall in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dresses and socks.

loans.name: Jesus Lola

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres  hijos, la señora estudió educación superior. 
Jesús se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, con su primer préstamo solicitado fue por la suma de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles dinero que utilizará para comprar dos fardos de frazadas, mantones, sombreros, todo lo compra de Juliaca y Desaguadero para venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad.  La señora trabaja sola ya que su esposo trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sueño es crecer y mejorar el negocio pera tener mayores ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el compañerismo entre las socias.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member s a community bank called “Las Intocables” [The Untouchables], located in the district of Puno, province and departament of Puno. She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage and has three children. She is a high school graduate.  
 
Jesús sells clothing. She has worked in the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. The first loan she took out was for the amount of  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business. 

She will ask for a new loan in the amount of S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles, money she will use to buy two bundles of blankets, shawls, and hats. She buys them all from Juliaca y Desaguadero to sell in the city markets. She works alone sonce her husband works as a teacher. 

Her dream is to grow and improve in business to have more income. What she likes about the community bank is the companionship among the members.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of blankets, shawls, hats.

loans.name: Andrez

texts.en:
Andrea is a widow with two children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Andrea is 49 years old.

Andrea has a food market business in the Philippines. Andrea requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her food market.

Andrea has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Andrea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her food market.

loans.name: Remedio

texts.en:
No matter what ups or downs might happen, life continues to flow. And Remedio, 50, learns to go with the flow while making sure he stays afloat. Remedio only reached high school. At present, he is a community partner in CCT* who actively attends Bible fellowships, trains on how to run a microenterprise, and saves for future business use. He is married to Jessielyn, and together they raise three children. They currently live in Tanza, Cavite.
Remedio has a rolling store – a store on wheels. He sells items that are of good use to customers on a daily basis, such as plastic wares and small appliances. For five years, Remedio has gotten to know what his fellow community members typically look for. With this business, he makes a net income of around 10,000 PHP per month. He manages to keep his business going without any employees at his side.
To help him continue to operate his business, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. He views this loan as a big boost to his capital, with which he is able to purchase necessary items to expand his product inventory. It is crucial for him to acquire whatever item his customers are looking for, and this loan enables him to do just that.
Life keeps on flowing, and while there is a positive look to it, it also brings challenges to Remedio. One of the uncertainties Remedio feels as he goes along with the flow every day is that he is not certain how they will survive each day, as there is still no concrete means of sustaining his business. One thing he holds to, however, is the business that he has. That is why he makes sure he meets every need of his customers so they will patronize his business and buy regularly from him. Even as he desires sustainability for his business, he prays for a good business space with a low rental rate. He longs deeply to see his children finish school and learn not just to go along with the flow but to make things happen. As a CCT community partner, he faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted household items and accessories to restock his rolling store.

loans.name: Ena

texts.es: Ena de 38 años convive con Jorge de 37, fruto de ese gran amor tienen cuatro hermosos hijos, quienes viven en su casa propia en el centro poblado de Puerto Mayo distrito de Pichari. Ena desde muy niña adopto de sus padres las labores agrícolas y los quehaceres de  la casa, que fue que lo inculco a obtener un terreno agrícola propio para poder generara su propio ingreso económico. Desde entonces cultiva cacao, café, y otros con la ayuda de su querido esposo. Ena esta satisfecha con su trabajo, por que sabe que al cultivar estos productos le genera un buen ingreso económico,  para así darles a sus menores hijos una alimentación y educación adecuada. Para Ena lo primordial por ahora es comprar un terreno para seguir expandiendo sus plantaciones de cacao y obtener mayor volumen en sus frutos para así obtener  mejores ganancias. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ena  esta a gusto con su banco comunal por que son participativos, entusiastas y con ganas de seguir superándose. Con los tres mil nuevos soles obtenido comprará un terreno para aumentar sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Ena is 38 years old and in a common-law marriage with Jorge, age 37.  Their loving relationship has resulted in four beautiful children.  They live in their own house in the central village of Puerto Mayo in the District of Pichari.  Ena was adopted as a young girl by her parents and they taught her how to farm and take care of the household chores.  She eventually obtained her own farmland for generating an income.  Since then she has grown cacao, coffee, and other crops to help her beloved husband.  Ena is satisfied with her work because she knows that the crops she produces will generate a good income, thereby enabling her to feed her children and provide them an adequate education.  For Ena, her current priority is to buy more land so that she can continue to expand her planting of cacao and increase her output in order to generate more income.  

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  Ena commits to being punctual with her loan payments.  She enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because the members are active participants, enthusiastic, and eager to continue succeeding.  Her loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy a plot of land so that she can plant more cacao.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for planting cacao.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Él Sr. Pedro es mecánico, es casado, vive con su Sra. Y sus 2hijos, tienen casa propia.
Él se dedica a la mecánica, posee un taller en una propiedad alquilada, se dedica a esta profesión hace 15 años aproximadamente, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia para llevar adelante su negocio, ya que sus hijos lo ayudan con el trabajo que realiza en su negocio.
Se define como una personas muy trabajadora y sacrificada, cada día trabaja arduamente para lograr el sustento de su familia.
Solicita el crédito a la Fundación para invertir en la infraestructura de su taller, además conseguir mas herramientas que va a utilizar en su taller. Tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito ya que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Pedro is a mechanic.  He’s married and lives with his wife and two children.  They own their house.  He’s a mechanic and has his shop in a rented property.  He’s been in this profession for about 15 years.  His family helps him run the business since his children help him with the work that’s done there.  He defines himself as a very hard working, self sacrificing person.  He works hard every day to support his family.

He asks the Fundación for a loan to invest in his shop’s infrastructure and to acquire more tools he’ll use in the shop.  He has all his hopes pinned on the loan because it will be a great help.

loans.use: to provide infrastructure for his shop, for its maintenance and to acquire tools.

loans.name: Lucien Colombia

texts.es:
Colombia de 39 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Su esposo es chofer tienen 3 hijos que están en escuela fiscal. Tiene un taller de costuras.

Con las ganas de progresar decidió ponerse su taller de costuras. Labora sola de 6H00 am en adelante. Con el apoyo del préstamo quiere adquirir una maquina recubridora para realizar sus trabajos de costura mejorar su negocio. Ella desea expandir mas se negocio.
texts.en:
Colombia is 39 years old.  She lives in the Primavera area of Duran, is a suburban area that was originally an informal settlement, with a number of hills, creeks and lagoons which still linger - remnants of a disappearing ecology.  Her husband is a driver.  They have 3 children who attend school.  She has a sewing business.  

Colombia wanted to get ahead, so she set up a sewing business.  She works alone from 6am onward.  With help from a loan she would like to purchase a coverstitch machine to use in her sewing projects and improve her business.  She would like  for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a coverstitch machine.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Amelia has a shop that sells breads, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 28,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Amelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Amelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is 54 years old, married and has nine children, two of them in school. She is in the business of pig fattening in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in the business for four years, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Benedicta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 33, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Lino, a security guard. She, together with her husband, manages the own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jennifer operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal, to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Jennifer earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jennifer hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to draw her family to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sarain

texts.en:
Sarain, 43 year old, is a policeman earning $3 per day. His wife stays home. He has three children, 19, 17, and 14 years old. One of them is studying and the other two are working for $3.3 per day each. 

Every month, he has to spend $70 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a plot of land for doing farming. He wants to buy this plot of land because when he retires from his current work, he wants to do farming to earn some money for his family. He hopes to send his last child to study in the university when he finishes high school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for doing farming.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 59 years, married, and has three adult children. His primary business is supplying potatoes at the busy Mulolongo market. He has been in this business for three years.  John's earns a monthly income of 36,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET By KADET officer.
	
This is John's third loan from KADET, which he will use to purchase potatoes for resale. He paid his previous loans on time.

John's anticipated profit will be used to purchase a pickup for transportation. His dream is to have a big store, buy potatoes from upcountry, and sell at Nairobi Gikomba market.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for resale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Georgia tiene 51 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ellos viven en la ciudad D. Caacupé.
Es comerciante desD. hace más D. 10 años, empezó vendiendo primeramente bebidas, como gaseosas y cervezas, con el pequeño ahorro y la ayuda D. su hijo que es chofer D. una empresa importadora D. vehículos pudo llegar a surtir su negocio con otro tipo D. productos hasta finalmente montar una despensa.
Gracias a la buena atención y a la calidad D. sus productos hoy día tiene clientela formada. La Señora Georgia comenta que sus ingresos son muy buenos y sus ventas aumentan ya que cumple con la demanda D. los productos que su clientela requiere.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas,panificados y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad D. productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Georgia, 51, is married and has four children.  They live in the city of Caacupé.

For over ten years she has been in business and started out selling beverages such as sodas and beer.  With a small amount of savings and help from her son, who is a driver for a vehicle import company, she was able to stock more products until finally establishing a store.

Nowadays she has a well formed customer base thanks to her service and product quality.  Mrs. Georgia says she has a very good income and sale are increasing because she is able to meet customer demand.

She is requesting a loan to buy goceries, beverages, bakery products and other items which will add variety to the range of products she offers her customers.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages, bakery products and other items.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is seeking this loan because she anticipates increased demand for fish and wishes to add more stock to meet that demand. Using the previous loan, Rosemary was able to expand the assortment of her products and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Emerciana

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos  que ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 7ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades  financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de  sua terra natal para Boane com sua familia ainda muito jovem, é comerciante ha mais de 4 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 11.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos comerciaiais (amendoim, arroz, sumos, refrescos, vinhos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro vai manter o seu negocio mais forte e construir uma casa maior, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Emerciana was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She went to school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

She and her family left Maputo for Boane when she was still very young. She's had a shop for more than four years and earns about 11,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account.
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to buy commercial products (peanuts, rice, juice, soft drinks, wines, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.
She intends to request more loans from Hluvuku to keep her business strong and build a larger house.

loans.use: to buy commercial products (peanuts, rice, juice, soft drinks, wines, etc.).

loans.name: Willaflor

texts.en:
Willaflor is married. She is 33 years old and has four kids. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

Willaflor manages her owns garden to make a living and has had this type of work for more than 10 years. Each month, she earns 4,600 Philippines pesos (Php) doing this kind of business. She has requested a loan with the amount of Php 7,000 to buy more seedlings and to purchase fertilizers. 

Willaflor has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. Willaflor will save the returns for sending her kids to school and to provide for their daily needs. Willaflor is wishing that her farm will grow and be more salable in her community.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings to plant and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Petin
