texts.es: Petin, de 41 años, es un hombre bueno y muy amable. Vive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 19, 12 y 1 año en casa D. padre de su pareja. Él junto a su pareja salen a diario en busca de ingresos para poder brindar lo mejor a sus familia. El trabajo de Petin consiste en la venta de bebidas, compra por grandes cantidades y los pone a congelar en sus refrigeradoras en espera de sus clientes le soliciten. Su negocio esta en su casa y lo lleva haciendo ya por tres años, ya que antes no se dedicaba a nada y tenía que depender mucho de los ingresos de su conviviente, pero ahora tiene su propio dinero y aporta en la economía de su hogar. Su trabajo tiene buenos y malos días como todos. En los días de intenso calor en la ciudad vende hasta 10 cajas de bebidas, pero los días de lluvia su venta máxima es de 1 o 2 cajas, espera poder poner una distribuidora grande y así tener mayores ingresos. Este será el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, además esta convencido que seguirá siendo un buen cliente y pagará sus cutas de manera puntual como lo ha hecho hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mayor cantidad de bebida y empezará a vender en grandes cantidades.
texts.en: Petin, 44, is a good and kind man who lives with his common-law wife and their three children, aged 19, 12 and 1, in his parents-in-law's home.  He and his wife go out every day to find a way to earn an income and provide the best they can for their family.  Petin's work is selling beverages.  He buys large volumes and puts them in his refrigerator to wait for customers.  He runs the business out of his home and has been doing this for three years.  Before he did not work and had to depend on his wife's income.  But now he has his own money and can contribute to the household economy.  He has good days and bad days as far as business is concerned, just like everyone.  On very hot days he can sell as many as 10 cases of beverages, but on rainy days maybe only one or two.  He wants to become a large distributor to increase his income.  This will be his third loan through the MFP.  He is very pleased with the financial support which he feels will help him get ahead in his business.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He plans to use the loan to buy larger volumes of beverages so he can sell more.

loans.use: To buy cases of beer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 22 and 28. All of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 42 years old and married with seven children.  She lives in Hioma, Uganda.  She deals in the buying and selling of maize, rice and groundnuts and has been in this business for six years. She faces the challenge of customers not paying on time and having inadequate capital to purchase stock.  Her business goal is to diversify the business and her personal goals are to educate her children and build them a permanent house.

Doreen needs a loan to buy maize, rice and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, rice and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida, 36, is married, and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a fortune-teller. Her husband is a construction foreman. Lida is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase construction materials to expand her husband’s business. 

In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business of construction work by purchasing more construction supplies in order to have enough material for mega costruction. This would allow her to build new house and support her child to study in higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru: Мансур женат и имеет двое детей. Жена занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города. Дети ходят в школу. Мансур является мастером и занимается производством окон и дверей. Он имеет четверых работников в качестве учеников, которых обучает своей профессии. В месяц обрабатывает 4-5 метр кубов доски. Он имеет хорошую репутацию среди клиентов и работников. Мансур хотел бы получить займ для покупки материалов и досок.
texts.en: Mansur is married and has two children. His wife is engaged in retail in the central town market. The children go to school. Mansur is a carpenter and has been manufacturing windows and doors. He has four employees as apprentices whom he teaches his profession. He processes four to five meter cubes  of boards a month. He has a good reputation among customers and employees. Mansur wants to get a loan for the purchase of materials and boards.

loans.use: to buy materials and boards.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Maricar has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Maricar has been a member of HSPFI. In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Fatou Kiné

texts.fr: Madame Fatou habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants âgés entre 8 et 26 ans. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10ans dans le secteur de la petite  restauration et vend du petit déjeuner et du  sandwich. En meme temps elle commercialise des tissus teintés, et des blousons. Elle a choisi son activité de commerce  pour épauler son mari a supporter les charges familiales.  Ce qui l’intéresse  c’est surtout l’aspect   lucratif de  cette activité. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destiné a renforcer son fond  de commerce  pour augmenter le stock  des produits qu’elle commercialise ( tissus teintés, blousons) d’une part, d’autre part elle compte renforcer son commerce de petit déjeuner  en achetant en quantité plus importante les denrées qu’elle utilise préparer ses repas. Son souhait  est d’augmenter ses bénéfices et d’améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou lives in Senegal. She is 43, married and the mother of 5 children aged between 8 and 26. She has been working as a restaurateur for over 10 years and sells breakfasts and sandwiches. She also sells dyed fabrics and jackets. She chose her business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and she is especially interested in the profitable aspects of her work.

Fatou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since November 2003. She is requesting a 300 000 franc loan so that she can strengthen her business activities by restocking on the products that she sells (dyed fabrics and jackets) and buying larger quantities of the ingredients that she uses to make her breakfasts. She would like to increase her profits and improve her family's social situation.

loans.use: to buy fabric, jackets and food products for her business.

loans.name: Oung's Group

texts.en: Oung’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Oung makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Raguf

texts.en:
Raguf was born in Lachin, Azerbaijan. He is single and lives with his parents in Sumgayit.  Raguf is a refugee from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin.

He is the only earner of his family. He began his own business 5 years ago when he opened his first counter.


Now he wants to open another counter for  food sale and needs kind support of Kiva lenders. He needs $500 for purchasing digital scales and hopes that his good business skills will enable him to repay the loan timely.

loans.use: To purchase digital scales and open food sale counter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rispa Wanjiku Njau intends to buy 10 bags of animal feeds and chemicals

loans.name: Test

texts.en: T.

loans.use: test

loans.name: Makhluga

texts.en:
This young girl is 27 years old, single. She lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village.  
Makhluga grows vines. She started this business 3 years ago.  Her vineyard is a small. 
Now she is applying for a loan of $725 to buy a vineyard. She wants to expand her vineyard and to get a bumper crop.

loans.use: To buy a vineyard

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.en:
My name is Maria and I make my living by making and selling minutas, a type of iced beverage made of shaved ice, fruits and artificial flavors. My business is located on a main street in my suburb, right across the street from a school. I also do washing and ironing for neighbors; this generates additional income that allows me to help my children stay in school. My intention is to buy sweets and other products that I can sell at the school. This loan will be used as working capital to help me stock my business and increase my income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Me llamo Maria y me dedico a vender minutas, es un helado a base de hielo raspado y se decora con frutas y sabores artificiales, mi negocio lo tengo ubicado en la calle principal de mi colonia, ya que en esta se encuentra una escuela y vendo frente a ella. Mis ingresos tambien los obtengo de lavar y aplanchar ropa de vecinos, de esta manera ayudo a mis hijos con sus estudios. Pienso comprar dulces y otros productos para vender en la escuela, es por eso que necesito capital de trabajo para surtir y acrecentar mis ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase ice, flavored syrups, fruits, honey and condensed milk

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Theary was married in 2005, and has one daughter. She started her business of selling grocery items at PREK Anh-chanh Market in 2005. Her husband has a business of pumping water into a tank and selling it from one village to another.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice previously. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase more grocery items for her stock.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her stock

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en: Marhamat K. worked as a cook for over 22 years in the  USSR. After its  collapse she was unemployed and her husband help her to rent premises for little cafe.They used all their home furniture( tables and chairs and kitchen dishes)for her cafe.Today her business is going well. Due to her abilities as excellent cook her cafe has attracted many clients. Currently her problems are shortage of dinnerwares,tables and chairs. She hopes that KIVA lenders will help her to solve this problem and she can develop her business.

loans.use: For purchasing dinnerware,tables and chairs for  her cafe.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheng D. is a widow with four children, one son and three daughters. Two of her children are married and living in different houses with their families. One of her daughters is working in a garment factory and her only son is doing farming with her. Pheng has been a farmer since 1979 and she has also been selling Cambodian snacks in her village since 2001. She and her family live along National Road number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.    

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now she is requesting another loan in the amount of $1,100. She will use this money for purchasing rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for a plowing fee.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more gas cylinders

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 35 years old and has been running his shop for two years, working alone six days a week. He is married with four children ranging in age from ten to four years. On his one day off, Henry is building a house for his family home.

Henry is asking for a loan to enable him to purchase more cosmetics, perfumes and also some food to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics, perfumes and also some food to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Maria Cristina's Group

texts.es:
Maribel, Cristina, and Dina have belonged to the Communal Bank “Paloma” for 1 year, 8 months, and 8 months, respectively.

Maribel has a live-in partner, she is 24 years old and has one daughter. Maribel sells clothes on credit to family and friends. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. She also sells food on some occasions.

Cristina is single and is 24 years old. She has a store where she sells meat, groceries, and vegetables. On some occasions she sells cosmetics through a catalog.

Dina also has a live-in partner, she is 37 years old and has 3 children. She sells food in a bus terminal. With the loan that she will obtain, Dina will buy a refrigerator.

Maribel, Cristina and Dina need loans of 600 soles ($230 US), 800 soles ($300 US), and 1000 soles ($370 US), money that will be invested in the purchase of jerseys, jackets, rice, sugar, milk, eggs, plates, spoons, and for the down payment on a refrigerator.

The dreams of Maribel, Cristina and Dina are to have stable businesses, to finish their higher education, and to open additional branches and other businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kaleigh Ruffner, Breanna Wong and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

Maribel, Cristina y Dina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Paloma hace 1 año, 8 meses, 8 meses respectivamente.

Maribel es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija, Maribel vende ropa a crédito a familiares y amigos, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima. Además Maribel en algunas ocasiones vende comida.

Por otro lado Cristina es soltera y tiene 24 años, Cristina tiene una bodega donde vende carne, abarrotes, verduras. En algunas ocasiones Cristina vende cosméticos por catálogo.

Mientras que Dina es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Dina vende comida en un puesto del terminal terrestre. Dina con el préstamo que obtendrá comprará su refrigeradora.

Maribel, Cristina y Dina necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 800 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, casacas, arroz, azúcar, leche, huevo, platos, cucharas y para la inicial de una refrigeradora.

Los sueños de Maribel, Cristina y Dina son tener un negocios estable, terminar sus estudios superiores, tener otra sucursal y otro negocio más.

loans.use: Maribel, Cristina and Dina need loans of 600 soles ($230 US), 800 soles ($300 US), and 1000 soles ($370 US), money that will be invested in the purchase of jerseys, jackets, rice, sugar, milk, eggs, plates, spoons, and for the down payment on a refrigerator.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S. and his wife, Mrs. Thary Noun, were married in 1986 and have four children; one son and three daughters. Three of their children are in school and one of their daughters works in garment factory. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Heng has been a village doctor for eleven years. His wife sells medicine at home. He is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for his family's use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.es:
Encarnacion has a bakery which she runs from her house in the zone of Las Lomas, in the city of La Paz. She works together with her husband. This is the second loan she has received from Impro, and she will use it to purchase flour, salt, sugar and other necessary ingredients. Her hard work and impeccable payment history makes her well qualified for this loan.

Encarnación tiene una panadería en su domicilio (zona D. Las Lomas, ladera oeste, ciudad D. La Paz) y trabaja con su esposo donD. realizan pan D. batalla y pan especial. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, por el incremento D. los productos en nuestra ciudad su capital se ha visto mermado, el crédito será destinado para la compra D. insumos (Harina, Sal, Azúcar, y otros). Su trabajo, responsabilidad e impecable historial la califican como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago D. las cuotas. Por lo que su acceso al crédito no se constituye un peligro.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To invest in the bakery she runs with her husband from their house.  She will purchase flour, salt, sugar and other necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Rosetta

texts.en: Rosetta E. sells sugar, tea, tomatoes, and other groceries. She is married and has one child. Her husband drives a taxi, but his income is not enough for full family support. Fortunately, demand for her goods is high, and so she is seeking additional capital to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Thi Bay

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Bay, 59 years old, has 3 grown-up children. Her husband is a retired army officer. In 2000, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed the first loan of 2,000,000VND (about 133USD) to start a business. After 8 years of borrowing, currently she has a beauty salon at home. Her business has been better over time, yielding substantial profit. Besides taking care of the salon, she also rears pigs and chickens to gain additional income. This time, she would like to borrow 625USD to purchase more tools for the salon. Her monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 266USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Bảy năm nay 59 tuổi, chồng chị là sỹ quan quân đội đã nghỉ hưu, gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành.Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương, vòng vốn đầu chị vay 2000000đ để đầu tư vào kinh doanh. Đến nay qua 8 năm sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả chị đã đầu tư mở được một cửa hàng trang điểm, làm tóc tại gia đình. Công việc kinh doanh của chị đang ngày càng thuận lợi và cho thu nhập cao. Ngoài thời gian làm việc tại cửa hàng chị cùng gia đình còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ đầu tư mua thêm dụng cụ để phục vụ cho cửa hàng. Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: investing in her beauty salon

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom P., 45, is a widow who lives in Kampong Chhnang province with her two children who both work at a local garment factory. She is a vegetable wholesaler who makes $2 per day in net income, while her children work at a garment factory and make a combined total of $160 per month, contributing to help support the household. Mom P. does not enjoy having her son work in the garment factory, though, and believes that there are better opportunities for him elsewhere. She has asked for a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a motortaxi service instead of working in the factory. Mom P.'s son and daughter are pictured above with the motorbike that she plans to purchase with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son

loans.name: Sununa's Group

texts.en:
Sununa N. is married with 8 children. Sununa also cares for over 15 orphans. She has run her Sebbi Metal Workshop for 14 years. The business is running smoothly and she now needs a loan from Kiva (through Pearl Microfinance) to buy more metal.

She makes doors, windows, gates, and anything else that comes out of the metal. She has a large customer base and income from her business because she has a free nature with people, there is a lot of construction work happening locally, and the metal shop has a good strategic location.

Sununa runs the Naalya lending group hand-in-hand with the treasurer Jameo N.. Jameo is a young businesswoman with a Fashion Designer store not far from from Sununa's metal shop. For Jameo, her shop sells good quality jeans, T-shirts, tops, shoes, and some jewelry. She says that this is her best season until January, and with the loan she has planned to stock her shop with fancy material that can bring in money quickly.

loans.use: To buy more metal for her workshop.

loans.name: Bahati's Group

texts.en:
Bahati S. has been selling firewood and charcoal in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works for twelve hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $30 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood and charcoal for her busienss and increase her sales and profit. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profits to get more food for her family and to reinvest in her business so that it can continue to grow.

Bahati is 27 years old, married, and has three children, aged 9 years, 6 years, and 3 months. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mkasi, Maina, and Khadija. Each has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood at greater quantities.

loans.name: Mrs. Mai Yum Sren Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of thirteen people, is located in Chrok Romeat village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Mrs. Mai Yum S. is the village bank president. She is a 27-year-old mother of two children; one attends the local school and the younger one is too young to work or study. She sells clothes in the local market. Her husband, Mr. M. Pleu, is a blacksmith. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fashionable clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Barbara

texts.es:
María es una laboriosa mujer de 57 años de edad, está separada desde hace muchos años. Tuvo 4 hijos con su ex-pareja y éstos actualmente tienen 32, 30, 26 y 24 años respectivamente. Los tres hijos mayores son comerciantes, ya se han independizado y han montado sus propios negocios, mientras que la última de sus hijos aún vive con ella y es quien le ayuda en el negocio.
María es propietaria de una despensa muy bien surtida que funciona en su casa propia, también tiene venta de carnes y embutidos de todo tipo.
La ubicación de su negocio es excelente, debido a que se encuentra en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad de Itá.
Ella comenta que desde muy pequeña se dedicó al negocio de las ventas de productos de todo tipo como ser: verduras y frutas que traía junto con su madre del mercado de Abasto de la ciudad capital para luego venderlos casa por casa por los barrios de la ciudad.
Posteriormente, y con mucho sacrificio, logró montar una pequeña despensa en su hogar que con el tiempo fue creciendo y hoy día es la mejor surtida del barrio.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio y convertirlo algún día en un gran supermercado. A la vez desea que dicho negocio quede algún día a cargo de su hija menor.
En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de más mercaderías como: harina, azúcar, arroz, fideo, yerba, aceite, pan, gasesosas, etc. debido a que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y aumentan considerablemente las ventas.
texts.en:
Mary is an industrious woman, age 57 and separated for many years. She had four children with her ex-partner, and they now are 32, 30, 26 and 24 years old respectively. The three oldest children are merchants, have already become independent, and have started their own businesses while the last of her children still lives with her and is the one who helps in the business. Maria is the owner of a well-stocked store that she runs in her own home. She also sells meats and sausages of all kinds. The location of her business is excellent, because it is in a strategic location in the city of Itá. She says that since she was very little she worked selling products of all kinds such as fruits and vegetables that she brought with her mother from the Abasto market in the capital city to sell house to house in the neighborhoods of her city . Subsequently, and with great sacrifice, she managed to set up a small store at home that eventually grew and today is the best-stocked in the neighborhood. She dreams of expanding her business and one day converting it into a large supermarket. At the same time she hopes that some day her youngest daughter will be in charge of the business. At this time she needs a credit to buy more goods such as flour, sugar, rice, noodles, tea, oil, bread, soft drinks, etc. because the end of the year holiday festivities are approaching and sales increase significantly.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, rice, noodles, tea, oil, bread, softdrinks, etc.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kodi

texts.id:
Diusia yang sudah tidak muda lagi apalagi setelah suaminya meninggal dunia Ni Ketut Kodi harus berjuang sendirian untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya.Anak pertama sudah menikah saat ini tinggal di kota. Anak yang kedua sudah mulai bekerja dan anak yang terakhir masih sekolah tingkat pertama. Untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya Ni Ketut Kodi menjalankan usaha berjualan baju dan celana  bekas yang sudah ditekuni sejak lama.

Untuk pinjaman yang dua kalinya Dari Yayasan DINARI. dana dipergunakan untuk menambah modal untuk menjalankan usahanya. Barang – barang bekas impor ini di dapat dari pelanggannya di kota Negara. Harga satu karung sekarang mencapai Rp. 800.000,- s/d Rp.1.000.000,- di sesuaikan dengan  mutu dari barangnya. Sebagai kegiatan sehari harinya Ni ketut Kodi harus menjajakan barang dagangannya dan menjual secara eceran kepada pelanggan yang ada di desa-desa yang jauh dari pasar. Untuk menempuh jarak yang jauh, Ni Ketut Kodi menggunakan sepeda motor tuanya. Dari hasil penjualan setiap hari Ni Ketut Kodi  memperoleh penghasilan bersih antara Rp. 20.000 s/d Rp. 50.000.
Dari usaha inilah Ni Ketut Kodi dapat mencukupi keperluan keluarganya dan dapat membiayai anak terakhirnya yang masih sekolah.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Kodi is a widow with three children. Her first child is already married and lives in the city. Her second child is already having a regular job while her third child is still in Junior High school. To make a living she sells 2nd hand clothing.

Ni Ketut is planning to take another loan from DINARI foundation. The loan money is to be used to add working capital in purchasing ex - imported 2nd hand clothing stuffs. She gets these stuffs from her regular supplier in Negara city for IDR 800 thousand to IDR 1 million per box (around USD 75 - USD 95) depending on the condition and the quality of the 2nd hand clothing items

Everyday Ni Ketut Kodi rides her old motor cycle to sell her merchandise in the surrounding villages. In one day work she usually earns a net profit of IDR 20 to 50 thousand (around USD 2 to 5). With this she is able to make a living and support her third child.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Mariama Issa

texts.fr: Mariama Issa B. est une veuve qui a la charge familiale et scolaire de ses enfants. Elle veut poursuivre son activité de vente de divers produits alimentaires au marché où elle tient un étal. Elle projette ainsi d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Issa B. is a widow who is responsible for the family and her children’s schooling. She wants to continue with her work selling various food items at the marketplace, where she has a stall. Thus, she plans on improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pursue her business selling various food items at the marketplace

loans.name: Djiguiya (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Dar Salam 2 de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage.
Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente  de friperie (articles usagers habits et chaussures). Elles sont très sollicitées dans ce domaine. 
Afin de palier la rupture de stocks qui fait l’objet de  baisse de clientèle, le groupe Djiguiya a trouvé la solution de son problème en intégrant l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles de friperie en gros et une quantité importante de chaussures d’occasion à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Ces habits et chaussures d’occasion  sont vendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Koutiala et  en ambulant dans les quartiers de la ville. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 55 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus telle que la vente de sacs de friperie.
texts.en:
The eight women of the group Djiguiya are all married and on average 34 years old with 4 children, and live in large traditional extended families in the Dar Salam 2 district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They met each other as neighbours. They are all engaged in almost the same business selling second-hand clothing (used clothes and shoes). They are highly sought after in this regard. In order to overcome the stock shortages which cause a decrease in their clientele, the Djiguiya group found the solution to their problem by joining the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are seeking their first solidarity (group) loan. They intend to use this loan to buy bales of used clothing in bulk and a sizable quantity of second-hand shoes in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). These second-hand clothes and shoes are sold at retail, in cash and on credit, at the market in Koutiala and door-to-door in the city's districts. They each hope to realize an average profit of 55,000 FCFA during this loan cycle, which will be used to repay the loan and to meet the needs of their extended families, with the rest being invested in their businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their business by taking up other revenue-generating activities such as the sale of second-hand bags.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing and shoes

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with one child. He owns a retail business selling various construction materials. He has been in this business for 6 years and has been able to develop it to have three sales locations at the market. Sergei always tries to have a large assortment of goods as this is the key factor that increases his sales. He is a hard working and honest person. His clients value his honesty and come back for repeated purchases.

Sergei would like to receive a loan of UAH 13,000 to enlarge his inventory. He would spend additional income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Poshi

texts.en:
Poshi has owned a small beauty salon in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to tuwe wakweli group loan (Group code 2101).  She works at her business 12 hours a day and currently earns an average monthly profit of $225. 


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy a hair dryer and other items for her salon. She is hoping that through this loan, she will be able to grow her business and her profit will increase so that she can pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.  


Poshi is married, and has two children, ages 18 and 4. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and other items for her business.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Huanca.
Lorenza es casada, tiene 53 años y 11 hijos, Lorenza tiene un puesto en el mercado chorro en donD. venD. papa, arvejas. Además Lorenza viaja a las ferias en donD. compra animales menores y lo venD. en el camal.
Lorenza necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. oveja y cerdos.
Los sueños D. Lorenza son comprar una casa, tener casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Señor D. Huanca (Our Father of Huanca) Village Bank. She is 53, married, and has 11 children. She has a stand at the Chorro market, where she sells potatoes and peas. She also travels to the fairs to buy young animals, which she sells to the slaughterhouse. Lorenza is requesting a loan of 1000 soles which she plans to invest in sheep and pigs. Her dreams incluD. purchasing a home, and having her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr: PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES ,elle capitalise cinq annees d'experience.elle vend des tissus et voudraitaugmenter sa capacite de financement.
texts.en:
As a member for several years, she can count on her five years of experience. She sells cloth and would like to grow her capacity for financing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: growing her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. has been raising pigs for several years. She is 34 years old and the mother of six children. Her husband, Hernane P. Jr., is a farmer. They started their piggery business with only two piglets. Aside form pigs, the couple also grows rice. At present, they have one sow and nine piglets.

Mary Jane would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed. The feed is quite expensive. She needs additional resource to raise more pigs.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage, as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Tope

texts.en:
Tope sells ice fish to her customers in the market. She is 30 years old and married with two children. They live in Lagos State, Nigeria. Tope is very happy with her business. She does not sell on credit but her customers pay in cash when they purchase her ice fish. Tope hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more ice fish to sell. 
Tope is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell

loans.name: Junaidullo

texts.ru: Боев Чунайдулло 1981 года рождения. Женат, имеет 2-х детей. Он занимается продажей бытовыми товарами. Он торгует в Центральном рынке  города Вахдат. Чунайдулло  закупает товар в городе Душанбе из оптового рынка «Корвон». Он ездит за товаром 3 раз в месяц. В этом бизнесе у него 5 лет опыта. Он хочет с помощью Кива получить займ в сумме 10000 сомони, и увеличить свой оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Junaidullo B. was born in 1981. He is married and has two children and is engaged in the sale of household goods. He trades them in the central market of the city of Vahdat. Junaidullo buys the goods in bulk in the city of Dushanbe from the wholesale market "Korvon". He travels here three times a month for goods, and he has had 5 years of experience in this business. He hopes with the help of Kiva he will obtain a loan in the sum of 10,000 TJS (2,300$), and increase his revenue.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Household Goods

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita S. is a 70 year old woman who lived in Hamtic, Antique with her 69 year old husband and three remaining unmarried children ranging in age from 18 to 14. Lolita dreamed of giving her children a better education. However, she failed because she had no opportunity at the time of having loan for a business capital.

When Lolita became a member of ASHI in 2007, her hopes for the two children that are still studying were rekindled. She started up a business raising and selling livestock. After years of loaning, her business eventually grew and now she wishes to buy a carabao and another pig to raise and sell in a given period of time. She wishes to raise a greater variety of livestock someday so that she can also help her children send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: A carabao and piglet to raise

loans.name: Eab

texts.en:
Eab M., age 73, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in the city of Phnom Penh. To make a living, she rents part of her house to other people, provides public phone services, and sells phone cards in front of house, typically earning $5 per day. The family is also assisted by her son, who is currently employed as a motorcycle repairman with an income of $4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This has resulted in a difficult economic year for much of the country, and M. is aM. those affected, as the country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, M. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $600 to exapnd her business to include such things as groceries, cigarettes, and additional phone cards. By doing this, she believes that she will be able to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her store's offerings

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus tres hijos de 11, 9 y 6 años de edad en el Asentamiento Humano Saul Cantoral, en los alrededores de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace 15 años empezó a vender comida al paso en los exteriores del Terminal Terrestre de la ciudad de Chiclayo y durante este tiempo se ha apoyado en este negocio para sacar adelante a su familia, su labor empieza desde muy temprano hasta la tarde, luego compra los insumos para preparar los platos del día siguiente; usualmente vende cebiche, papa rellena y tortas de choclo, su carisma y la buena sazón con la que prepara sus platos  le han valido para mantener a su clientela durante todo este tiempo.

Ella es a la vez padre y madre para sus menores hijos quienes estudian en un colegio estatal cercano al lugar en donde viven, su más grande anhelo es poder asegurarles en el futuro algún tipo de educación superior con la cual se puedan ganar la vida, además también desea terminar de construir su casa ya que aún esta hecha de adobe, un material rustico de barro usado para construir viviendas, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por tercera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que le permitan ampliar su negocio y así lograr sus objetivos.

Jessica ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus cuotas por lo que es considerada como una cliente excelente, los vecinos de su comunidad la consideran una madre luchadora y ejemplar.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 37 year old single mother. She lives with her three children, ages 11, 9, and 6. They live in Asentamiento Humano Saul Cantoral in the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo. Fifteen years ago she started selling food dishes on the outside of the bus depot of the city of Chiclayo. During this time she has been supported in this business in order to get her family ahead. Her work starts very early and goes until the afternoon. Then she buys the supplies to prepare her dishes for the following day. She usually sells “ceviche” (a popular local fish dish), “papa rellena” (stuffed potato), and “tortas de choclo” (a dish made with ground corn). Her charisma and the good seasoning she uses to prepare her dishes have served to maintain her customers during all of this time. She is father and mother at the same time to her minor children. They go to a state school near the place where they live. Her biggest wish is to be able assure them in the future of some type of advanced education, which they can use to earn a living. She also wishes to finish building her house because it is still made of adobe, a material made of mud used to build houses. That is why she is asking the Institution for a loan for the third time. She is asking for 2,500 PEN, which will allow her to expand her business and, therefore, achieve her objectives. Jessica has worked with us previously, and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments. She is, therefore, considered an excellent client. Her neighbors in the community consider her a determined and exemplary mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare and sell food

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en:
Abdumanon is a hardworking person and he has been providing taxi services for two years. He is 52 years old and the father of three children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. The most important thing to him is that his children enter university and successfully finish it, so that they will be professionals and have a better future. Abdumanon wishes to keep his taxi business growing and for this he needs to have tools in good working order. Abdumanon needs to buy spare parts and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to his work, he has been able to stabilize their quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi

loans.name: Jhasmin Noelia

texts.en:
Jhasmin is 19 years old, single, and lives with her mother. She works as a dairy farmer, selling the milk that her cows produce. She lives in the municipality of Asiru Marca, in the Cercado Province of the Cochabamba Department of Bolivia.

With this loan from CIDRE, Jhasmin will purchase more fodder for her livestock, such as soy and cattle feed. She believes that this loan will help her provide more food for her livestock so that they can become better producers of milk.

Jhasmin is studying to become a professional, and she is paying for her education with the income she gets from selling her cows' milk.

loans.use: To purchase fodder for her cows

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en:
Pacifique N. is 33 years old, married with 5 children aged between 5 and 13 years. Pacifique lives in the northern province of Rwanda where she has owned a business since 2005. Pacifique's shop is open from 9AM to 6PM every day. Pacifique is now requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing a variety of goods.

Through accessing this loan, Pacifique hopes to attract additional customers. If she is successful in her business, she will be able to pay school fees for her children. In addition, she hopes to help her community by bringing more high quality goods closer to them at the cheapest price.

loans.use: Additional Inventory

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
Madame Blandine Koné est une femme mariée de 28 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Blandine Koné a abandonné l’école dès son jeune âge pour des raisons sociales. Elle a tenté pendant des années plusieurs activités notamment l’achat et la vente de légumes, mais sans réussite.
C’est ainsi qu’elle décida d’apprendre auprès de son ami, l’achat vente des articles d’alimentation. Après 3 années d’expérience, elle arrive à bien maitriser cette activité, qu’elle exerce dans une boutique  située dans son  quartier de résidence, qui est d’accès facile. 
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers une cliente de cette institution, elle décida de collaborer avec dernière avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel pour acheter, une grande quantité d’articles pour son alimentation. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et des fois à Bougouni et effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices elle envisage acheter un congélateur pour la conservation de certains articles.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blandine Koné is a 28 year old married woman, mother of two children. She lives with her husband and her children in the neighborhood of Torakabougou in the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). Blandine Koné left school at an early age for social reasons. For years she tried several activities, particularly the purchase and sale of vegetables, but without success. Thus, she decided to learn from her friend how to sell various foodstuffs. With three years of experience, she manages her business well. She exercises her activity in a shop located in her neighborhood, which is easily accessible. She learned about Soro Yiriwaso from a customer of this institution. She decided to work with them, and this is her first individual loan that she will use to buy a large quantity of goods for her grocery store. She buys her supplies in Bamako and sometimes in Bougoni. She sells retail for cash or on credit to diverse and varied customers. The turnover in her business is very high and she hopes to make a monthly profit of 50, 000 FCFA. With the profit she plans to buy a freezer for the preservation of some goods.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food items.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina L. es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a tres hijos de diferentes edades y quienes dar lo mejor. 
Doña Alejandrina desea construir un cuarto de material para que sea mas duradero ya que será para su niños. 
Pero tiene un problema que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagarle a la persona que le realizara la mejora. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo como trabajadora de una fabrica de electrónicos en le departamento de producción. Ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su hija la señorita Idalia Ixtapan L., que trabaja en una agencia aduanal en el departamento de sistemas.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandrina L. is a single mother who is responsible for three children of different ages. She wants to provide them with the best.

Doña Alejandrina wishes to build a room of durable materials since it will be used by her children. Her problem is that she does not have the necessary funds to pay someone to undertake this project. For this reason, she is requesting a loan and plans to repay it with the income she earns as a factory worker for an electronics company. The family expenses will be covered by her daughter, Srta. Idalia Ixtapan L., who works in the systems department of a customs agency.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor & materials to have a room built

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El señor Héctor T.  vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Héctor es chofer asalariado en el trasporte público, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de cocina en su vivienda.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Héctor T. lives with his parents in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. He is a salaried public transport driver, with a stable income. He is requesting a loan to build a kitchen in his home. This is the 4th time that he has requested a loan, and he has already been approved for the loan based on a socioeconomic analysis.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a kitchen in his home

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is married, has five children and is 48 years old. She is a focused, hard-working woman who puts in long hours trying to keep her business profitable. She is a LAPO client because of our commitment to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Regina makes a living selling sarongs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time, and has applied for a loan for 80,000 NGN to buy more sarongs to sell. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Gina's Group

texts.en:
Gina M. is from the village of Libag Norte, Tuguegarao City. She is 39 years old. Gina is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gina M.'s group.

Gina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling shoes

loans.name: Efren's Group

texts.en: Efren T. Sr. is from the village of Barangcuag, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 57 years old and is the group leader of a eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Efren is married and has four adult children. He owns and operates a furniture business. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Efren joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his seventh from ASKI. Efren plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel H. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 51 years old. Noel is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Noel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs and chicken for sale. Noel has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Noel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Mutungo South Namutebi Resty Group

texts.en:
N. Resty is a happy business lady. She is twenty-four, married and has one child who goes to school. She has another dependent who also goes to school. 

She owns a fridge and sells soft drinks such as sodas, passion fruit drinks and mineral water. She has been running her business for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase soft drinks to sell. She is a determined, hardworking business lady whose future plan is to open a shop.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Tansito's Group

texts.es: Este pequeño grupo de Mujeres  luchadoras para el  bien  comun de ellas y para su familia an  estado trabajando para la superaciòn en la compra y venta de ropa tipica  ya que sus ansestro les enseñaron a realizar este tipo de trabajao y lo cual ellas se handedicado durante 9 años atras y estan comercializando en varias lugares de Guatemala con este producto de ropa tipica y van en lugar en lugar para ganar el pan de cada dia y ellas relatan que estan llevando màs mercaderia surtida para combatir la competencia pero les hace falta capital de trabajo y por lo cual acuden a la Asociaciòn de ASDIR para apollarlas en sus capitales y asi prosperar este año y darles lo mejor a sus familias.-
texts.en:
This small group of women is struggling for the common good of themselves and their families. They have been working to succeed in the business of buying and selling traditional Guatemalan clothing. Their parents taught them to do this kind of work, which they have been carrying out for 9 years. They sell this product of traditional clothing in various locations in Guatemala, going from place to place to earn their daily bread. They tell us that they are stocking more merchandise to sell in order to compete in the market, but they lack working capital and for this reason they came to the Asociaciòn ASDIR to support them with capital so that they can prosper this year and give the best for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy traditional Guatemalan clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and ties to sell

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 40 años D. edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, vive junto a su familia en el anexo San Carlos, perteneciente al caserío Arbolsol, una zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope, sus habitantes tienen como principales actividades productivas son L. agricultura y L. crianza D. animales. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales desD. hace diez años. El cría chivos, cerdos y aves D. corral en algunos corrales instalados en L. parte exterior D. su domicilio, cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen punto D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan L. zona y eventualmente también los venD. en el mercado del pueblo D. Mórrope. Este negocio es L. única fuente D. ingresos con L. que cuenta su familia por lo que trata D. mantenerlo D. L. mejor manera posible, además L. comercialización D. animales es un negocio con bastante demanda en L. zona.

Santiago se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en L. compra D. alimento balanceado para hacer que sus animales sean D. mejor calidad y tengan una buena acogida por parte D. sus compradores.

Santiago es un padre D. familia muy trabajador y que gusta mucho D. lo que hace. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Santiago is 40 years old, he is married and has five children. He lives with his family in the San Carlos annex of the Arbolsol homestead which is a rural zone in the district of Morrope. The principal productive activities of the population are farming and raising animals. It is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Santiago has dedicated himself to raising and selling animals for ten years. He raises goats, pigs and poultry in pens installed outsiD. of his home. When his animals have reached a point in their development, he sells them to merchants that visit that area and eventually he also sells them at the market in Morrope. This business is the only source of income for his family which is why he tries to maintain it in the best possible way. The commercialization of animals is a business with high demand in this area. Santiago is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to purchase balanced feed so that his animals are of better quality and will be better received by his buyers. Santiago is a hardworking parent and he loves what he does. His greatest hope is to proviD. a better quality of life for his family. He has previously worked with this partner and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in paying his quotas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for his livestock business.

location.town: Anexo San Carlos - Arbolsol - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Mirtha Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha del Socorro D. V., tiene la edad de 43 años habita con  su compañero de vida en el Barrio la Primavera de Managua, ellos tienen 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y un menor de 10 añitos, el señor labora como cargador, brindando a un aporte económico a los gastos diarios, la señor posee una pulpería, siendo este el principal ingreso familiar.

La variación de precio de los productos no le ha permitido en varias ocasiones buenas utilidades, que favorezcan a  su estilo de vida, fue con la ayuda de su familia y marido que económicamente le apoyaron y con un financiamiento, abrió su negocio hace ya 7 años, los planes del negocio, es la venta de ropa y calzado de segunda mano, debido a que la demanda de estos productos hoy en día en Nicaragua es alta, es por tal razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos para su negocio, una inversión de esta magnitud permitiría un aumento en las ventas, favoreciendo sus niveles de vida y la satisfacción de brindarle a sus hijos mejores condiciones socio-económicas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirtha del Socorro is 43 years old and lives with her life companion in the Primavera (Spring) barrio of Managua. They have 3 children, of whom 2 are adult and 1 is a minor, aged 10. Her companion works as a porter, helping with their daily expenses. Mirtha has a general store which is the principal source of family income. Variations in product prices have not permitted good profits, on various occasions, and this has harmed their standard of living. In the past, aid has come from her family and her husband. With a loan, she opened her store some 7 years ago. Plans for her used-clothing and used-shoes store resulted from the fact that demand for these items remains high in Nicaragua. That's why she is requesting a loan for purchasing a greater inventory of products for her store. An investment of this magnitude should permit an increase in sales, elevating their standard of living, and offering the satisfaction of better socioeconomic conditions for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE TO SUPPLY HER 2ND-HAND STORE

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa B. is from the village of Minongan, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 42 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonisa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonisa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2006, Leonisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leonisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Leonisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 22 year old single man from Lebanon. Since 2006, he has been working in the field of industry. He is specialized in installing and repairing tiles, as well as polishing them. This type of business is very common in Lebanon. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues which didn't allow him to purchase all the needed tools for his work. Youssef is known for his good work and is proud of his experience. 

Today, for the first time, Youssef is asking for a loan to purchase a generator for his business, since in lebabon there is a lot of electricity shut downs. If he doesn't have a generator, it will stop him from working and, therefore, it will delay his work and his clients will be unsatisfied. Therefore, he hopes that it will help him continue to grow and enhance his business in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase a generator for his business.

loans.name: Phorch

texts.en: Mrs. Phorch L. is a 38-year-old farmer who lives in Pongro village, Takeo province. She owns four hectares of land to cultivate rice and she works very hard to support her children. Mrs. Phorch L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine, fertilizer and rice seed to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Paolo Sen, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family and also helps his wife farm. The couple has three children; one is construction worker, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and one attends the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Nerla

texts.en:
Nerla C. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has five adult children. Nerla owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nerla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

Nerla joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Nerla has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nerla is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nerla from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester T. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Ester is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Ester owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products such as ready-to-wear clothing and also selling viands  in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old. She is a married mother of six children who are now aged between 7 and 21. Four of the children attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for over 20 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, milk, bananas, pineapples, millet, tea leaves and beans, which she sells at both the Kenya Tea Development Authority and at the local market.

Grace has requested this second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her cereal business. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to continue educating her children and she will be able to provide enough milk and food for the family. 

In five years time, she plans to expand her cereal business and open at least one cereal store and also buy a posho mill.

Her major challenges have been a poor transport system and the fluctuating prices of cereals. She appreciates how far Juhudi has improved them.

loans.use: To expand her cereals business

loans.name: Koken Ene

texts.en:
Koken Ene M. is 50 years old. She is married to Oloshorua M. and she is a mother of two children.

She is a farmer, and has been farming her own piece of land for the last seven years. She grows wheat, and has been quite successful at this due to good climatic condition in her area.

She learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to spend on preparing the land for wheat planting. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land.

Her future dream is to plough a bigger piece of land and increase her wheat production.

She is a hard-working woman and very determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Begaiym

texts.en:
Begaiym U. is the leader of the group; she is 38. She is a citizen of Kyrgyz Republic and lives in Kant city. She, together with her spouse, is raising three sons; two of them are schoolboys and the youngest one lives with the grandparents. Seven years ago, family friends had left for Russia to earn additionally money, while departing they had left some part of their business. Since then, Begaiym, together with her husband, run their own businesses: they sell different sorts of fish in the local market. Her husband works as smoked fish supplier round the region Yssyk-Ata, and she herself makes money additionally by working as a nurse in Tuz village. The average profit comes to 15,000 soms per month. Out of total earnings they had a possibility to make house repairs, to obtain a car, household appliances, and to give education to their children.

The family intends to obtain several kilograms of smoked and fresh fish for resale. For this purpose, they want to get a loan. For the rest money, they are planning to purchase necessary household appliances. In the future, the couple wants to give birth to a daughter, to give a good upbringing to their sons and to at last obtain a house. 

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Umary Isa

texts.en:
B. Isa Umary is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. For the last two years, he has made a living by selling phone accessories.        

To help expand his business, Umary has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more accessories to sell to his customers. He plans to use the income made possible by this loan to support his family, mostly by buying food. In the future, he hopes to open additional stores where he can sell his wares.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories to sell to his customers

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna J. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Lorna is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling Filipino delicacies viands like "dinuguan" and "pancit guisado" in the local community. She is also buying and selling instant noodles and bananas. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio D. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 39 years old. Dionesio is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Dionesio owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and selling fish like milkfish, mackerel and also shrimps in the local community. Dionesio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dionesio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new tools for the maintenance of the boat. Dionesio is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Dionesio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert B. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. He is 37 years old. Albert is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Albert owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business come from making and selling pork & chicken barbecue, hot dog kebabs, & chicken intestine kebab in the local community. Albert has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Albert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Albert is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Albert from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
