Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: La Sra. Elva llego a nuestra oficina con la intención de solicitar un  préstamo en grupo, pero al final se desanimaron y sacaron con otra persona y se garantizaron ambas, La Sra.  Elva vive en el Barrio los claveles en donde tiene su casita propia en la que vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, cuenta con una tiendita de barrio en su mismo domicilio y por las noches vende cena (comida), con su tiendita viene trabajando desde hace 3 años y la venta de comida desde hace 1 año en la cual le esta yendo bien ya que ella esta sacando su segundo préstamo en nuestra institución, el dinero solicitado será para aumentar su capital (surtir mas su tienda ), ya que tiene mucha demanda, y la Sra. manifestó  "agradezco a la institución por haber confiado en mi persona.
texts.en:
Elva approached our office with the intention of requesting a group loan.  However, in the end they were discouraged and decided instead for a joint loan with just one other person; they act as each other’s guarantor.

Elva lives in Los Claveles neighborhood where she has her own home and lives with her husband and four children.  Elva has a small neighborhood store in her home and in the evenings she sells dinners (meals).  She has been working in her store for 3 years and has been selling meals for 1 year.  Everything is going well for her in her business since she is taking out her second loan with our institution.  The money she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital (to better stock her store) since she has a lot of demand.  She says “I am grateful to the institution for having put their trust in me”.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace años atrás a estado trabajando en diferentes actividades una de ellas fue la venta de ropa le generaba ingresos estables para mantener a su familia pero hace dos meses atrás decidió cambiar de actividad económica en la venta de plásticos. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas llamada Fortín de Guayaquil está trabajando hace dos meses desde las 07h00am hasta las 17h00pm vendiendo plásticos de todo tipo a diferentes tiendas. Actualmente le ayudan dos personas repartiendo los plásticos. Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo plástico y otra parte dirigirla en el mejoramiento de vivienda comprando cemento, bloques. 

En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y que su hijo termine sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Mariana is 37 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has been working in a number of different business activities for many years.  One of her businesses was selling clothes.  This made a stable income for supporting her family but two months ago she decided to change her business activity and start selling plastics.

Mariana lives in a peri-urban area with dirt roads and hills called Fortín de Guayaquil.  For two months she has been working from 7.00am to 5.00pm selling all kinds of plastics to different stores.  She currently has two people helping her to deliver the plastics.  To continue in her work she would like to use part of her loan to buy plastic and the other part to improve her home, buying cement and blocks.

In the future, Mariana would like to continue in her business and see her son successfully complete his studies.

loans.use: To buy plastics.  To buy blocks and cement.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es: Estefania, de 62 años, enviudo hace 6 años, pero a pesar de ello, ella nunca decayó y siguió adelante en compañía de sus 4 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 3 de ellos: José, de 34, Andrea, de 33 y Jorge, de 22, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). En Pampa del Carmen, donde se ubica el restaurante de Estefania, los platos exquisitos que prepara, son el deleite de todos los pobladores de su localidad; según menciona en temporadas turísticas, y fechas importantes del país, recibe mucha clientela, tanto así que hay fechas que no se abastece. Ahora Estefania, recibe el apoyo de sus hijos con los cuales pudo abrir una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, y para más adelante sueña con convertirlo en un minimercado. Es la décima vez que trabaja con MFP, y agradece el apoyo recibido por parte de su banco comunal, y a todas las personas que hacen posible la obtención del préstamo. De obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para surtir su tienda de comestibles, sobre todo en está época de año nuevo, que la demanda es mayor.
texts.en: Estefania, age 62, has been a widow for 6 years; despite this, she has never waned and has kept seeing her 4 children, of whom only 3 live with her in their own home in the city of La Merced (in the central peruvian forest): Jose, age 34, Andrea, age 33, and Jorge, age 22. In Pampa del Carmen, where Estefania's restaurant is located, the exquisite dishes that she prepares are the delight of all the townspeople. She says that she has many customers during the tourist season and on important dates for the country. There are also times when she does not have many customers. Now, with her children's support, she and her children are opening a food store, where she sells basic staples. In the future she hopes to convert it into a minimarket. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the support of her community bank, and to all of the people who are making it possible for her to obtain this loan. When she obtains this loan, she will invest in the purchase of items to stock her food store, as the demand is greater in the new year.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her store.

loans.name: Luisana Aracelli

texts.es:
Luisana Aracelli D. L. O. tiene 28 años D. edad, Vive en Unión Libre junto a su compañero y a sus hijos. En el Cantón Ventanas Provincia D. los ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros D. la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas D. ciclo corto siembra D. maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luisana Aracelli se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra D. maíz, arroz, cacao desD. hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  venD. en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra D. insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo D. maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprarse una casa.

Le gusta pasar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Luisana Aracelli D. L. O. is 28 years old and she lives with her common-law partner and their children. They live in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. They have 4 children. 

The communal bank named "Jesus Loves Us" is located in the community of Los Amarillos in the city of Ventanas. This group is dedicated to short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, and beans. They have practiced this business for a long time.

Luisiana Aracelli is an agriculturist who has been sowing corn, rice, and cocoa for the past 5 years. With this loan she will have the financial support to proviD. for her needs, and to face challenges, such as plagues, disease, and the changing weather. Her dream is to buy a house.

She enjoys spending time with her children.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yaem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yaem P. lives in Phngeas village in Takeo province and she was born in 1983. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family.

She has a problem with the rice field, because it is infertile. So, to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Yaem P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, and to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for transportation. Her husband, Mr. Thou Nob, is a duck breeder who is able to earn some money from selling duck eggs to support his family. The couple is raising two children who are all too young to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María D. es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en la comunidad  Corazón de Jesús en la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es admirado por ser el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

La Señora. María tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 23, 13 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven  independientes, su hija de 13 años ayuda en la casa y estudia a distancia, su hijo de 12 años por falta de recursos económicos no pudo ingresar al colegio. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se ocupa de los quehaceres de su hogar en donde se dedica a la agricultura, ella siembra hortalizas y cría  animales como: cuyes y pollos los que vende en la ciudad de Cuenca o en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de mas pollos para continuar en esta actividad. Su meta es llegar a tener un criadero de pollos más grande.
texts.en:
María D. is a member of the Corazones de Turi ("Turi Hearts") community bank. She lives in the Corazón de Jesús community in the parish of Turi. The place is admired for being the viewpoint of the city, and its people work in trade, animal husbandry and agriculture. 

María is 47 years old and married with four children, aged 26, 23, 13 and 12 years old. Her two eldest children are married and live independently. Her 13 year old daughter helps at home and is distance learning. Her 12 year old son could not start secondary school due to their lack of funds. Her husband works as a builder and with both their effort they have managed to build their own home.

María takes care of the household chores and works in agriculture. She grows vegetables and raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells in the city of Cuenca or in her community. 

This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank, and she plans to invest it in the purchase of more chickens to continue her business. Her goal is to have a bigger chicken farm.

loans.use: Buy chickens.

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Norma R. is from the village of Disimuray Cauayan City, Isabela.  She is 36 years old.  Norma is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Norma is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Norma owns and operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Norma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Norma from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Stenely

texts.en:
Stenely E. is from the village of Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 55 years old. Stenely is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Stenely owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Stenely has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised pigs.

In 2008, Stenely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stenely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. The previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Stenely is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Stenely from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Norng

texts.en:
Mr. Norng is a married man who was born in 1986. He and his wife, Mrs. Sarun, have two children, both of whom are too young to work or study. To earn a living, he works as a fisherman. In addition, he is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land; on his land, he grows rice, some of which he sells to local customers, and the rest of which he keeps to feed his family. His wife, meanwhile, owns a general store in the local village, where she sells groceries to generate additional profits to support their family.

Mr. Norng explains that he has been experiencing problems with his rice field because it is not particularly fertile at this time. As a result, Mr. Norng is applying for a loan in the amount of $500 to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticides

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora C. lives in Samtredia District, in the village of Dabla Gomi. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband, two sons, and her daughter-in-law. A couple of weeks ago, she became a grandmother and now they have an infant boy in the home. 

Eleonora’s sons are in military service. Eleonora and her husband are heading the family agricultural business: a small dairy farm, which consists of four milk cows. The end-product – 20 kg of traditional Georgian cheese is sold on the market. They also have a plot of the land where maize is grown. From the harvested 6 tons of maize only 600 kg is sold and the rest is used in the farm. Also the family owns a lemon garden, which gives them 500 kg of lemon per year. These are sold locally. Along the above-mentioned, Eleonora had 30 bee-hives with bee colonies. 24 colonies were destroyed because of unfavorable weather conditions last year. Now only six bee colonies are left.

The requested credit will be used for further development of their farm, in particular – 50% of the credit will be used for purchasing 10 new bee colonies. The rest will be used for cultivation of the land and purchasing 250 chickens. The chickens will be sold in a couple of months at double the price. 

After this investment the income of the family will significantly increase. Eleonora hopes that they will be able to put aside some savings and purchase a car for the family.

loans.use: tu purchase bee colonies, fuel for tractor and chickens for poultry business.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora Flor De María, es socia del banco comunal Las Dalilas del Distrito yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos que todavía están a su cargo.
Lleva 5 años dedicada a la venta de bebidas, el mismo tiempo que lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos, su negocio esta ayudándole a conseguir cosas que antes eran imposibles como poder comprar algunas comodidades para su hogar.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 comprará:  15 cajas de cerveza, 10 cajas de gaseosa, 3 paquetes de agua  sin gas, 3 paquetes de agua con gas.
Su esposo le ayuda con la atención por las noches, porque durante el dio trabaja manejando moto car, dinero que también es bienvenido a su hogar.
Los dos trabajando han podido ir comprando algunas cosas que les faltaba y que eran bien necesarios en su hogar.
texts.en:
Flor De María is a member of the 'Las Dalilas' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children still in her care.

Flor has been selling drinks for five years.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the same amount of time.  Her business is helping her to achieve things that were impossible in the past such as being able to buy some comforts for her home.

Flor will use her new loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles to buy 15 crates of beer, 10 crates of soda, 3 packets of still water and 3 packets of fizzy water.

Flor's husband helps her to serve in her business in the evenings because during the day he works driving a car, making money which is also welcome in their household.

Through their work, Flor and her husband have been able to buy some things that they were lacking before and which were really necessary for their home.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer and water

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores E. is 48 years old and married with six children.

Dolores work hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like sardines, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Dolores has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Otgonzaya

texts.en:
Otgonzaya is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver who manages a taxi service in their town. Her older daughter goes to a local secondary school. 

Otgonzaya manages a beauty product trading business at a rented stall at a trading center called Minj. Since she started her business, it has developed and flourished. With her earning she pays the tuition fee of her children and buys all the necessities of their family. 

She is a kind woman who is planning to expand her business in the future. She says, "I want to have one more stall in order to increase my sales channels." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more products and to rent one more stall.

loans.use: To purchase more products and expand her business.

loans.name: Bayardo Ines

texts.es: Bayardo Ines se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en su triciclo. Es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. El cliente es muy reconocido por el trabajo que realiza, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado obtener su medio de vida. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de llantas, repuestos nuevos, tapizar asientos entre otras cosas.  Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Bayardo Ines has a tricycle transportation service.  He is very responsible and enjoys his work, so this is the first time he is requesting a loan.  Although the work has a good reputation, he does not have sufficient capital, despite the fact that over time he has been able to make a living.

He plans to use the loan to buy tires, new repair parts and seat upholstery, among other things.

loans.use: To buy tires, new repair parts and seat upholstery, among other things.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa D. 48 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Thalia D. 14 y Arles D. 10 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. La tienda D. repuestos, reparaciones y mantenimiento D. motocarros D. Rosa, es una D. las más conocidas D. la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene muchos clientes, ya que el trabajo que realiza es muy bueno y D. mucha calidad, lo cual le ha hecho muy buena fama y que sus clientes la recomienden a otras personas. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es reparar y dejar todo como nuevo, sin embargo el tener que conseguir los repuestos le resulta difícil o si los encuentran tiene un precio muy alto. Espera con el tiempo que su negocio se desarrolle e instalar un taller D. mecánica. Este será su décimo crédito con MFP, es muy conciente D. que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para no perjudicar a las socias D. su banco comunal, en donD. es muy querido por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más repuestos para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her two beloved children: 14 year-old Thalia and 10 year-old Arles, who she would like to proviD. with a better quality of life.

Rosa's business is a store where she sells spare parts.  She also offers car repairs and servicing.  Hers is one of the most well-known businesses of this type in the city of Pucallpa.  She has many customers since the work that she carries out is of very good quality.  This has given her a very good reputation and her customers recommend her to other people.  What she most enjoys about her work is repairing vehicles and leaving them as good as new.  However, it is difficult for her to get hold of spare parts or, if she finds them, they are very expensive. She hopes that, over time, she will make progress in her business and be able to set up an auto repair shop.

This will be Rosa's tenth loan from MFP.  She is very much aware that she must make her repayments on time so as not to cause problems for the other members of her community bank, where she is very well liked because of her responsibility.

Rosa will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more spare parts in order to better stock her business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es: Jenny de 45 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.  Ella tiene 1 hijo con el que sueña ver prósperos y productivos y por eso se esmera por lograr una educación de calidad y es precisamente su mayor motivación en el trabajo que desempeña como comerciante. Ella inició su negocio con capital propio, pues con ciertos ahorros que tenía decide comenzar a comprar ciertos productos para empezar a ofrecer a todo público en general. La competencia de su mercado es muy fuerte y para ella este es su mayor desafío, pero como maneja muy bien sus relaciones con los proveedores, logra precios que traslada a sus clientes, con los cuales los mantiene fieles. Este crédito es para la compra de  cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, lápiz labial, brillos, lápiz de ojos entre otras.
texts.en:
Jenny is 45 years old and sells cosmetics. She has a son who dreams of becoming prosperous and productive, so she strives to provide him a quality education. He also serves as great motivation for her work as a merchant. Jenny started her business with her own capital. She used her savings to buy certain products so that she could start offering them to the general public. Her greatest challenge is the competition in the marketplace since it is very strong. However, she has been able to manage the relationship with her distributors very well. By negotiating good prices, she is able to pass the savings along to her customers who have remained loyal.

This loan will be used to buy crèmes, treatments, shampoos, lipsticks, lip gloss, eyeliner, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase crèmes, treatments, shampoos, lipsticks, lip gloss, eyeliner, and other products.

loans.name: Aiturgan's Group

texts.en:
Aiturgan is the leader of this group. She is 20 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is 5000 soms.  She and her husband are raising a baby together. Six years ago Aiturgan’s parents presented her with a calf, and since then she has been breeding farm animals. She earns an additional 4000 soms per month, fattening and reselling animals at the highest price. This profit helped her improve their family’s living conditions. With money received from the loan, Aiturgan wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In future she wants to purchase a piece of land to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora has managed her rice farming business for 30 years. At 49, she is married with four school-aged children. Her husband is her partner in managing their farm business. Aurora also engages in a hog raising business for an additional source of income for the family. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for farming. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her profits because she is now able to apply the exact amount of farm inputs needed in farming.

Through farming and a remittance from her daughter, she is able to send her children to school and fulfill their daily basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is a twenty-nine-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Shaban is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family, and his dream is to set up an income-generating activity to support them.

Shaban has been operating a grocery for four years amidst the hardships imposed by inflation. He needs a loan of 2,200,000 UGX to buy sugar, cassava flour and soap to sell. His vision is to have a wholesale business plus a better residential home.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cassava flour and soap to sell.

loans.name: Faig

texts.ru: Faig jivet Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Faig 48 let. On uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom i sojayet pomidori. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi pomenat sistemu orosheniya tak kak ona ochen staraya i ploxo oroshayet zemlyu.
texts.en: Faig lives in the Baku region together with his wife and children.  He is 48 years old, married and has two children.  Faig has been involved in agriculture and growing tomatoes for ten years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to replace his sprinkler system because it is very old and does not water the ground well.

loans.use: to replace a sprinkler system

loans.name: Cephas

texts.en: Cephas is 32 years old, married to Grace Omusolo and together they have two children. His primary business is dressmaking. He has been in the sector for the past three years. His monthly income from the business is 6,000 KES. The business is located in Mathare slum. This is his first loan in KADET which he intends to use to purchase more clothing material. Anticipated profit is to be used to expand the business and educate his children. His hopes are to build his own house and venture into the hotel industry.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carro, su negocio aun es pequeño, recién cuenta con una pequeña vitrina que está abasteciendo poco a poco, pero dice que "por algo se empieza".
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: ½ docena de pistones, ½ docena de crucetas, 1 caja de bujías, 6 pares de espejos, 1 balde de grasa, ½ docena de radiadores.
Le falta mayor inversión pero está empezando con poco capital, mas adelante espera tener una tienda bien completa, es la meta que se a trazado este año, solo espera que Manuela Ramos le sigua prestando el apoyo económico que necesita para implementar mas su negocio.
A su cargo tiene un solo hijo que todavía está estudiando y necesita mucho de su apoyo.  Su esposo es operador de maquinas pesadas.
texts.en:
Nimia is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Productivas in the district of Manantay, in the department of Ucayali, and is 41 years old, married and has 5 children. She has an auto parts store. Her business is small and she has a little showcase that she is supplying little by little, because as she says, "everybody has to begin somewhere." With her new loan of 1500 soles she will buy 1/2 dozen pistons, 1/2 dozen spreaders, 1 box of spark plugs, 6 pairs of mirrors, a bucket of grease, and 1/2 dozen radiators.

The major problem was beginning with a small investment but as time goes by she will have a more complete store. She is on the path to this goal this year. She only hopes that Manuela Ramos continues to provide the loans that she needs to grow her business. She has one dependent child in school needing support. Her husband is a heavy equipment operator.

loans.use: to purchase radiators, pistons, and other auto parts for resale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a fruit and vegetable vendor in her community. She sells every day just to have funds use for daily expenses. At the age of 58, she is a very industrious woman. The fact is, she is walking some distance to sell to her villagers. Sometimes due to poor sales, she earned just 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) daily, which caused her to pursue selling in other communities without hesitating to walk a distance. 

Now, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional goods to sell such as cabbage, beans, carrots and eggplants. She hopes the fruit of this will be greater than her usual income every day. Through this she can now provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell such as cabbage, beans, carrots and eggplants

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor is 52 years old. She is a farmer and earns $2 per day. Her husband buys and sells cattle and earns $3 per day. They have two children, and all of them are working. Each earns $2.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $42 on food, $5 on electricity and $20 on rent. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy cattle to sell. The loan will help her husband to have enough money to continue his career that makes some income for the famiL.. The couple plan to buy more land for farming and to buy more cattle to sell when they can save enough money to start.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Yen Phong distict in Bac Ninh province. She is married and has four adult children.  

To making a living, Nga owns and operates a furniture-making business, specializing in bedroom furniture for local businesses and community members. Nga has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Nga joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Nga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,944,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.   

Nga is now requesting a new loan of 9,184,000 VND, which will be used to purchase machinery to expand the business. The loan will be the sixth  taken out by Nga from SEDA. Nga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


 Nga là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống,  Nga Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.   Nga thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này,  Nga kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007,  Nga đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.   Nga đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.184.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.   Nga dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase machinery to expand the business.

loans.name: Saida Danitza

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Saida Danitza; la socia tiene 54 años de edad; la socia  sigue trabajando en una entidad estatal en el área administrativo,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere mejorar en su trabajo .La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un artefacto para implementar su casa. 


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is Mrs. Saida Danitza.  She is 54 years old.  She continues working in an administrative area of a state institute.  Because of this job, she is able to help her children get ahead.  She wants to improve in her work. She is asking for a loan to buy a fixture or appliance to better her house.
She is happy about her loan and commits to comply with the payment of her fees.

loans.use: to buy a fixture or appliance to better her house.

loans.name: Maly's Group

texts.en:
Maly, a 22-year-old mother of one, has been farming on her rice field for five years. She also raises pigs to generate additional income for her family.

Maly now leads a group of five female members in a village located in the Moung Russey district where rice farming is common. Having received two previous loans from VisionFund, she is now requesting her third to buy fertilizer for the rice field and feeds for her pigs. This loan will help to increase her crop yield and ensure the health of her pigs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 40-year-old widow. She is living with two daughters,  Novi, 21, studying at a university, and Yunita, 17, studying in the 3rd grade of Senior High School.

Since the death of her husband 9 years ago, Rosalina automatically took over her husband’s role as the breadwinner for her family. To meet her family needs and her children's education needs, Rosalina is working at the church office as an administrator as well as running a rented house business (one simple house and 4 small rooms). She has been running the business for one year. Actually, she still has two more buildings for rent but the buildings are not completed yet due to her limited capital. 

Therefore Rosalina is seeking a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000. The loan will be spent on building materials such as sand, cement, zinc, wood, etc. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as sand, cement, zinc, wood, etc.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a 47-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 24 years old and her husband works as a farmer and an official in Barangay. For the past 11 years, Saturnina has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells items such as coffee, shampoo, soap, canned goods and soft drinks. She works hard to help support her family. 

Saturnina is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, toilet paper, and coffee. In the future, she hopes to have more income.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soft drinks, toilet paper, and coffee

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
El Sr. Herminio es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 38 años de edad y está casado hace más de 6 años con la Sra. Antonia, ellos tienen 1 hijo de 4 años de edad.
Hace más de 20 años él Sr. Herminio se dedica a la  compra y venta de coco con su padre, en cada cosecha le deja muy buenas ganancias. Gracias a este trabajo logró comprarse un camión y trabajar en forma independiente, hoy en día ya tiene clientela formada, lo cual le trae muy buenas ganancias.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra  de coco puesto que ya comenzó la cosecha y necesita de capital para invertir en dicho negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Herminio is from the city of Carapeguá.  He is 38 years old and has been married for more than 6 years to Señora Antonia.  They have one child who is 4 years old.  

Señor Herminio has been buying and selling coconut with his father for more than 20 years.  Their earnings are good for each harvest.  Thanks to this work he has been able to buy himself a truck and work independently.  Now he has an established clientele and brings in a good income.  

He is requesting a loan to buy coconut since the harvest has started and he needs capital to invest in his business.

loans.use: purchase coconut to sell.

loans.name: Fedinand

texts.en:
Fedinand is 34-years-old, married and a father of two children. He operates an electronic and battery shop and has been in the business for the last three years. He earns a monthly income of about Kes 25,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of Kes 30,000. Ferdinand plans to buy working tools such as screw driver kits, electric chargers, and other tools that he may need to conduct his business. He plans to save the anticipated profit as he continues to support his family and educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to own an electronics distribution store and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more working tools/equipment for his business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 25 years old, married to Alice, and they are blessed with one child aged 3 years. He has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar and rice for his shop

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Bineta vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants d’un et de 7 ans. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de petit déjeuner et de diner. Elle a aussi une expérience dans la coiffure. Elle a choisi son activité de commerce par passion mais aussi dans le souci de se  procurer  des revenus .C’est l’aspect lucratif de l’activité qui l’intéresse le plus. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis février 2008. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’aménagement de sa cantine dans le but d’élargir  son emplacement et d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour une meilleure satisfaction des besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Madame Bineta lives in Senegal. She is thirty-one years old. She is married and mother of two children, one and seven years old. She has been active for over ten years in the sale of breakfast and dinner. She also has experience as a hairdresser. She chose her profession out of passion, but also in order to make a profit.  It's the lucrative aspect of her profession that interests her the most. She has been a member of UIMCEC since February 2008. She is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs, anticipated to equip her canteen with the goal of enlarging her site and to increase her profits to better satisfy the needs of her family.

loans.use: to equip her canteen.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Madam N. operates the Vquaye Ventures as a food distribution depot for the community, which has about 15,000 people living in the area. Madam N.'s activity ensures that food is available to the community and especially the schools all year round. She travels frequently to up north the country to purchase the food items and then preserves them in the food storage facility she operates at home. She has been a participant of the TEACH lending programs of Kraban and keeps systematic but simple records of her activities. She wants a KIVA LOAN of $1000 to expand her community food distribution business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Shabani

texts.en: Shabani sells dry fish at Temeke market in Dar es Salaam. He has been in this business for four years now. Shabani buys these fish in the nearby region of Morogoro, packs them and transports them to the market. Buyers of his fish are retailers at the Temeke market. He has built a healthy relationship with his regular customers. These retailers place regular orders to him and when he has enough orders he arranges the trip to Temeke market. For the past six months he has been receiving more orders than he can service. This is due to the weak capital base he has. This is a competitive disadvantage for him. Competitors may capture and utilize the opportunity. He needs USD 750 to add to his working capital so that he can service all the orders he receives.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Puchase and selling of potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Alis Atocha

texts.es:
Alis is single, 29 years old and lives in Mérida, Yucatán. She's a teacher and also works in childcare. To improve her quality of life, she started her own business two years ago. Her love of children motivated her to open daycare center in an air-conditioned room in her home, where, thanks to her experience, she's been successful in offering a high-quality service and, from recommendations by her clients, has been able to take many children under her care.

To improve her service and grow her business, Alis is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to remodel her daycare center by giving it a better appearance and enlarging it to take on more clients. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Alis is very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Alis es soltera, tiene 29 años de edad y vive en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán, es maestra y puericultora, para mejorar su calidad de vida desde hace 2 años decidió iniciar su propio negocio, su gusto por los niños la llevo a abrir una estancia infantil acondicionando una habitación de su casa, donde gracias a los conocimientos que posee ha logrado ofrecer un servicio de muy buena calidad y por las recomendaciones de sus clientes ha logrado tener muchos niños a su cuidado.

Para mejorar su servicio y hacer creer su negocio ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la remodelación de su estancia con lo que podrá mejorar su apariencia y ampliar su capacidad, ella espera devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Alis agradece mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Remodel daycare center

loans.name: Nilza

texts.en:
Nilza, 30, and her husband Geronimo, 35, have a business together making and selling wooden furniture. He makes the furniture in a shop out of their home, and she sells it from their store which they opened 4 years ago. 
They have 2 children who are 3 and 12 years old and the eldest is studying in the 6th grade of elementary school. Her dream for the future is that they go to university and become professionals. She says that this is why she and her husband struggle to make a good living. 
Nilza and her husband are requesting this loan to purchase a truck so that they are able to expand their business and begin delivering their furniture to be sold at additional locations.

loans.use: To purchase a delivery truck

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. lives in the rural village of Nansana on the outskirts of Kampala, Uganda. She has a tailoring business. During the day she has a sewing machine set on the concrete entrance to Debby’s Salon, located on the busy highway . At home she has another sewing machine. In is not uncommon for women tailors to have two machines: one for home and one on the street next to a business. In the picture you can see some of the fabric that she uses to make garments.
 
She is a new client and has only been in her lending group for one month. Generally, a person needs to be in the lending group for at least a month before there are eligible for a loan. With her loan she plans to buy another machine and some fabric. She wants another machine because she is planning on starting a sewing school for young girls. Young girls often have to drop out of school to take care of sick parents, so a sewing school gives them a trade in which to earn a living.

loans.use: Rose plans to use her loan to buy another sewing machine and some fabric to start a sewing school.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Elizabeth Q. lives with her son in Anticretico in the Pasankeri zone on the west side of La Paz. Mrs. Elizabeth is the caretaker of a building in the Sopocachi zone. Her brother has a piece of land in the same zone that has a rough-built room. Mrs. Elizabeth’s objective is to finish the construction of the rooms and add a bathroom so she can live there and leave Anticretico. The credit she is requesting will go toward the finer details of the construction of her house and a bathroom. This is the first time she has requested a loan, and a socioeconomic analysis performed qualifies her favorably for a loan. This type of credit falls under the remodeling line of our Dwelling program.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Elizabeth Q. vive en Anticretico en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hijo. La señora Elizabeth es portera en un edificio de la zona de Sopocachi. Su hermano mayor tiene un terreno en la misma zona que tiene una habitación edificada en obra gruesa, la señora Elizabeth tiene el objetivo de concluir la construcción de la habitación más un baño, para poder vivir allí y dejar el anticretico. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación en obra fina y un baño. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Este tipo de crédito cae bajo nuestro programa de Vivienda, línea refacción

loans.use: Construction of house and bath

loans.name: Kazinga C (Iii) Group

texts.en: O. is a single mother of one child. She currently makes a large variety of crafts like mats, sandals, bags, necklaces, and shoes. She would like to use her extra profits to expand her business and make a business building.

loans.use: To expand her crafts business

loans.name: Nakururwe West D Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is N. K.. She has a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs to sell. N. is 37 years old and is single. She has 6 children ranging in age from 5 to 18, and 4 of her children go to school. Each week, N. makes approximately 70000 UGX (about $40) profit and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up another restaurant. N. has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 1800000 in order to invest in business and the loan was paid back on time.

N. is joined in her small group by Zainah T., Mariamu N., B. Faridah, and Faridah B.. Zainah T. has a business in selling clothes and wants to increase the stock of clothes. Mariamu N. runs a restaurant and wants a loan to buy a fridge and more food warmers. B. Faridah sells charcoal and wants to increase the stock of charcoal. Faridah B. has a tailoring business of and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for sale and expand business

loans.name: Bi Mkubwa's Ujirani Mwema Group

texts.en:
Bi Mkubwa is 32 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 11, 7 and 1 years old. Bi Mkubwa owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items  for her business.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng K. S., 37, is married with two children and lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has a stand at a market, where she sells porridge and Chinese noodles for breakfast. Eng K. S. and her husband have to get up very early in the morning to cook all their food stuffs and send them to the market. When everything is done and well-prepared Mrs. Eng K. S. works selling all the food stuffs at the market and her husband goes back home to breed their cows. With her business activity, Mrs. Eng K. S. can typically makes $15 each day in income, of which one part of the money is for repaying her loan and another part of the money is used to cover her family’s expenses. Recently, Mrs. Eng K. S. applied for a loan to help her expand her business. She lacks utensils and some equipment. The rest of the loan she also wants to beneficially use to purchase more calves for her family’s livestock.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and equipment for her stand

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Mrs. Paullina U. is 51 years old, married and has 7 children. She finished the repayment of the last Kiva loan. According to her, the loan was really helpful to her. Hence with the loan she was able to serve her customers better. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more women's clothing for sale. She thanks you for this opportunity for her business.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothing and hats for sales

loans.name: Seleisa

texts.en: Seleisa F., 25, is married with 1 children.  She has 4 year(s) of experience in the keke puaa business. She sells to the villagers/public 3 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Seleisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. to help for her business needs

loans.use: flour, vegetable oil, bakery powder and sugar, mutton flaps, onion

loans.name: Kiemmiddin

texts.ru:
Kiemmiddin S. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 38 years, married and has four children. He has a higher education and works as a teacher in a secondary school. Besides teaching, he practices animal husbandry. He breeds and raises cattle that he then sells at a marketplace. Kiemmiddin needs the loan to purchase an additional bull, which he can raise and sell for profit, needed for his family. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарофиддинов Киеммиддин житель Вахдатского района. Возраст 38 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование высшее . Работает учителеми в средней школе.Кроме того занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот , который после откормки продает на базаре.Хочет купить еще одного бычка , которого так же после откормки он сможет продать и получить прибыль , которая так необходима его семье. Получив кредит он сможет приобрести бычка , а погасить кредит он планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Yoeut

texts.en:
Yoeut C., 23, is married and lives with one child in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia.

C. sells charcoal with the help of her husband, Phai Hang (pictured). Her business has been around for about over ten years and she makes US$2.5 every day. Selling charcoal has been a difficult business. She would like a loan to purchase a cart and motorbike to transport the charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and trailer for transporting charcoal.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem M. and her husband, Mr. Korng Ry, have a business of fishing, and live in Peam Ta Ek Village in Kandal Province. They are currently facing a problem because they have an old boat which they can no longer use for fishing. Mrs. Nhem M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy more fish nets to catch more fish. Mrs. Nhem M. is 47 years old and the mother of five children:  one is a fisherman and the others are attending school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a boat and more fish nets

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride M. sends you greetings from Byumba in the northern region of Rwanda! Floride is 36 years old, married with 3 children. Floride has owned a small shop since 2006. She sells clothes, shoes, etc.

Besides the shop, Floride owns a cow farm and earns about US$ 110 per month by selling dairy products. She is requesting a loan worth 200,000 Frws to expand her business. The loan term is 8 months.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 31 years old and lives with his wife and one child in a small village called Rashaia, in Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley. Mohammed is a car electrician and has asked Al Majmoua for a loan of 1000 US Dollars in order to purchase a supply of car batteries. This will be Mohammed’s first loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new car batteries for his auto repair business

loans.name: Nouha

texts.en:
Nouha lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children.  Nouha has been a seamstress for the last seventeen years and she has also made clothing for seven years. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase fabrics for her sewing. Nouha has been a micro-credit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

Nouha is a very dynamic person and she is known for her good work as well as the good quality she provides in her work. Nouha says that she feels like she is “gifted” that’s why she is talented in her work. But in the beginning she faced some difficulties because she didn’t have any cash to open a shop, and she said that thanks to A. Majmoua, she was able to achieve her dream and be an independent woman. She plans in the future to purchase a newer and more sophisticated sewing machine.

loans.use: Nouha needs the loan to purchase fabrics for her sewing

loans.name: Marbelly

texts.es: La Sra. Marbelly, de 42 años de edad, es casada, con 3 hijos, uno de 25 años quien ya trabaja y 2 niñas estudiando la primaria, trbaja para Plan Nicaragua desde hace 3 años como asesora tecnica sobre los derechos de la niñez y la adolescencia, su esposo es abogado y le ayuda con sus hijas. Está solicitando su 3er credito el que utilizara para compra de 3 puertas y la elaboracion de un closes, tambien pintara la caa si el dinero le ajusta, esta empezando a invertir en la casa porque hasta hace unos meses el esposo dio escritura a nombre de las niñas y ella como albacea y es hasta ahora que ella hara las mejoras a la vivienda porque esta segura que la inversion que haga no sera en vano, pues las beneficiadas serán sus hijas, sin el temos que un dia las saquen de la casa como ha sucedido en muchos casos.  una vez que cancele este credito solicitara otros hasta dar las condiciones deseadas a su casa, porque en el futuro sera de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marbelly is a 42-year-old married mother of three children: her oldest is 25 years old and employed, and she has two daughters in primary school. She has worked at Plan Nicaragua for three years as a technical assessor for children's and adolescents' rights. Her husband is a lawyer and helps support the girls. This is her third loan request, which she'll use to make home improvements and buy three doors, build a closet, and paint the house if there is money leftover. She is beginning the house improvements because a few months ago her husband placed the house in the girls' names and named Mrs. Marbelly as executrix. She is ensuring her daughters will benefit from the house and not be evicted as has happened in other cases. Once she has paid off this loan, she'll request future loans in order to continue the house improvements until completed, as the house will be for her daughters in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three doors and build a closet

loans.name: Did

texts.en: S., 41, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a staffer of Christian Center. She is married with three children; all of them are single. To help a little with her family's food needs, one of her sons is working as a local teacher, and currently earns a salary of $120 per month. Her husband Nouv Samith, 56 years old, is working as a security guard at the Orphanage. He currently earns a salary of $150 a month, and has been working since 2002. S. has applied for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for her son to ride to work and meet her family's needs. The loan will help her reduce the cost of transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: David

texts.en: David U. is 42 years old and married with 6 children. David has a farm where he cultivates cassava and he says he needs to put all his children in school, that is why he needs to plant another farm to make more money to take care of his family. He is requesting the loan amount of N 25,000 to meet his goal. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To plant crops on another farm

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda C. lives in the village of Calamagui 1st, Ilagan.  She is 32 years old and married to Christopher, 31 years old and working as OFW abroad.  They are blessed with three children named John Mark - 10 years old, Mark Clart - 8 years old, and Ian - 7 years old.  All of them are elementary school students.  The good relationships in their family inspire Imelda to strive for a better life. 

Imelda generates income for her family by means of a direct selling business.  She purchases AVON products and then offers them to her friends and neighbors in their village.  She walks and visits every house of her customers' to encourage them to buy her products.  However, due to lack of capital, Imelda is hoping to avail a loan amounting to PHP6, 000 as additional capital for her business. 

Imelda works hard for her family.  She also looks for other types of selling businesses as alternatives to her AVON business.

Moreover, Imelda believes that God is always present to look over their needs.  She learned to be humble to those who used to criticize her because she knows that she’ll be exalted in heaven with God.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace U. has a business selling milk. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Grace is 36 years old. She is married. Her husband is a cattle keeper. They have 4 children, who all go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Grace hopes to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations, with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
For the last two years, Mwandawa has made a living selling firewood and clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar.   She currently earns an average monthly profit of $110, and works for 12 hours a day.  

She is applying for her third loan from BRAC Tanzania and plans to use it to buy more firewood to sell. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits, grow her business, pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.  

Mwandawa is  34 years old, married, and has three children, ages 10, 6 and 2. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will share this loan with her fellow loan group member, Jina. Jina runs a small business selling clothes and firewood in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es: Edinson tiene 25 años, vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 4 años ofrece el servicio de transporte de pasajeros diariamente y durante todo el día recorriendo a las calles de la ciudad con su auto. Edinson sabe que como transportista corre muchos riesgos, sin embargo no se detiene porque es una buena fuente de trabajo que le genera los ingresos necesarios para vivir y sostener a sus hijos. Para el futuro le gustaría crear su propia empresa de transportes. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, tiene muchas expectativas de trabajar en su banco comunal y ser uno de los socios más comprometidos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de repuestos para su carro y el mantenimiento del mismo.
texts.en:
Edinson is 25 years old and lives with his son in his parents’ house. For 4 years, he has been providing daily transportation services to passengers throughout the city’s streets with his car. Edinson knows that, as a driver, he runs many risks. He continues on regardless, because it is a good source of work that generates income for him to support his family. In the future, he would like to start his own transportation enterprise. This is the first time he has a loan with MFP, and he has great expectations of working with his cooperative bank and being one of the most responsible members. The funds he is requesting are to purchase replacement parts for his car, and for its maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts and maintain his car.

loans.name: Williams

texts.en:
Williams A. is 41 years old. He is married and has three children, all girls. He says two of the children are currently in the primary school. The youngest is yet to start. He lives with his wife and children in a family house in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Williams' wife is a trader.  

He is also into trading. He deals in all kinds of baking ingredients such as flour, margarine, etc. He sells in a store in his community. Williams supplies the majority of the bakers in his community. He wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other materials in bulk. Williams has been in business for two years. He hopes to improve his standard of living and give his children a sound education.

loans.use: To procure baking ingredients

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina L. is a 53 year old mother of six children. She is renting a rice farm. She grows rice to be able to buy the things they need in their home. Someday she wishes to have her own farm. In that way, she could enjoy all her harvest and improve their family living conditions.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. "With my loan, I could be able to improve our harvest", she said.

CEVI is helping people to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en:
Marriam J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to open a shop. Marriam is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a chief. She has one child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Moses Ojowi

texts.en:
Moses is the 34-year-old, married, father of four children, who range in age from 1 year and 8 months, to 12 years old. His children are all in school. His wife works with him in his business.

Moses sells vegetables and fried fish. He purchases tilapia and nile perch from a market in Kisumu, Kenya, and transports the goods back to a place near his home where he sells them. He also sells vegetables like tomatoes and onions.

The challenge of his business are that during the dry season (which is now, July-December), the prices he pays for his vegetables go up and the supply goes down. He will use this loan to buy more fish and vegetables to sell.

Moses says that “when business goes well, I want to become a farmer.” He wants to grow and sell his own food.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Ry P. is a 53-year-old widow and she lives in Preak Doung village in Kandal. She is a chicken breeder. She is also a beautician who gets hired by people during weddings, parties, and so on. Although she tries to work hard, she still earns too little income to support herself. Thus, Mrs. Ry P. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
“In order to uplift our family from poverty, we must learn how to prioritize things and learn to be hard-working enough. If we need money, then we need to look for money. But we must also remember to use it for its productivity," says Antonio.

Antonio has been managing his buy-and-sell business for almost two years. His income of PHP 3,000 a month is being used to support the needs of his three children. He is now asking for business capital in the amount of PHP 5,000, which he believes will make his business more productive and profitable.

Antonio has five children. Due to insufficient income, he was not able to send them all to college. Three are still studying and two of his eldest children are already working in Manila after their graduation from high school. His eldest works as a waiter and his second-eldest works as a helper.

He is not losing hope that someday, his three younger children will finish their college education.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is the 46-year-old father of three. A landlord, who owns a furniture workshop, John owns a large building and rents out both residences and small business premises. He has been in this business for the past five years. John is requesting a loan of Kes 60,000 in order to add to his stock of timber and block boards and to purchase more tools. As the father of three, John hopes to build for his family a home away from the slums. He describes himself as social, kind and charitable. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of timber and to purchase more tools

loans.name: God Gee Group

texts.en:
This is Hawa C., Mohamed K. and Memunatu K.. They named their group God Gee.  They are small scale entrepreneurs who want a loan of Le 1,500,000 to enable them improve their businesses. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, sales will thus improve and so also will be their sales-to-profit-margin. With a larger profit at their disposal, they will be able to better look after themselves and children.  

Hawa C. (right) is the leader of this group. Hawa was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. She is now age twenty-five, married to a driver and they have one child who is just two years of age. Hawa sells market food – pepper, palm-oil, etc. at Makeni second largest market. Hawa has now had three years of experience in business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos vive en casa propia en la calle Juan Granier de la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz, vive con su esposa y su hija menor; la actividad que el realiza es la de sastre, ya que desde muy joven se dedicó a esta profesión, la cual es su única fuente de ingresos y además genera empleo ya que tiene a su servicio dos operarios que le ayudan con la costura; el crédito que solicita es para comprar material (telas, forros, botones, cierres, etc.) y atender a  su clientela.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2002, con un buen historial de pagos, de manera que califica para acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos U. lives in his own house on Juan Granier Street in the September 14th area of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and his young daughter. Carlos works as a tailor, and has been involved in this business from a young age. This job is his only source of income, but the business also provides jobs for two other workers that help with the sewing. The loan that Carlos is asking for would be used to buy materials (fabrics, linings, buttons, closures, etc.) and to see to customers' needs. Carlos has been a client of Impro since 2002 and has a good history of payments, qualifying him to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, linings, closures, buttons, etc. for tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build more rooms in his lodge and buy more cows for his dairy

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco.  The group is called Sacro.  She  is from Cruz Pata and lives there as well.  She is 41 years old and is married with 3 children.

She owns her own land where she farms various types of cereals, grains and potatoes.  She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her fields.

Martha appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin B. is a 31-year-old single man, currently living at Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. In 2009, Franklin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

He is requesting a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP as additional capital for his new business which is a sari-sari (variety) store. He is going to purchase items to make his new little store full of stock. This amount will be his 2nd loan from PMPC.

loans.use: purchase stock for his new sari-sari store

loans.name: Enosh

texts.en:
Enosh J. is a 27 year old man married to Varary J.. Together they have a two year old son. Enosh is a tailor and runs his tailoring business in Naivasha town.

This is Enosh’s third loan with KADET. With his first and second loans Enosh was able to establish his business in terms of acquiring better premises and buying sewing machines. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a client.

Enosh plans to buy textile stock in bulk in preparation for the Chrismas season which is normally a peak time in Naivasha. He will also use the loan to assist his wife in improving her vegetable business by adding more stock.  

Enosh currently pays rent but his longterm goal is to grow his business to be able to acquire his own premises.

loans.use: To buy a stock of fabric for his tailoring business

loans.name: Good Member Group

texts.en:
This is a group of small-scale entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They formed themselves into a group they named 'Good Members' in order to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, sales and level of income will improve so that they can better support themselves and their children.

On the left of the photo is Adama J., the leader of this group of four. Adama was born in Magburaka town about forty years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have five children. Their children are attending secondary and primary schools respectively.

Adama J. sells fresh fish and supplies fresh fish to market women in Magburaka town. She has been doing business for approximately thirty years now. With her share of this loan, she will travel to Freetown and buy something like four cartons of fish. In Freetown; a carton usually costs her SLL 100,000.

loans.use: Buy four cartons of fish

loans.name: Necifora

texts.en: Necifora T. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 55 years old, widowed and has eight grown-up children. She is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. Necifora has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Necifora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Necifora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Necifora is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chacap Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Chacap se dedican a la elaboraciòn y venta de guipiles y blusas, han trabajado durante 6 años atras  y con esT. han salido avante, pero viendo la gran necesidad de apliar sus capitales y cubrir sus demandas acuden a la Asociaciòn de ASDIR para que se les apoye, en sus capitales, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que piensan superar y apoyara a sus familias, y como tambien desean realizar sus distintos sueños y quieren ver a sus hijos graduados en sus estudios, y tener una casa digna.
Este grupo de señoras se encuentra un lugar llamado Chacap es una aldea  de solola muy Pobre a pèsar de ello ellas visitan y realizar venta en otros lugares.-
texts.en:
The Chacap Group engages in the manufacture and sale of “huipiles” and blouses. They have working for six years and are successful in this endeavor, but they need T. increase their capital in order T. keep up with demand. For this reason, they have come T.
