Asociaciòn ASDIR for assistance in accessing more capital. The women work very hard T. overcome obstacles and support their families. They also have different dreams that they want T. pursue, such as seeing their children complete their education and owning a decent home.

These women live in a place called Chacap, an isolated village that is very poor. Despite their location, they are able T. visit other places in order T. sell their products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making traditional blouses

loans.name: Aduke

texts.en: Aduke is married with four children. She is a hardworking woman who is experienced in her business of selling drinks and sachet water. Her business gives her joy because she does not sell on credit – her customers pay cash when they come to purchase drinks. Aduke is longing to expand her business significantly, and is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. Her husband is a building contractor and he also supports the home. Aduke sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol D. is from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Mirasol is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mirasol owns and operates a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mirasol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be Mirasol's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha L. is 43 years old and is a villager who lives Roka village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Sao Phon, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they cultivate rice. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

In order to support her rice farming, Mrs. Pha L. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her growing crop. Aside from farming, Mrs. Pha L. is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to support her family living.

This couple has eight children, one of whom is a laborer, three others are seamstresses in the garment factory, three are students in the public school while the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 58 años, vive con su hijo Israel (26), en su casa que es  propia.Como la mayor parte del tiempo estaba solo busco una actividad a la cual pueda dedicarle todo su tiempo, pues su hijo trabaja y casi nunca estaba  en casa, es por esta razón  que optó por la venta de calzado. Esta actividad varía según las temporadas, en la actualidad se dedica a la comercialización de sandalias, y le genera buenas ganancias. Trabaja movilizándose en su triciclo por las  diferentes zonas del mercado de la zona por donde vive, a diario acomoda  de una manera vistosa  toda su mercadería, en el triciclo, ya lleva 5 años en este trabajo y le dedica prácticamente todo el día. Le gusta mucho las ventas  ya que puede interactuar con toda clase de personas y su carisma le ha permitido hacer  muy buenos amigos. En el futuro quiere instalar  un negocio fijo en algún mercado concurrido, pero por el momento se siente muy bien con este trabajo.Es el segundo crédito que tiene y esta muy agradecido con todos los que hicieron posible el préstamo que le permitirá continuar laborando.Manuel tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería ,en calzado, ya que desea  mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel, 58, lives with his son, Israel, 26, in his own house. Because his son works and is hardly ever at home, he was always alone. So, he needed to find something to do that would keep him occupied. He decided to sell shoes. This activity varies according to the season. Currently, he is selling sandals and is earning good profits. He travels on his three-wheeled vehicle to various markets near his home. He displays his wares in an eye-catching manner in his vehicle. He has been in this line of work for 5 years and spends almost the entire day at it. He enjoys sales very much because he can interact with all kinds of people and his charisma has made it possible for him to make many friendships. In the future, he would like to set up a fixed site in some busy market but, for the time being, he is content with his work as it is. This is his 2nd loan and he is very grateful to all the people that made his past loans possible so that he can continue working. Manuel plans to invest the requested funds in greater amounts of merchandise, shoes, because he wants to improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup items to cook and sell

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Ma.Theresa D. is from the village of Obay. She is 40 years old. Ma.Theresa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma.Theresa works in a family member's business raising pigs for sale. Ma.Theresa is just starting in this business.

In 2010, Ma.Theresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Ma.Theresa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets, feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ma.Theresa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Our Father #2 Group

texts.en:
Kulah G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Our Father #2.  Kulah is 37 years old and married with two children, aged eight and 14 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For 16 years, Kulah has been selling rice, slippers and lappas (traditional wrap-around clothing) at the Stephen Tolbert Estate Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  

She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more stock to re-sell. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kulah is the borrower holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more lappas, slippers and rice to re-sell

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé A. est une femme âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à Atakpamé, une ville située à 100 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse des produits de l’alimentation générale et elle exerce cette activité il y a 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché d’Atakpamé  chez les grossistes, avec ce crédit, elle voudrait augmenter le stock de marchandise dans sa boutique en achetant en gros afin que le prix unitaire lui soit moins cher et qu’elle puisse réalisée d’énormes bénéfices. Avec le bénéfice réalisé, elle souhaiterait subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Amélé A., 45, is married and the mother of five children. She lives in Atakpamé, a town situated 100 km from Kpalimé. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for 10 years. She buys her inventory in the big marketplace of Atakpamé from wholesalers, and with this loan she would like to add to the stock of merchandise in her shop by buying wholesale, so that the unit price of her goods will be lower and she will be able to make enormous profit. With this profit, she would like to support her little family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39 year old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents. In 2002, he opened his own mini market to attend to the needs of the residents in the surrounding areas.

He is now requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise for the store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 24 years old and married. He finished  the intermediate school. 

He owns a small shop where he sells various CDs. His shop is located on the outskirts of a town in northern Iraq. He started his business with only a little capital, but he dreams of enlarging his shop in the future if the circumstance are right. 

Despite his youth, he has a good reputation in the market. Many customers gather around him due to his soft and respectful way with customers, his low prices, and because he has the latest CDs. He can raise his family income with this small shop.

loans.use: To buy CDs and new decorations

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan. She is the mother two children: a son and a daughter. Her husband sells timbers and her son works in a water pipe manufacturing factory. 

She herself stays at home, manages the household chores, and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and mother. Her daughter also helps her with the household work.
  
She has applied for a loan for the 2nd time from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy timbers in bulk to sell. She is hopeful that with the investment in her husband’s business, he will be able to increase his income, which will help her in saving money for her daughter’s marriage. 
Sugran has maintained her good credit behavior with last year's loan and attended all the meetings as a responsible client.

loans.use: To purchase timbers for selling.

loans.name: Baatarjav

texts.en:
Baatarjav D. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province, western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son was demobilized from the army this year and his daughter is a student in a university.

Baatarjav operates a shoemaking business in his town and his wife helps him with sewing the shoes. He sews many types of shoes including the traditional Mongolian shoes which are well known as “a pair of white-soled shoes” which are popular and warm and valued by his customers for their quality and design.

Baatarjav began this business in 1990 and since then he has gained a lot of experience and knows what his customers want and how much they are willing to pay for his quality shoes. He sells his products to stock keepers through trade fairs or by wholesale. The business has been so successful that he purchased a car which allows him to deliver his products to his customers.

Baatarjav is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for his business

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en:
Dioscoro R. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 40 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To earn a living, he makes "bahalina" and sells it in the community. Bahalina is a coconut wine famous all over the Philippines and said to have health benefits. Dioscoro is doing his best to provide for his family. He works hard to give his children a proper education. He also hopes for his business to grow bigger.

Dioscoro joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his family’s house and living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kimanyisho

texts.en:
Kimanyisho N. is 23 years old and she supports three members of her family. Her spouse is Meiponyi N. who is a farmer and they both do farming on their own piece of land. She has been raising cattle and sheep rearing for the last four years. Her target is to buy young rams during dry season when they are not very costly, then place them on her farm, which she has fenced for grazing. After the rainy season when they have fattened, she sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

She learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to use to buy ten rams and three young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

Her dream is to become a large-scale cattle and sheep farmer. 

She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To buy ten rams and three young bulls

loans.name: Chynarkul

texts.en:
Chynarkul D. lives in Kyrgyzstan, in Tyup village. She is 50 years old. Unfortunately her husband passed away, so she has to support her family alone. Her children are already adults. The eldest one (30 years old) earns his livelihood by working at a building site in Cholpon-ata city. The daughter who is 27 years old is a housewife and lives in Kant city with her husband. Another daughter (24 years old) makes money by working as a seller in the market “Dordoi”. The younger son (22 years old) lives with his mother and helps her to run their family business. 

In 2008 they bought three calves for 15,000 KGS for fattening and further resale, and since then they have managed to increase their stock of cattle by three more calves. By operating this business the family earns about $33 per month. 

The family needs money to purchase two calves for fattening and resale. For this reason they want a loan. In the future Chynarkul wants to continue to increase their stock of cattle and to buy a car. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice S. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children. All of her children are currently in school. Beatrice has a business of a garment shop, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items and stock, like clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Beatrice hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Beatrice hopes to build up a progressive business.

loans.use: To buy more items and stock, like clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita L. is from the village of Matusalem. She is 55 years old. Teresita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Teresita runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia C., a 48-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store, lives in Prk. Santol, QCRO, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30000.

Emelia is requesting a loan of PHP 19000 to add to her working capital in order to purchase more products to sell in her store. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Emelia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P. is a married woman who lives in Purok Moises, Brgy. Camang camang, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a pig fattening business.  Her husband Mario P., who is 47 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 13 and 14 years old.

 Lorna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to buy feed and piglets so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Lorna P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Ana Maricela

texts.es:
Ana una joven emprendedora, deseosa de superar tiene 18 años de edad, tiene su negocio de venta de ropa, vive con sus hermanos y su madre, es soltera y no tiene hijos, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, ella primeramente se dedicaba a la venta de meriendas y luego dispuso mejor dedicarse a la venta de ropa, viendo en este una mejor oportunidad de crecimiento, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y por días sale a visitar clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa de nuevos estilos y colores, ya que la demanda ha aumentado y espera que siga así por la época navideña, para ella es momento oportuno realizar esta inversión y darle al negocio un mayor fortalecimiento teniendo a la mano las prendas que los clientes buscan.
Su visión es ser una comerciante mayorista, tener variedad de prendas de vestir, aumentar las ventas para mejorar la solvencia económica de la familia y pagar este préstamo de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Ana is a young entrepreneur who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s 18 years old and has her own clothing sales business.  She lives with her siblings and her mother.  She’s single and has no children.  She lives in Puerto El Triunfo, Usulután department.

She used to sell prepared food but then decided it would be better to go into clothing sales because she thought this was a better growth opportunity.  She has the business in her home and she goes out during the day to call on her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy new clothes in new styles and colors because demand has increased and she hopes it will continue to do so because of the Christmas season.  For her this is the opportune moment to make this investment and strengthen the business having items on hand that her customers are seeking.

Her vision is to become a wholesaler, to have a variety of items available, to increase sales to better provide economic solvency for her family and to repay this loan in the best possible way.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 39 años, convive con Guadalupe, de 30 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Cristian, de 13 años de edad. En unión familiar los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Hace 15 años, esté trabajador hombre se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ovino, vacuno y porcino; el cual los engorda y mata, para luego comercializarlo en su carnicería que con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación adquirió en el mercado modelo de su ciudad. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Rolando, él también incursionó hace 2 años, al trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas de Tarma - Palcamayo, obteniendo un ingreso extra. Ahora él, está pensando adquirir un auto mejor implementado, con el que podrá trasportar a los pobladores de la ciudad al campo, asimismo está pensando adquirir máquinas para cortar carne, y así tener una carnicería de producción; con ello espera tener mejores ingresos para darle a su hijo una educación de nivel. Este es el onceavo crédito con MFP, y como presidente de su banco comunal, trabaja con ahínco y mucha responsabilidad, en el desarrollo constante de sus integrantes. Con el monto que solicita comprará, varios kilos de carne de animal, ovino, vacuno y porcino. Con esto piensa abastecer su carnicería, para las épocas de mayor demanda comercial que se avecinan.
texts.en:
Rolando is 39 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife, 30 year-old Guadalupe.  They have one son: 13 year-old Cristian.  The three of them live together in their own home which is located in the city of Tarma.

This hard-working man started his business buying and selling sheep, cattle and pigs 15 years ago.  He fattens the animals, slaughters them and then sells them in the butcher's shop which he acquired in the town market through a lot of hard work and commitment.  However, Rolando doesn't just have this one business.  He also broke into the public transport market two years ago.  He covers Tarma-Palcamayo routes, thereby making an extra income.

Rolando is now thinking of acquiring a better car with which he can transport the residents of his town to the countryside.  He is also planning to acquire machines for cutting meat which will allow him to have a productive butcher's shop.  He hopes to thereby make more profits so that he can give his son a good level of education.

This is Rolando's eleventh loan with MFP and, as president of his community bank, he works hard and very responsibly, to constantly help the bank's members to develop.  Rolando will use his loan to buy several kilos of meat: lamb, beef and pork.  He plans to use this to stock his butcher's shop for the coming season which sees a high demand for his products.

loans.use: To buy meat: lamb, pork and beef, to stock his business

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa C. e es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de cultivos ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, mucha de su gente encuentra en la ciudad un trabajo para ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 9 y 7 años de edad, todos  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Rosa se dedica al arreglo de casas, actividad que la realiza hace 6 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo ya que sale del trabajo en el momento que termine de realizar todos sus quehaceres. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes los que son mas para su consumo pero cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica los vende en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de animales y  materiales para acabar su casa. Su sueño es seguir conservando su salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa C. is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) communal bank.  She lives in the Los Alamos community which is part of Cumbe parish.  This parish is notable due to its fields full of crops because its residents are farmers and raise cattle.  Many of its residents look for work in the city to help our their household economy.

Rosa is 32 years old, married with three children who are 10, 9 and 7 years of age; they all go to a local school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  Their work as a couple has resulted in their building their own house.

She works as a domestic employee in houses.   She’s been in this line of work for 6 years. She works from Monday through Friday without a fixed schedule since she gets off work when she finishes all her duties.  At home she raises chickens and guinea pigs which are for personal consumption mostly but which she does sometimes sell when she has financial need.

This is her second loan with the communal bank.  She will use the money to buy animals and building materials and supplies to finish her house.  Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy chickens, guinea pigs and building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Elena Graciela

texts.es:
Elena Graciela C. A. tiene 44 años de edad. Vive en Unión Libre junto a su compañero y con sus hijos. En el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Elena Graciela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es darles el estudio a sus hijos.

Le gusta realizar los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Elena Graciela C. A., aged 44, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband and her children in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has three children.

The members of the rural communal bank "Jesús Nos Ama" (Jesus loves us) meet on the grounds of Amarillos in the canton of Ventanas. This group works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice. Its members have been in this activity for a long time.

Elena Graciela is a farmer. She has grown corn, rice and cocoa for 5 years. She buys her agricultural supplies from Agripac Eicopa and sells her products at the market in Ventanas.

She applies for a loan to buy agricultural consumables and fertilizers that she needs to grow corn and rice. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to provide her children with education. She likes doing her housework.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and fertilizers

loans.name: Sayyorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sayyorn S. (pictured here) is 29 years old and her husband, Mr. Chamreun Khat, is 30 years old. They have been married since 2005 and have two daughters, who are still young. The family lives along national road number one about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sayyorn sells meatballs and boiled eggs in her village. Her husband is a remoque taxi driver (a remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back). She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 32 years old, married, and has two children, aged 15 and 9. She has a small grocery store in Ayacucho and will be using her loan of 2,100 nuevos soles to buy new products to stock the store. Judith was invited to FINCA Peru by a friend when she was 18 years old and has been a member for 14 years. She enjoys the regular meetings and training that FINCA provides, and would like to save enough money to buy land or a house in Ayacucho.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to sell in grocery store

loans.name: Fidelin

texts.en:
Fidelin is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  hog-raising, livestock and ready-to-wear clothes/pants. Her husband Ramil, who is 31 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 7 and 8 years old. Fidelin joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fidelin has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy livestock supplies so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and renovation of her house. Fidelin is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase livestock supplies

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. is from the village of Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Del Norte.  She is 51 years old.  Delia is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Delia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.  This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Delia from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Doflintien's Group

texts.en:
The five entrepreneurs comprising this group know each other through common business, as they all run general stores in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments.

Doflintien (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1980 in Cotonou. She moved to her current location 10 years ago and now lives with her husband Ségbègnon and their four children. For the past five years Doflintien has run a stall selling general food and household goods. This loan will enable her to purchase a new stock of spices, bags of rice, and corn. Her aim in the longterm is to diversify her business. She says she is very dynamic in her approach to business.

loans.use: to purchase food stock for resale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman, with five children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, making dumplings and rice for sale.  Saumu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil for her food stall. Saumu decided to work with Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her small business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil for her food stall

loans.name: Florencia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Florencia de 64 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó su trabajo por medio de un dinero que tenia reunido y así abrió su negocio.

Ella labora en su tienda de 9H00am A 19H00 pm con el apoyo de su esposo y cada dos semanas compra la mercadería para su negocio. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como cuadernos, hojas y libros por docenas. Ella anhela tener su papelería bien surtidos para sus cliente.
texts.en:
Florencia is 64 years old. She is a hardworking woman that started her business with some money she had saved and this is how she opened her business.

Her store is open for business from 9am to 7pm and she has her husband's support. Every two weeks she purchases merchandise for her business. With the loan she wants to purchase more merchandise such as notebooks, loose leaf paper, and books by the dozens. She strives to have a well-stocked supply store for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, loose leaf paper, books, and office supplies.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana lives in the city of Arifwala, which is located in Pakistan and is known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house for the past 15 years. She is 33 years old, married to M. S. and has six children. Three of them are studying and the rest stay at home. 

Farzana is a housewife. She spends most of her time staying at home and carrying out her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Her husband owns a small piece of land and grows different seasonal crops on it to fulfill the basic needs of his family. He is a very hardworking person and does his work with great dedication. 

Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides to get better output from his land. He has been operating this business for 10 years and Farzana hopes that an investment will bring more profits to him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for an agricultural business.

loans.name: Shakhir

texts.ru:
Shakir jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On jivet v Baku regione, vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Shakir rodilsya v 1963 qodu. Uje 8 let kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnoqo produkta. Shakir prodayet v magazini moloko, sir, yogurt  kotoriy delayet on i yeqo jena.
texts.en: Shakir is married and has three children.  He lives in Baku with his wife and children. Shakir was born in 1963.  He has been working as a herdsman breeding cattle for eight years. Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy sheep to increase the quality of dairy products he produces. Shakir sells milk, cheese, and yogurt (which he and his wife make) in stores.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander, es un agricultor, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y tres hijos, de 14, 11 y 9 años de edad, él se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 14 años, como un medio para obtener ganancias e ingresos para su familia.
Actualmente ha iniciado el proceso de siembra, para lo cual solicita un préstamo para cubrir el gasto de los insumos, como abono, tratamiento para plagas y semilla. Este financiamiento le ayudara para tener lo necesario y dar un cuido ordenado al proceso del cultivo.
Para Alexander su objetivo primordial es que sus hijos estudien, y puedan superarse.
texts.en: Alexander is a farmer.  He lives with his family which is made up of his wife and his three children aged 14, 11 and 9.  Alexander has been in this business for 14 years.  It is how he makes income and profits for his family.  He is currently starting to sow his crops and is requesting this loan to cover the expense of the supplies he needs such as manure, pest control products and seeds.  This loan will help him to have everything he needs to care for his crops.  Alexander's main goal is for his children to study and improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy manure, pest control products and seeds for growing corn

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra vive en la comunidad rural de Ostional en Guanacaste. 
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora, y ha sacado a su familia adelante por si sola. En donde ella trabaja apenas le alcanza para sobrevivir, es por eso que no ha podido arreglar  el piso de su casa.
 Por eso ella necesita un préstamo  de ₡100 000 (cien mil colones) para la compra de cerámica que necesita para su casa. Ella está muy contenta porque al fin arreglará su casita. 
Ella es  socia de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de Ostional, una de las 110 empresas de crédito socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in the rural community of Ostional in Guanacaste.  

She is a woman who is a fighter, and who has been able to get her family ahead on her own.  Where she works, she barely makes enough to survive.  This is why she has not been able to fix the floor of her house.  

For this reason, she needs a loan of ₡100 000 (a hundred thousand colones) to buy the ceramics she needs for her house.  She is very happy because at last she will fix her little house.  

She is a member of the Ostional Cooperative Bank, one of the 110 social credit enterprises of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: buy ceramic floor tiles.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una mujer que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de su actividad. Su actividad es un centro recreativo es su principal fuente de ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Desde hace mas 9 años empezó su negocio cuando a su esposo lo despidieron del trabajo y compro el área donde tiene el negocio, aprovechando que el lugar tiene vertientes de agua, modificaron el lugar con pilas de agua estilo piscina, lo que atrae el turismo de la ciudad y tiene clientes que alquilan el lugar para diferentes actividades de negocio, o turístico, en el lugar venden platillos variados, gaseosas, refrescos y otros productos varios, también servicio de música al gusto del cliente. El financiamiento es para realizarle ciertas mejoras al local y también comprar gaseosas, golosinas, verduras, carnes, entre otros
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a woman who has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time.  This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan as she is a very entrepreneurial person who enjoys her work.  Her business is running a recreation center.  This is the main source of income for her household.

Luz Marina started her business more than nine years ago when her husband lost his job.  She bought the area where she has her business, making the most of the fact that the location has springs of water.  They modified the place with large basins of water, swimming pool style.  This attracts tourists from the city and she also has customers who hire the place out for different business or tourist events.  In her premises, she serves different dishes, soda, soft drinks and other various products.  She also provides a music service to meet her customers' tastes.  She is requesting this loan to make certain improvements to her premises and also to buy soda, candies, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.use: to buy soda, candies, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Lelia has a shop that sells eggs, snacks, candies and breads. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell.

Lelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 30 years old and is married with three children who are between 6 and 10 years old. She earns a living by selling goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, salt, drinks, cakes and so on. This is her second successful year in business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 8 am until 7 pm every day. She employs one person to help her. 

Epiphanie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more lotions, soap, sugar, salt, drinks, cakes and so on for resale. By adding more goods and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as soap, cooking oil, sugar, drinks etc. for resale.

loans.name: Sanare

texts.en:
Sanare, 40 years old, is married with four children. He has been in mixed farming for the past nine years.
He was introduced to KADET LTD  by a registered client in his abode. 

This is his second loan with which he plans to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plough back into his farming and to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to a higher level of education. He is an industrious man who will try  hard to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a committed 37 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with 3 children between 5 and 12 years old.  For the last 3 years he has been running a butcher shop to make a living. He supplements his income with the earnings from poultry farming.  In the next 5 years he wants to have opened up another butcher shop and to be a major distributor of eggs in his county. 

He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy cows to slaughter. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has now learned business management skills.

loans.use: to buy cows to slaughter

loans.name: Jose Favian

texts.es:
Jose Favian tiene 31 años es soltero, vive con un hijo de un año de edad. Vive en el Canton Chillanes Perteneciente a la Provincia Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece a la Parroquia San Jose del Tambo, en esta ventanilla son socios 24 personas que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, arroz, soya platano, yuca y naranja.

Jose Favian se dedica a la agricultura tiene cultivos de acao, arroz, soya, platano, yuca y naranja.Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El credtito lo solica para invertir en huertos de cacao, en comprar de abonos y fertilizantes, el credito le ayudara a dar mejor mantenimiento a los cuiltivos y tener una mejor cosecha. Enfrenta desafios como la falta de lluvia en los terrenos. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con el hijo.
texts.en:
Jose Favian is 31. He is single and lives with his one-year-old child. He lives in the Chillanes Canton, belonging to the Bolivar Province.

His communal bank is called El Placer and is located 60 minutes from the office. It belongs to the San Jose del Tambo Parish. There are 24 members, all farmers who sow cocoa, rice, soy, plantains, yucca and oranges.

Jose Favian is a farmer who has cocoa, rice, soy, plantain, yucca and orange crops. He makes his purchases in San Jose del Tambo and his sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

He is requesting this loan for investing in cocoa crops, through buying manure and fertilizer. This loan will help him to maintain his crops and have a better harvest. He confronts challenges such as lack of rainfall. His dream is to have his own home.

In his free time he enjoys going for walks with his son.

loans.use: to invest in cocoa crops.

loans.name: Guembe Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo surgió por promociones hechas acerca del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación, actualmente son 14 mujeres, todas ellas vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Se encuentran muy felices atravesando el quinto ciclo del programa.
Una de las miembros es la señora Zulma tiene una despensa bien surtida, con lo cual y gracias a su arduo trabajo puede ayudar en la casa. Comenta que gracias a la amabilidad con que atiene logra atraer a los clientes, además de eso ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, lo cual la ayuda mucho en el manejo de su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para el abastecimiento de su despensa con comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas, lácteos y demás con lo cual podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group was born as a result of the promotion activities run by the Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras program. The group is currently composed of 14 women, who are all friends and neighbor in their town. They are very happily working through their fifth cycle in the program.
Zulma is a member of this group. She has a well-stocked up small store, and as she works hard she is able to help her family. She told us that owing to her kind tending manners she succeed in attracting customers, and on top of this she considers herself as a very hard-working and tenacious woman, two qualities that help her a lot in managing her activity.
She is requesting a loan to stock up her pantry with groceries, drinks, vegetables and dairy products among others with which she will be able to tend to her customers’ requests.

loans.use: To buy groceries, drinks, vegetables and dairy products-

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Mbodze dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: C 2011 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Hasina is 53 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of 13 and 31 years old. She owns a business selling pineapples, passion fruits, apples, beans, vegetables and so on. She is the leader of this group, which is called "ABAHUJE" in the local language (she is the third person from the left side in the photo, in the white scarf). Hasina has been in this business for about two years. 

Hasina and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase their quantities of pineapples, passion fruits, apples, beans, vegetables and so on, to sell. Hasina and her team will reinvest their profits into their businesses and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business by cultivating more vegetables, fruits etc. to sell.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Hoeurn (in the photo) and her husband, Nay, are rice farmers. They have been married since 1975 and have six children (two sons and four daughters). Three are married and live outside the family home, two are garment workers, and another one assists his parents in the business. The family lives in a village about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Hoeurn is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to continue her farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide. She will also use a part of the loan to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and buy additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del centro poblado de Chinumani, distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  34  años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos, la señora estudió hasta 3ro de educación primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de cereales como chuño, papa, habas, cebada, tunta.

Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles comprará cinco sacos de chuño, tunta, papa, habas, cebada, occa y quinua, estos productos los vende en la ciudad de Tacna.  Su esposo trabaja como albañil, también venden chanchos en la localidad de Yunguyo.

El deseo de Graciela es tener más capital, tener más mercaderías y obtener buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the communal bank Santa Barbara in the town of Chinumani in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puna. She is 34 years old, married and has 5 children. She studied until 3rd grade of elementary school.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 5 years, and her first loan was for 300 soles and she used the money to invest in her business of selling grains and chuño and tunta [freeze-dried potatoes], potatoes, beans, and barley.

With this new loan in the amount of 1500 soles she will buy 5 sacks of chuño and tunta, potatoes, beans, barley, occa [a root vegetable], and quinoa. These products are sold in the city of Tacna. Her husband is a bricklayer, and he also sells pigs in the town of Yunguyo.

Graciela’s dream to to have more capital, to have more merchandise, and to have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of freeze-dried potatoes, potatoes, beans, barley, occa, and quinoa

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya is a married man with three children. One of his children is enrolled in school, the other two are still young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the family's basic needs. Baya owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and water. 

Baya has operated an electronics workshop for the past ten years; his potential clients are local residents. He faces a major challenge which is competition from other operators. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the KES 100,000 loan he wants to purchase electronic spare parts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial services to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase electronic spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Kimatullo

texts.ru: Киматулло житель района Дангары. Ему 44 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Более 15 лет занимается торговлей фруктов и овощей. Кредит берет для закупа овощей и фруктов.
texts.en: Kimatullo is a resident of the Dangara region. He is 44 years old, married and has two children. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for more than fifteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy carrots, onions, apples and pomegranates.

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions, apples and pomegranates.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Upendo Mhekela Group

texts.en:
Lusiana is a 54-year-old married woman with one child. She has been a coffee farmer for over 20 years. She has been challenged by lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. She has also started a business of buying and selling fish. 

Lusiana seeks a loan to pay for fertilizers and insecticides for her crops. Also she is thinking of increasing her scale of production from 13 to 22 acres in five years to come. By expanding her scale of production, she will be able to pay medical expenses and buy clothes.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 38 years old and married to Julius. They have four children.

She has been involved in her clothing business for the last 10 years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan to buy more clothing materials for sewing and selling.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for sewing and selling

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat is 27 years of age. She is married and has no child yet and lives in her father’s home.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her brother’s livestock business. With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits.

He is new in his business and Farhat is hopeful that an investment will help him earn higher profits and get more established in his business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Farhat.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her livestock business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 51 years old, married to Nicholas, and they are blessed with four children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 57,266 and she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Bossèdè Rosalie

texts.fr: Bossèdè Rosalie âgée de 37 ans, n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Bossèdè Rosalie est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Irénée. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Bossèdè Rosalie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple. Pour cette raison, Bossèdè Rosalie vend de la nourriture de façon ambulante depuis douze ans. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Bossèdè Rosalie achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Bossèdè Rosalie sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, du poisson et du maïs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO HAVE AN EYES SURGERY

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
M. Seng is a 27 year old wife and mother. She and her husband have two daughters and one son. Their oldest daughter attends school and their youngest two children stay at home. M. Seng and her husband run their own business of selling eye glasses and earn about $10 per day. 

M. Seng is requesting this loan of $1,000 to make improvements on their home and livelihood. She will use $450 to purchase land, $350 to purchase a buffalo, and $200 to build a fence around their home.  She is excited about being able to improve her families lives through these changes. 

M. Seng has taken other loans with CREDIT and she had no problem with the payments. In the future she would like to purchase a small stall in the market to sell her eye glasses in.

loans.use: Buy land, a buffalo, and build a fence around home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose Wangui Kagia intends to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy chemicals/ingredients for making the soaps

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: “I make wheat and barley flour at home, which my husband sells in the market. We have been doing this business in a village in Pakistan. It is easier for my husband to go out and do the transactions in the market place. Now we need a loan to purchase stock so that we can sell more in the market place. I have five children in school and I would like for them to continue their education.”

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Doña Hermelinda is originally from Huayucachi. She has been raising chickens in her home for the past 20 years which in turn she sells at the local mercado once the chickens are fully developed. Chicken meat is in high demand in this area due to its nutrional value. Her business has grown over the past years due to the good care Hermelinda gives to her chickens.

Hermelinda's motivation are her two children. Since she stays at home taking care of her chickens, she also spends a lot quality time with ther children. Hermelinda has big aspirations and one of them is to have her small chicken farm transform into a big and prosperous business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 USD to purchase more chicks and to purchase better food to feed her chickens. She comitts to repay this loan within 6 months. She thanks you for your generosity!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Hermelinda es natural de Huayucachi, y hace 20 años decidió criar gallinas en las humildes instalaciones de su hogar para que a su madurez total pueda comercializarlas en el mercado de su localidad; debido a la demanda y al alto contenido proteico esta carne de ave es muy solicitada por las madres de familia para el alimento de sus pequeños en crecimiento y desarrollo continuo, con el tiempo este pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo y cada vez es más solicitado debido al cuidado que les profesa Hermelinda, en la actualidad su mayor motivación son sus dos pequeños hijos a los que atiende diariamente y gracias a que esta actividad la puede realizar en casa puede otorgarles mucho amor y dedicación.Doña Hermelinda tiene grandes aspiraciones y una de ellas es ver su pequeña granja de pollos convertida en todo una avícola, para ello es que solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de más y mejor alimento para sus gallinas y la compra de más pollitos para criarlos hasta su madurez y te extiende el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses y te agradece tu noble colaboración para llevar a cabo su propósito.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and food to feed the chickens

loans.name: Mamah

texts.en: Mamah is 40 years old and is married. She sells clothes on credit and goes door to door to sell her products. She usually earns $10 per day. Her husband sells clothes in the market. She needs more capital to expand her business, due to the small profit margin of her husband's clothes business. Mamah is a member of MBK and requests a IDR 900,000 loan. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Mr. Celso Martinez works in furniture manufacturing and sales. This business, which he and his wife run, is his family's sole source of income. They would like to invest in the business without losing profits, so they are requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy the materials needed to manufacture wood furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Celso M. se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera y venta. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Queremos invertir le mas al negocio pero sin descapitalizarnos. Así que solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de materia prima para la elaboración de muebles de madera.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make wood furniture

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Fatuma P.. She is married with two children, ages 18 months and 10, and has one other dependent who is her niece. In 2007 Fatuma established a pharmacy business and now requires a loan of $175 in order to increase her inventory of medicine. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Kisakye A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Florence A.. She sells used clothing and is requesting a loan to expand business. Florence is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children ranging in age from age 3 months to 10 years old, and her children go to school.

Each week, Florence makes approximately 50000 UGX (about $30) profit. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to provide for the basic needs of the family and home. Previously, Florence had a loan from BRAC Uganda for 200000 UGX (about $120) in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Florence is joined in her small group by Amina N., Topista N., and Rose N.. Amina N. has a retail shop and wants to purchase more items to sell in the shop. Topista N. sells second-hand clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell and expand the business. Rose N. runs a retail shop and wants to increase the stock of goods in the shop.

loans.use: To expand the clothing business and earn more to support her family

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married woman with two children, ages 2-12 years old. Rehema is a soft drink seller; she started this business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Sri

texts.id:
Mrs Sri I., 42 years old, sells foods which are categorized as "Sembako" or nine basic necessities. This business is quite good as she has a lot of customers from her neighbors. Twice a week she buys her merchandises from Badung Market. Her eldest son usually drives her to the market in a motorcycle.

She wants to use the loan money to expand her Sembako business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Sri I. mulai menekuni usaha jual Sembako sejak tahun 2000. Usahanya cukup lancar karena disekitar tempat tinggalnya hanya dia yang berjualan dan biasanya konsumennya adalah mereka yang kost disekitar tempat itu. Dua (2) seminggu dia belanja bahan-bahan di Pasar Badung, dan biasanya dia diantar oleh anak sulungnya menggunakan sepeda motor. Ibu berusia 42 tahun ini bisa membiayai kebutuhan keluarganya dan juga pendidikan anaknya dengan keuntungan dari jualan Sembako. Ibu Sri I. sangat mengharapkan bantuan modal usaha untuk pengembangan toko Sembako miliknya.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margoth has an internal fortitude motivated by the love of a mother for her only child. She has gotten ahead after many failures that didn’t permit her to practice her profession as a teacher. Not long ago, she decided to sell groceries at a stand in the market and it has proven to be a good option to sustain her family on a daily basis; the family includes only her son and her mother, with whom she shares her days. She greatly enjoys her mother’s company, and she now wishes to increase her merchandise and that way grow her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Margoth, tiene una fortaleza interna motivada por el amor de madre hacia su único hijo. Ella sale adelante después de muchos fracasos que no le permitían ejercer su profesión de maestra. Hace poco decidió vender abarrotes en un puesto de mercado la cual ha sido y es una buena opción para lograr el sustento diario de su familia: que son únicamente su hijo y su madre con quienes comparte los días. Ella disfruta mucho de la compañía de su madre y ahora su deseo es incrementar su mercadera y así acrecentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
H. Shavkat is 34 years old. He is married and the loving father of five children. Shavkat is a farmer. Shavkat is a strong physical and spiritual man. He plows the land to the best of his abilities. Thanks to his energy and high spirit, he has been able to support his family for 10 years and to offer them an education as well. Shavkat sows potatoes, onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

Each year he is growing sufficient crops to feed his family and the rest to sell. At the same time, Shavkat is raises cattle. He buys cattle on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. Now that the business is stable, Shavkat believes it shall be the main income for his family in the future as his dearest children are growing up, and accordingly the expenses are raising.

Today Shavkat requests 600 $ US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Shavkat thanks everyone who trusted him and supports him today. He promises to pay the loan in a timely manner. Be an important part of the growth of Shavkat’s business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dinh Thi B. is 43 years old. Before joining the TYM Fund, she had a lot of difficulties in life because her husband passed away. In 1999, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in breeding animals. Later, she used the borrowed money to buy waste materials and resell them to wholesalers. This activity helps stabilizing her family economy. Being hardworking, she raised her 2 children on her own. She is currently invest in decorative plants to sell to local people and people from other towns. She wants to borrow 600 USD to buy more materials for her business. Her average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đinh Thị Bích năm nay 43 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớm. Năm 1999 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư các dự án phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi sau đó chị vay thêm vốn để đi mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý. Công việc buôn bán phế liệu đã giúp cho thu nhập của gia đình chị ổn định hơn. Là người phụ nữ chăm chỉ, chịu khó chị đã cố gắng làm ăn và nuôi được hai con khôn lớn. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang đầu tư vào làm chậu trồng cây cảnh bán cho nhân dân địa phương và các vùng lân cận. Chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua nguyên vật liệu phục vụ sản xuất. Thu nhập : 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: buy materials for business

loans.name: Nataša

texts.en: Nataša is a young woman from the town of Doboj.  She is not married and supports herself by working in a local coffee bar.  Since her income from this job is pretty small - around 260 USD per month - Nataša wants to try her luck with a second business. She wants to start selling cosmetics and thinks this will be a good way to increase her overall income.  This is her first loan from Zene za Zene, which she requests in the amount of 600 KM, and all of it will go towards building this side business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Yawovi Mawulom

texts.fr:
Monsieur M. Yawovi Mawulom est né le 30 novembre 1978 à Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Zio. Il est célibataire avec un enfant. Il a ouvert un magasin «  MINI PHARMA DIEU EST GRAND » de vente des produits génériques  dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Son objectif en exerçant cette activité est de sauver des vies humaines à coût réduit.
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’aller s’approvisionner au Ghana en produits génériques pour un total de sept cartons afin de pouvoir servir la population. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra aussi subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Yawovi Mawulom M. was born on November 30, 1978 in Mission Tové in Zio Prefecture. He is single and has a child. He opened a store called “MINI PHARMA DIEU EST GRAND” selling generic pharmaceutical products in the Agoè district of Lomé. The objective of his work is to save human lives at a reduced cost. This first loan that he is requesting will enable him to get supplies of generic pharmaceuticals in Ghana totaling seven boxes in order to be able to serve the people. And thus, with the income from this business, he will also be able to provide for himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Ngwafu

texts.en:
G. is married and has four children with Nche Nji Michael. 

G. dropped out of school early because her parents were unable to continue her education. She was then pushed   to marry early in order to care for herself. As a child with her parents G. practiced a lot of farm work. Now in her husband's house she continues to use the skills of hard work and farming practices, and is able to support and cater to the needs of her family. Her yield from her activity is always good and she always has a ready market. She provides a lot of corn and beans to the community; people buy from her and go to resell at long distances.

Since joining GHAPE in 2006, G. has been able to take and repay two loans. This will be her third loan, which she will use for farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides and beans.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou B. est âgé de 31 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (une des préfectures de la   troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) dans la concession paternelle avec sa maman et ses frères et soeurs.
Très tôt  Seydou B. a abandonné l’école pour mener  les activités économiques notamment l’achat et la vente de bicyclettes neufs et surtout d’occasions qu’il a appris  auprès de son cousin. 
Avec une experience de 8 ans, Monsieur Bagayogo maîtrise parfaitemenet cette activité et jouit d’une notoriété exemplaire et enviable à Bougouni. Il est beaucoup sollicité pendant les périodes de fêtes et la veille de la rentrée des classes car chaque enfant veut avoir une bicyclette.
C’est dans le souci d’agrandir la taille de son activité qu’il décida de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, 15 bicyclettes tout terrain. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la republique du Mali)
La vente de ses bicyclettes se fait au marché de Bougouni à une  clientéle composée de toutes les franches de la population.
Monsieur Seydou B. vend ses bicyclettes au comptant ou à crédit payable mensuellement. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA.qui servira essentiellement  à  agrandir son entreprise et  assurer les dépenses de la famille.  Son ambition est d’associer à ses activités autres articles tels la vente de moto d’occasions et de pièces de vehicules.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou B., 31, is married and the father of one child. He lives with his wife and his child in the Torakabougou district of the town of Bougouni (one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) in his father’s holdings, together with his mother and his sisters and brothers.

Seydou B. left school at a young age to go out into the business world, selling in particular new bicycles and especially used ones, a business he learned from his cousin. With 8 years’ experience, Mr. Bagayogo is perfectly at home in this business and has an exemplary and enviable reputation in Bougouni. He has lots of customers during the holiday season and just before school begins, since every child wants to have a bicycle.

With a view to expanding his business, he came to Soro Yiriwaso through whom he is presently requesting his first loan. With this loan he intends to buy 15 all-terrain bikes. He does his buying in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). He sells the bicycles in the market in Bougouni to a clientele composed of all sorts of people.

Mr. Seydou B. sells his bicycles for cash, or on credit with monthly payments. He expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA which he will use to expand his business and support his family. His ambition is to add other lines to his business, for example used motorcycles and spare parts for cars.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bicycles for re-sale

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en: How sweet is success in the field! Precilla P., who is 64 years old, lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, in the Philippines. She shared her happiness that her children were able to lead a better life because of rice farming, now that most of them have finished school and are married. “For 20 years I have been in rice farming, helping my husband do all the dirty work in the field, just to feed our 8 children,” she says. Because this is their only source of income, they exert every effort to make their rice-farming business sustainable. She owns a 1-hectare rice field and hires additional help during planting and harvesting. Their harvest has reached an average of 100 sacks during peak season, which is more than enough to sustain the family. Their main buyer is KC Marketing in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. In order to maintain this bountiful harvest and quality of produce, she is requesting for a loan to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
