Tiene que levantarse todos los días temprano su labor es desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche ya que sus diferentes clientes siempre llegan a comprar sus diferentes productos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de huevo, queso, leña,  leche, mantequilla entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa has two young children and she is responsible for them. She has had a bakery for 10 years which has benefitted her. She gets up very early each morning and works from 8:00am to 10:00pm because her costumers go to buy her products throughout the day.

Maria has had satisfactory experience working with credit. The loan will be used to buy eggs, cheese, milk, butter and fire-wood among other ingredients and supplies.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en:
Chreng S., 62, is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits from her business to repair her house. 

S. sells food, earning an income of about $5 per day. She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being well supplied with fresh water from major rivers. Every month, the family has to spend $44 on food, $10 on electricity and $45 on other necessary expenses. Her two children are employed as construction workers, earning an income of about $3 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena N. is from the town of Talibon. She is 43 years old and married. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She started her business five years ago and earns approximately $75 per month.

Lucena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nicasia; ella tiene 52 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. golosinas, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en un colegio D. la ciudad D. Cusco, la socia trabaja desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como chupetes, chicles y caramelos al por mayor.   
           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This member pertains to the communal bank, “MADRES TRABAJADORAS” (Working Mothers).  This bank is located in the Cusco District, pertaining to the Province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco.  

This is Nicasia of 52 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Her day varies between buying and selling sweets.  She owns a small stall at a school in Cusco and works from 9:00am until 6:00pm.  From this business, she has been able to proviD. her children with a better quality of life.  She would like to broaden her business and is seeking a loan in order to be able to purchase sweets such as suckers, gum, and hard candy in bulk.  She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: Purchase sweets in bulk, such as suckers, gum, and hard candy.

loans.name: Estelle Rajy

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 32ans d’âge, restauratrice dans son quartier à coté d’un atelier de menuiserie. 
Après son échec au baccalauréat et son accouchement , elle a préférer faire des petit plats qu’ elle vend pour subvenir aux besoins quotidiens, à ce jour elle prépare plusieurs plats et a un restaurant où chacun vient manger avec appétit.

Avant le premier  prêt , ses revenus étaient de  30.000F par jour, en augmentant son activité, car elle a ajouté la boisson et autres denrées qui attirent ses clients. Ses revenus sont maintenant  à plus de 80.000F. Le prochain prêt viendra pour améliorer ses conditions de vente et ouvrir un restaurant plus moderne.

Elle vend pour aider ses parents qui sont à la retraite à s’occuper de ses petit frères et sœurs qui vont à l’école.
texts.en:
A 32-year old woman who runs a diner in her district next to a joiner’s workshop.
After failing her qualifying exam for entering college and giving birth to her child, she has decided to cook meals for sale in order to support herself. She  continues to cook various dishes and has an eatery where all enjoy coming to eat.  

Before her first loan, her sales were 30,000 West African Francs per day. She expanded her business by offering drinks and other staples to attract customers. Her sales are now over 80,000. The next loan will serve to improve her vending conditions and help modernize her diner. She runs this business to help her retired parents and to provide for her younger brothers and sisters, who are in school.

loans.use: Purchasing boxes of fresh groceries, oil jugs,  seasoning, dishes,  kitchen utensils

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor Kayis 67 years old.  She is married and has one child.  She resides with her family in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. 

K. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband sells traditional kitchen utensils, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 56 on food and USD 13 on other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Maharoumba

texts.fr: Dame  Maharoumba  est mariée  avec  2  enfants  à   charge.   Elle a  50 ans  et  habite  quartier  Wessomé.   Elle  est  revendeuse  d’une  boisson locale  communément  appelé  dans  la langue maternelle au Togo  Tchoukoutchou.  Elle a commencé  cette  activité  en  2000  et  s’approvisionne au  marché d’assiyéyé  à  adidogomé.    Ensuite elle  revend  la  boisson  à  son domicile.   Elle  sollicite  un  prêt  pour  acheter  6  sacs  de mil. Mais actuellement elle n'a pas de stock.
texts.en:
Maharoumba is a married woman with two children in her care. She is 50 years old and lives in the Wessomé neighbourhood. She sells a millet-based beverage locally called Tchoukoutchou. She started this activity in 2000. She gets her supplies at the market of Assiyéyé, in Adidogomé, and then sells the beverage from her home. 

She is seeking a loan to buy six sacks of millet as her stocks are currently depleted.

loans.use: To buy millet

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en:
Zaira and her husband live in the village of Sartichala, Kartli Region. She is 56 years old. She works as a cook in a local shelter for the homeless and old persons. Her husband works as a car painter. Besides their jobs, the family has small farming business. They have two milch cows. With the milk Zaira regularly produces cheese and sells it to cheese retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is appx. 400 GEL. 

This is Zaira’s third loan from Credo. The previous loan was used for house renovation. Now Zaira requests 1700 GEL, the biggest part of which will be used to purchase an additional milch cow. A small part will be used for covering of the previous loan. This will allow Zaira to produce more cheese and increase their income. Zaira hopes that she will use the increased income to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milch cow.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yiriwa est composé de six femmes mariées majoritairement  dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le village Dougounikoro dans la commune rurale de Sanando dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de galettes à base de mil,  de céréales (mil), de gousses d’arachide grillées, d’ustensiles plastics et du bois de chauffe. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djènèba Touré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de mil au village avec les producteurs de céréales pour la transformer petit à petit en galettes. 
Pour faire de la galette, on décortique le mil, le débarrasse du son, le lave, le fait moudre, le mélange avec la  farine du blé et de la levure avant de le pétrir avec de l’eau simple. On  laisse au repos la pâte obtenue pendant 5 heures de temps au moins avant de la frire avec de l’huile. 
La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à la porte de la concession tôt le matin à une clientèle mixte. Madame Djènèba Touré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux petits besoins du foyer et réinvestir dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Yiriwa group is made up of six married women, the majority of whom live in monogamous families; they average 39 years of age with four children each. They live in the village of Dougounikoro in the rural commune of Sanando in the Ségou region (Mali's fourth administrative region), and got to know each other through neighbors, relatives and via marriages. 

The group members have small businesses making and selling pancakes made out of millet, as well as trading in cereals (millet), grilled peanut pods, plastic utensils and firewood. Since they needed to increase their business, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. 

Mrs. Djènèba Touré is planning on using her loan to buy three sacks of millet from cereal producers in the village, in order to make them up progressively into pancakes. 

In order to make the pancakes, one has to husk the millet, dispose of the bran, wash it, grind it, mix it with the wheat flour and yeast before kneading it with plain water. One leaves the dough to rest for at least five hours before frying it in oil. 

She sells the pancakes for cash and on credit at the concession gate early in the morning to a diverse customer base. Mrs. Touré is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA with this loan and this will be used to provide for small household needs and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase millet

loans.name: Lizeth Margarita

texts.es:
Lizeth pequeña comerciante, de ropa, ropa interior, cosmético, logrando hace años comercializar sus productos en su casa de habitación, así como en oficinas y clientes del barrio. Es madre de dos hijos, el cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Comenzó a vender más, y comprar estilo de ropa con financiamiento que la institución de Afodenic, logro dar atreves del préstamo, siendo el sexto ciclo, lo que para su comercio ha sido de excelente inversión.
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en compra de ropa para damas como: faldas, camisas, blúmer, short, cosméticos, así como ropa para caballeros. Partes de estos productos los da al crédito. Lo que espera seguir proyectándose a mejores resultados de economía.
texts.en:
For many years Lizeth has run a small business selling clothing, underwear, and cosmetics from her home as well as to neighbours and people in nearby offices. She has two children; her husband also helps support the family.

With her sixth loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, Lizeth started to sell more items and bought new lines of clothing and that has proved to be a good investment. With this new loan she plans to buy women’s clothing such as skirts, shirts, bloomers, shorts, and cosmetics, as well as men’s clothing. She will let customers have some of these products on credit. Lizeth hopes that this new stock will help her earn more money.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Soraya Gisella

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Para Un Futuro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Soraya, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, dos mayores de edad y cuatro menores de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela, todos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es obrero.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, aguas, sodas, jugos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados. Los productos los compra en Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva con su tienda un año y que la empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque con el crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the subdivision of Rocafuerte, the members of the community bank "Trabajando Para Un Futuro" (working for a future) meet every two weeks. This place is known for the delicious sweets - known throughout the country - made by the locals and for the warm and hardworking people. 

We met Soraya here. She is 40 years old, is married and has six children, two adults and and four children who are in school. All of her children still live with her. Her husband is a laborer. 

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, waters, soft drinks and juices among other things. She works every day from 6:00am until 8:00pm and sometimes later. Her children and her husband help her with her work when they are not busy. She buys the products in Portoviejo although the majority are delivered to her. She tells us that she has had her store for a year and she started it with the first loan she received from the bank. 

She will use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other essential products. She has been with the community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because with the loan she started her business. 

Her goals are to succeed in her business and that her store will grow every day.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other essentials.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a married mother of two children who works hard to support her family. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store. Imelda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business. She has kept her business going through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 43-year-old man who has four children. His wife Rehab is a driving teacher. Having experience in this field (teaching driving), Khaled decided to open a school to teach driving and mechanicA. skills. Now his school, “Asem for Driving Teaching” as he called it, has been running for two years. During these two years, he has obtained over 10 cars to use to teach driving. 

Now Khaled has applied for a loan to add more cars and he want to improve the inside training rooms.

loans.use: To add more driver training cars and improve the training room decor .

loans.name: Nancy Pilar

texts.es:
Nancy Pilar tiene 33 años, es soltera vive con la madre, tiene una hija. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

nancy se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es salir adelante.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Nancy Pilar is 33 years old, single, and lives with her mother.  She has one daughter.  They live in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "Unidos Venceremos" (Together We Shall Overcome).  It is located in La América, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Nancy grows crops, especially corn and rice.  She has been doing this for a long time.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and makes her sales in the market in the same town.

Nancy is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pest infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to get ahead.

Nancy enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: San Jose Las Juquilitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San José las Juquilitas,  sus integrantes  decidieron ponerle así   por que son muy devotos a la virgen de Juquila , este grupo se encuentra en el pueblo de San Miguel del Progreso.
El grupo San José las Juquilitas  cuenta con mas de diez integrantes, también tiene una representante de grupo se llama  Gregoria cuenta con una escolaridad de  nivel medio superior.
Este grupo esta conformado  por  trece integrantes once son mujeres  y dos son hombres .
Uno de sus integrantes la señora  Brenda ,  tiene  treinta siete años  de edad ,cuenta con  la escolaridad la secundaria terminada ,  tiene  tres hijos muy trabajadores e inteligentes , tres mujeres y un varón. La señora  Brenda  se dedica a lo que es la repostería , siempre la a gustado hacer  pasteles. Desde muy chica  vendía pasteles  de  casa en casa , pero con el, paso y conloar ahorros a podido comprarse sus cosas y  hacer sus propios , postres y pasteles en su casa cuenta con muchos clientes .
La razón por la cual pidió su préstamo es para poder rentar un local y poder vender sus pasteles ahí, para  que las personas que vayan al puebla de  san Juan del progreso pruebe sus pasteles y vuelva a visitarla.
Le gustaría   hacer de sus  ganancias una de las mejores  pastelerías de su localidad San José del Progreso ,para  tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para las personas que mas quiere que son su esposo Pablo y sus hijos Brenda , Miriam , Lourdes y Gustavo.
Los otros   doce integrantes del grupo son:
María del Carmen-la venta de zapatos.
Elena –venta de comida.
Catalina-para la venta de comida
Bertha-la compra y venta de ropa.
Teodora-la compra de materiales para  hacer tamales.
Fabiola- para la venta de calzado.
Celia- para la venta de ropa.
Eleazar-compra de material de albañilería.
Manuel-materiales para el campo.
Beatriz-para la compra de pollo.
Brenda-para la venta y compra de calzado.

Todos los que conforman el grupo  José las Ju quilitas le dan las gracias al equipo de trabajo de fundación realidad por el apoyo que les a dado.
texts.en:
This group is called San José las Juquilitas.  The members decided upon this name because they are very devoted to the virgin of Juquila.  The group is located in the town of San Miguel de Progreso.  The San José las Juquilitas group has over ten members.  Gregoria is the group representative.  She has a high school education.

The group is comprised of 13 members, 11 women and 2 men.  Brenda is one of the members.  She is 37 years old, and she has a high school education.  She has three daughters and a son who are very hard-working and intelligent.  Brenda makes pastry.  She has always liked making cakes.  When she was a girl she sold cakes door to door. 

However, with time and savings she was able to buy her things and make her own desserts and cakes in her house.  She has a lot of customers.  The reason that she requested the loan is to be able to rent a spot to be able to sell her cakes there.  She wants the people who go to the town of San Juan del Progresso to taste her cakes and come back to see her.  

She would like to use her earnings to make one of the best pastry shops in San José del Progreso.  She wants this in order to have a better quality of life for her and for the people who she loves the most.  That would be her husband, Pablo, and her children; Brenda, Miriam, Lourdes, and Gustavo.

The other 12 members of the group are:

María del Carmen-sells shoes
Elena –sells food
Catalina-to sell food
Bertha-to buy and sell clothes
Teodora-to buy materials to make tortillas
Fabiola-sells footwear
Celia- to sell clothes
Eleazar-will buy brickmaking materials
Manuel-will buy materials for the fields
Beatriz-to buy chicken
Brenda-to buy and sell shoes

All of the members of the José de las Juquilitas group give thanks to the team of workers at the Fundación Realidad for the support they have given them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pastry.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Mr. Meng, 41, is a poor man who has worked hard and operated his farming business for over four years. On average, Mr. Meng is able to earn around $3.50 each day for their daily expenses. As a part-time job, he often goes to buy some firewood to burn in order to produce charcoal and his wife normally takes the charcoal from him, as well as buying some from other charcoal producers, to sell in their community in Siem Reap Province. 

The couple tries to help each other to support their four children, all of whom are still living under their roof and depend on their daily income. Mr. Meng will be using his loan for purchasing additional firewood to burn into charcoal that he can sell and he will get more profit from his charcoal-selling business. For the remainder of the fund, he intends to plant potatoes and purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to burn into charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 39 years old and married to Benter. They have four children.

He has been running his fish business for the past 10 years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 6,000 that he uses to take care of his family and pump back into his business.

He has been loaned KES 20,000 by KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock of fish for sale. He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children.

In the future, he hopes to improve the living standards of his family by building a house and educating his children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fish.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia, de 48 años es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo muy alegre y soñadora; vive con dos sus dos hijas. Ellas y su conviviente residen en una casa propia en el distrito de Manantay. El trabajo de Nimia es muy duro, ella se tiene que levantar muy temprano en busca de pollos frescos y grandes al mejor precio en el mercado de la Bellavista, el mercado de la ciudad. Por las noches, prepara todo para vender en la vereda de su casa, tiene la ayuda de sus dos hijas y viene trabajando ya dos años en este negocio.
Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que puede trabajar a lado de sus hijas y así enseñarles  desde pequeñas el valor de la responsabilidad sin descuidar los estudios. Nimia siente que su negocio es muy rentable ya que vende un mínimo de cinco pollos al día que le genera una buena ganancia.Ella quisiera poder tener una ramada más grande y poder poner ahí una tienda de venta de pollos grande.Este es el tercer préstamo entre Nimia y la institución MFP esta muy contenta pues considera que en su grupo son responsables y todos se llevan bien.	
Con el préstamo solicitado 1500 soles, ella comprará materiales para armar un local mas grande en su casa, también comprar menajeria para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nimia, 48, is a hardworking, responsible and, above all, very cheerful and a dreamer.  She lives with her two daughters.  She and her spouse live in a house of their own in Manantay District.  Nimia’s work is very hard.  She has to rise very early to seek out fresh, large chickens at the best possible price in the Bellavista Market, the city’s market.  At night, she prepares everything to sell along the path at her house.  Her two daughters help her and she’s been working in this business for two years now.

What she likes about the work is being able to work alongside her daughters and teaching them from a very young age to value responsibility while not neglecting their studies.  Nimia feels that her business is very profitable since she sells a minimum of five chickens daily generating good profits.  She’d like to have a larger space to install a bigger chicken store.  This is Nimia’s third loan from MFP and she is very happy because she considers her group to be very responsible and they all get along well together.  She will use the requested 1500 new sol loan to buy building materials to enlarge the space in her house and will also buy more kitchenware to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to buy kitchenware.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh is a 42-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She lives with her husband, one son and one daughter. She has operated a food stall for five years in her local community. Her husband also helps her to sell noodles.

Binh would like a loan to purchase new furniture and a greater quality and quantity of food to sell from her stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and food for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children. One of her children is currently in school. Rose has a business of a restaurant, which she has had for 9 years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for the restaurant, for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business. Rose is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by easily accessing loans from BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase food for the restaurant, for resale.

loans.name: Tsiagu

texts.en:
Tsiagu is a 30-year-old woman who is married and a mother of three, all of whom are below fifteen years of age. She lives with her family in a two-bedroom house in Ntahbessi, a quarter in Nkwen, in the Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.

Tsiagu is a very committed and hardworking business lady who owns a store in the Nkwen market. Her hard work and commitment have earned her many customers who demand a variety of goods which she cannot stock with her minimal capital. With the help of a loan from GHAPE, she will be able to stock foodstuff like maize, beans, rice and groundnuts which are in high demand. She really believes that this business will be successful because she already has many customers, and has a committed and hardworking spirit.

Her business is helpful to the community because she will increase the variety of goods in the market, making things readily available at moderate prices. She has been through some tough times in her life, such as the death of loved ones, ill health and poverty (which made it difficult to educate her children). 
With the profit from her loan, she will be able to educate her children very well, and to feed, clothe and provide medication for them.

She  prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, and also because of the training the staff offers. The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase groundnuts, beans, maize and rice.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marisol, la socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica  al transporte, la socia tiene una combi la cual está inscrita dentro del servicio urbano, la combi de la socia presta servicio de transporte urbano en la misma ciudad del Cusco en una de las rutaa; La socia en esta ocasión requiere el crédito para poder invertir en el mantenimiento de sus unidad vehicular, ella comprara algunos repuestos y también un llanta para que lo tenga de repuesto en caso amerite. La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de repuestos y una llanta para su unidad vehicular y esta siga operando en la ruta, la socia trabaja mucho para dar lo mejor a su menor y terminar de construir su vivienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de repuestos y una llanta para su combi.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “MUJERES UNIDAS” ["United Women"] Communal Bank, located in the San Jeronimo District in the Province and Department of Cusco.
This is Mrs. Marisol. She is 33, single, and has one child. She works in transportation and has a combi [a 12-passenger van] which is registered for urban service. She offers an urban transportation service in Cusco on a route through the city. She currently needs a loan to invest in maintenance for her vehicle. She will buy certain spare parts and a spare tire in case she needs it. She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of spare parts and a tire for her vehicle in order to keep operating her route. She works a lot in order to offer her child the best and finish building her home. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of spare parts and a tire for her combi.

She thanks you for your support and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of spare parts and a tire for her combi [a 12-passenger van].

loans.name: Abdukhalim

texts.ru: Абдухалим женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Он ответственный и целеустремленный человек. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Абдухалим в основном  выращивает лук. Он хочет купить минеральных удобрений для переработки земли с целью получения хорошего урожая. А также ему нужны деньги для оплаты труда работников. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 10000 Сомони. Он заранее благодарить всех кредиторов, кто будут поддерживать его.
texts.en: Abdukhalim is married and is a loving father of four children.  He is a responsible and goal-oriented person.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops.  Abdukhalim primarily grows onions.  He wants to buy mineral fertilizers to treat the land in order to get a good harvest.  He also needs money to pay for his employees' work.  This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 Somoni.  Abdukhalim thanks all creditors, who will support him.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay employees

loans.name: Sukea

texts.en:
Sukea, 26, is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $2.90 per day. They have one child who is three years old. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $6 on electricity, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her and her husband to use for traveling to work. Sukea wants to open a grocery shop to sell along the road when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her and her husband to use for traveling to work

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a Kenyan lady age twenty two years, married with four children with ages ranging from one to nine years old. She runs a beauty salon which is located on the estate where she lives. She has been in the business for three years. She will use her loan of kes 20,000 to buy the salon equipment. She hopes to grow her business and open another one in future. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. Florence is very religious and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es: Miriam Del Socorro tiene 50 años,  tiene cuatro hijos, los cuales aun son él 19 años depende de ella. Miriam se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, pues quiere realizar este financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, clavos, alfajillas entre otros. Ella siempre se esfuerza por mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que es muy importante para ella y su familia.  Es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Miriam Del Socorro, age 50, has four children.  Only the 19 year old is still dependent upon her.

Miriam sells general merchandise.

She wants this loan to buy construction materials like zinc metal sheeting, wood for windows and doors, nails, and other materials.  She always endeavors to improve the condition of her house, which is very important to her and to her family.  She is a hard-working, honest, and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy zinc metal sheeting, wood for windows and doors, nails, and other materials.

loans.name: Mulongo

texts.en:
Mulongo is a married woman with three children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family income. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mulongo has been weaving items (mats and baskets) and selling them for the past six years. Her clients are people at the marketplace. Her major challenge is customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more mats and baskets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more mats and baskets for resale.

loans.name: Amani W G Group

texts.en:
Nalulwe is the facilitator of the Amani W group. Nalulwe and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Nalulwe and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Nalulwe takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Nalulwe had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Nalulwe was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Nalulwe will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Amani W group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Nalulwe is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Montana

texts.en:
Montana is 54 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Montana runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Montana has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years, and she earns additional income from fishing, farming rice, and food vending. Montana aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавджуда замужем. Имеет троих детей. Муж работает автослесарем. У них дружная семья. Они стараются работать лучше для улучшения своих жилищных условий. У неё свой магазин с продуктами. Она закупает товар на рынке. У нее свой круг клиентов, которых она рада обслужить. Она хочет получить займ в размере 3000 долларов США  для  расширения ассортимента своих товаров. Ведь к праздникам торговля будет хорошей. Она надеется на вашу поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Mavjuda is married and has three children. Her husband works as a car mechanic. Everyone in their family gets along well with each other. Mavjuda and her husband are trying to work harder to improve their living conditions. Mavjuda has her own food store, which she stocks with products from the market. She has her regular customers whom she is always happy to serve. Mavjuda would like to obtain a loan in the amount of $3000 in order to expand the assortment of her products, since trade will be brisk during the holidays. She is hoping for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase more food products for her store

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima lives in Yeghegnavan village with her husband. The couple earns a living by cultivating their rented land. Rima has applied for a loan in order to cultivate the land; she plans to purchase watermelon seeds. Rima hopes to get a good harvest in the spring and earn additional income from the sales.

loans.use: to pay for watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Abul

texts.en:
Abul is a 39-year-old, married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has run a charcoal selling business in Bor, South Sudan for three years.
Abul is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Reseda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reseda está en su 2ºciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Son mujeres emprendedoras donde la mayoría tiene sus actividades particulares, pero se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Ramona es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, comenta que siempre tiene muchos clientes que le llevan los trabajos y que quedan contentos con lo que hace. Por medio de su lucha diaria y a través de su esfuerzo están pudiendo salir adelante y sobresalir.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The group “Reseda” is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can move forward. They are enterprising women and most of them have private businesses. They are helping one another.

Ramona is part of this group. She is a seamstress and says that she always has many customers who bring her sewing jobs since they are pleased with her work. Ramona strives each day and through her efforts she is able to move forward and succeed. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabric and thread. This will allow her to continue her work and fulfill her outstanding orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 26 years old and married, with 1 child.  She has operated a retail shop business for 2 years, and will be using the loan to purchase retail goods such as sugar, soap, and tea-leaves to sell.

Winnie hopes this loan will enable her to make more income to provide for the needs of her family.  Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, make additional income, and educate her child up through the university level.

loans.use: to purchase retail goods such as sugar, soap, and tea-leaves to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: My name is Rosa A. I work producing and selling Mondongo Soup (Intestines and Belly Soup) and tamales, my business has about 5 years, my clients are great because my product has an excellent flavor and my business location is in the capital’s market, my business produces income to support my family, my goal is to increase my sales and with the profits I get I would be able to buy kitchen supplies (big casseroles) and support my family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, poultry, pork, spices, salt, water, corn, wood, intestines, sugar, cookies, olives.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.en:
I have dedicated myself to taxi driving for four years, helping people on the streets and also favored clients who call my cell phone so I can pick them up personally and take them to their destination. At the moment my car has a few problems, and I need to change some parts and get new tires so I can continue to offer a good service.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cuatro anos me dedico a este rubro, atiendo personas en las calles y tambien algunas personas de confianza que llaman a mi celular para que los transporte a su destino. En este momento mi carro tiene algunas fallas por lo que necesito cambiarle algunas piezas y las llantas para poder brindar un buen servicio.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Mercedes Elena

texts.en:
Mercedes is 32 years old with three children. She and her husband are farmers who grow corn and coffee beans. With this loan she will invest in fertilizers that inhibit the growth of weeds that weaken their harvest. They sell their produce in San Cristobal de las Casas which is located two hours from their home. She is part of the Grupo Santa Catarina 3.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

MERCEDES TIENE 32 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS, ELLA Y SU ESPOSO SON CAMPESINOS, COSECHAN MAIZ Y CAFE. CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN FERTILIZANTES Y LIQUIDOS QUE AYUDAN A PREVENIR EL CRECIMIENTO DE HIERBAS MALIGNAS QUE NO PERMITEN TENER UNA BUENA COSECHA. SUS PRODUCTOS LO LLEVAN A VENDER A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS UBICADO A DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SANTA CATARINA 3.

loans.use: CAMPESINA

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is 25 years old and is single. He lives in Yenikand village of the Salyan region. He has a small plot of land that he has been farming for 4 years.Now he would like a  loan of $1200 to buy orchard medicines and an additional plot of land.

loans.use: To buy orchard medicines and a plot of land

loans.name: Janali

texts.en:
Mr. Janali is a vulnerable, low income young man.  He is single and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.  

Janali already has three pedigree cows but the income from them is too low to support Janali's family.  That is why he decided to apply to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher.  In the Caucasus region, the price of a good cow is about $800-1000, but Janali has some money of his own to add.

loans.use: To buy a pure-bred milk cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Mary is married in 1980 and has 4 children, one son and 3 daughters. She is running a cleaning motorbike station since 2005. Her husband is also assisting her in this business. Her husband, Mr. Samrith Chith is a cooker for the wedding ceremony. Two of their children are living under their custody and the other two daughters are married and have moved to live in different house.   

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time with the amount of $1,100. She will use this loan to purchase another cleaning machine and repairing house.

loans.use: Purchasing another cleaning machine and repairing house.

loans.name: Khikmatullo

texts.en:
Khikvatullo I. lives in Mastchoh, Tajikistan; he is married and has 4 children. Since 2006, Khikvatullo I. has been receiving and repaying loans from MicroInvest. The loan amounts have steadily increased, which shows the stability and development. of his business.

His business includes the milk processing and production of a variety of dairy products. His dream is to purchase a horn pedigree cow to produce more milk and sour-milk products to sell at the bazaars. He plans to produce a variety of milk and sour products, such as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd.

Now Khikvatullo I. requests a loan of 1600 TJS (about $475) to purchase a pedigree milk cow. Purchasing this cow will allow him to significantly increase the family income and to plan the further expansion of his business and variety of dairy products.

loans.use: Purchase pedigree milk cows

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mr. U. Khom (age 27) and his wife, Mrs. Mao Puthy have been married since 2004.They have one daughter. Khom and his family are living at National Road 6 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, and he has been working as a construction contractor since 2000. His wife stays at home taking care of their daughter.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now he is requesting another loan of $700. He will use this money to purchase construction materials to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San R. is 34-year-old and is married with three school-age children. She works selling clothes and utensils at Punle market, Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. Every morning she has to get up very early in order to travel and open her shop, which is about thirty-five minutes from her house. With daily business activity, she can normally make around $3 each day of profit, while her husband can make only $2 per day from working as a dentist. Mrs. San R. has lately requested a loan amount of $1000 to purchase extra utensils and clothes to meet her large growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase extra utensils and clothes to meet her large growing customer demand.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
Mrs. Máxima had to assume radical changes for the well-being of her family. Twenty years ago in her native land of San Martín de Pangoa, due to the political violence of terrorism that beat upon her beautiful city, she fled leaving her cultivation lands and her humble abode in order to save the life of her husband and their ten children, all of whom were still little, and they chose the city of Huancayo and with the help of many generous people they recouperated. With time they purchased in this city a house and some plots for cultivation in which Mrs. Máxima used it to sow potatoes and corn and breed animals, especially piglets. At present she lives alone with with five of her children who are still minors; the others are already grown into good men who have formed their own households. It has been many years since her husband abondoned her. Two years ago she returned to her native land to recoup that which she once had to leave behind and now she has taken back to her cultivation lands coffee and cocoa. Her loan request attends to the need to convey her produce from the countryside to the city in order to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Máxima, tuvo que asumir cambios radicales por la seguridad de su familia, hace 20 años en su tierra natal San Martín de Pangoa, debido a la violencia política del terrorismo que azotó su bella ciudad huyó dejando sus tierras de cultivo y su humilde casita para salvar la vida de su esposo y sus 10 hijos, todos eran pequeños y escogieron la ciudad de Huancayo y con ayuda de muchas personas generosas resurgieron, con el tiempo compraron en esta ciudad una casa y algunos terrenos de cultivo en los que actualmente Doña Máxima se dedica a sembrar papa y maíz y a la crianza de animales, especialmente cerditos. En la actualidad vive sólo con 5 de sus hijos que son los menores, los otros ya son hombres de bien, que han forjado su propio hogar, hace varios años su esposo la abandonó. Hace 2 años volvió a su tierra natal a recuperar lo que una vez tuvo que dejar y ahora ha retomado en sus tierras el cultivo del café y del cacao. Su solicitud atiende a su necesidad de trasladar sus productos del campo a la ciudad para su comercialización.

loans.use: Rental of a transport vehicle. - Alquiler de un vehículo de transporte.

loans.name: Fatma's Jiimarishe Group

texts.en:
Fatma S. is 35 years old and is divorced woman with 3 children, ages 12,8 and 2 years old. Fatma S. conduct a small business of making and selling chapatis, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her chapati business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to make more chapatis for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Fatma Y.. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other member is responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food items to make chapatis

loans.name: Rom Neng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom N., the group leader, owns a small restaurant in Cham Bak Phém Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells rice soup, Chinese noodles and rice for breakfast. She is 55 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Sameourn Hin, is a farmer and he cultivates land near the village.

In the past, Mrs. Rom N. has hired a pump to water their crop. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to pay the fee this year and has applied for a loan to solve this problem.

loans.use: To pay for a hired water pump

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha L. lives in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a mango seller and cricket seller. Previously, Mrs. Chantha L. obtained a loan from AMK to start her business. Her business now is more improved; thus, Mrs. Chantha L. needs to expand it. Unfortunately, Mrs. Chantha L. has insufficient money to buy more mangos and crickets, so Mrs. Chantha L. needed to ask for a loan again. Mrs. Chantha L. is a widow with two children, one of whom owns a beauty salon while the other is attending school.

loans.use: To buy more mangos and crickets to resell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, aged 22, is a young mother of a small son aged just 2, who provides both her reason for and strength to continue fighting. Teresa is from the village of Orcotuna, and she has lived there since she was born. Many have left for other towns searching for a better future, but Teresa hasn’t: she believes she can have a bright future and give her son the best of everything in her hometown.

Teresa trusts in her hands and in the land, which is the source of her sustenance. Teresa’s fields produce alfalfa, which is the feed for her livestock, who proviD. milk which she sells in the livestock market. Teresa is very courageous and knows how to control her animals, especially bulls, which she also breeds, raises and then sells in the market. Although she’s only spent one year working in this profession, Teresa is already an expert livestock farmer. The money she is asking for is in order to sow alfalfa on more of her land and to be able to buy the necessary seeds and fertiliser to do this. Teresa believes in the land, and she asks that you believe in her.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa a sus 22 años es una joven madre D. un pequeño D. tal sólo dos años, que es su razón y fuerza para luchar. Teresa es del pueblo D. Orcotuna, y allí vive desD. que nació. Muchos se fueron a otras ciudades buscando un futuro mejor, pero Teresa no, ella cree que pueD. tener un buen futuro y darle lo mejor a su hijo en su propia tierra. Teresa confía en sus manos y en esa tierra fuente D. su sustento. El terreno D. Teresa produce alfalfa, que es el alimento D. su ganado del que extrae la leche, que venD. en la feria ganadera, Teresa es muy valiente y sabe como manejar a sus animales, es especial a los toros, ya que los cría, cuida y también venD. en la feria. A pesar que sólo lleva un año trabajando D. esta manera, Teresa ya es toda una experta ganadera. El dinero que piD., es para sembrar alfalfa en otras áreas D. su terreno, comprar para ello, semillas y abono. Teresa cree en su tierra, y ella te piD. que creas en ella.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilisers in order to plant alfalfa in her fields and continue raising livestock for sale.

loans.name: Guy

texts.fr:
Guy A. is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. It is with increasing difficulty that he is meeting the needs of his family due to the fact that he is a farmer and land suitable for cultivation is becoming rarer and less fertile. To earn more money to support his family, he is planning on changing businesses and becoming a motorcycle taxi driver in Avetonou, a village located 85 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this FECECAV loan, Mr. A. hopes to purchase his own motorcycle to start his business. With this opportunity from Kiva, he can begin to increase the quality of life for himself and for his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Guy A. est âgé de 35ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille parce qu’il travaille avec les cultivateurs et les terres cultivables deviennent de plus en plus rares et moins fertiles. Pour gagner plus de l’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il prévoit changer d’activité pour conduire un taxi moto à Avétonou, un village situé à 85 km de Lomé la capitale du Togo. Avec ce crédit de FECECAV, Monsieur Guy espère acheter sa propre moto pour commencer son entreprise. Avec cette chance de Kiva, il peut commencer à tellement augmenter la qualité de sa vie et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: The purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Tiguida

texts.fr: Tiguida D., 42 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané 3 depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines d’arachide pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Tiguida sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Tiguida D., age 42, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané 3 for six years. She wants to buy peanuts to transform into peanut butter to sell. Her income will enable her to help cover family expenses. Tiguida is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Lilliam Haydee

texts.es: Lilliam Haydee  T. tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el barrio Los Meléndez, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe. Esta señora habita con su esposo Manuel Rivera Vilchez, este señor le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, se desempeña como personal encargado de servicio al cliente en una empresa de Managua; ellos tienen a cargo a dos hijos que estudian actualmente en primaria , los sueños de doña Lilliam es darle una condición de vida mejor a sus pequeños ya que ha pasado muchas dificultades para poder logra lo que hoy en día tienen , esta señora es comerciante tiene una pulpería  ubicada en su casa , y solicita el apoyo del crédito para aumentar su inventario ya que quiere lograr tener una miscelánea en el futuro
texts.en:
Lilliam Haydee T. is 33 years old and lives in the Los Meléndez neighborhood of Ticuantepe city. She lives with her husband Manuel Rivera Vilchez, and he helps her with the household expenses. She works as a personal courier for a business in Managua. They have two children who are in primary school. Lilliam dreams of providing a better standard of living to her little ones as they have overcome many difficulties to be able to have what they have today. This woman has a small grocery store located in her home, and she is asking for a loan to increase her inventory as she wants to have a general store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cleaning and personal use products

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 43 años, vive con 2 de sus 6 hijos. Desde hace más de 15 años, se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, desde muy joven ha disfrutado de vivir en el campo y respirar aire puro, por lo que decidió establecer su hogar y criar ahí a sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, hoy solo vive con los 2 menores que la ayudan también en cuidar sus tierras de cultivo, siembra papa y maíz, también alfalfa, la cual le servirá para venderla en el mercado y alimentar a sus animales, tiene dos terrenos, en uno de ellos siembra y el otro lo hace descansar por varios meses para que la tierra recupere sus nutrientes y de una buena producción cuando se vuelva a sembrar, es así que ella trabaja, y también con sus animales, principalmente con su vaca, la lleva  a zonas lejanas para pastearla a parte de la alfalfa que le da de comer.  Carmen trabaja para seguir manteniendo a sus 2 últimos hijos, que son la razón de su esfuerzo. Solicita este préstamo para su próxima campaña de siembra en la tierra de cultivo que se muestra en la fotografía, desea comprar sacos de abono, semilla y alquilar tractor.
texts.en:
Carmen is 43 years old. She lives with two of her 6 children. For more than 15 years now, she has made a living in agriculture and livestock. She has enjoyed living in the countryside and breathing clean air since she was very young. This is why she decided to make her home there and raise her six children. Today, she only lives with her two youngest who also help her take care of the farm. She plants potato, corn, and alfalfa which she sells at the market, and also uses to feed her livestock. She owns two properties; in one of them she plants while the other rests for several months so that the earth recovers its nutrients and can yield a good crop once it is cultivated again. This is how she works; she also works with her livestock, especially her cow, which she takes to far off pastures to feed in addition to the alfalfa she gives her to eat. Carmen works to continue to support her two youngest children, who are the reason for her great efforts. She asks for this loan for her next crop; she wishes to purchase fertilizer, seed and rent a tractor.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her next crop

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La Sr. Dominga de 52 años de edad, habitante del memorial Sandino de la capital de Managua. Madre soltera tiene cuatros lindos hijos de 9, 11, 14 y 17 años todos  estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Trabaja en su negocio de venta de mariscos desde hace 20 años en un de los mercados de la cuidad. Como  planes tiene vender variados productos como: frutas, carne, pescado. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograra cumplir con sus planes  de crecer como pequeño negocio y generar mayores ventas con sus nuevos productos. También aumentaría sus ingresos y cumplirá con la remodelación de su casa para brindarles un mejor nivel de vida y seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dominga is 52 years old and lives in the neighbourhood Memorial Sandino in the capital city of Managua. A single mother, she has four beautiful children aged 9, 11, 14, and 17 years, all of whom attend a school in the capital. She has worked selling seafood in one of the city markets for the past 20 years. She has plans to sell a variety of products such as fruit, meat, and fish. Thanks to the loans from Kiva partner Afodenic she will be able to accomplish her plans to expand her small business and earn more money from her new products. She will also increase her revenue and finish renovating her home to make it safer and give her children a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seafood, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida M. is thirty years old. She is a married woman with three children who are all currently in the basic school.

Rashida has been trading since her infancy with her mother. She went into business right after completing elementary school. Rashida trades cereals such as maize and groundnuts, along with beans and other food items. She buys these foods directly from the farmers at relatively low prices and sells them at the local market in the town where she lives with her family. She also treks some of her goods to nearby markets to sell. Rashida says she wants to use this loan to buy the goods in bulk so that she can distribute to a number of customers.

Rashida belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cereals like maize and groundnuts

loans.name: Hobly N’Dokpo

texts.fr: Agé de 57 ans, Mr Hobly N’Dokpo A. est marié et père de huit (08) enfants. Couturier de formation, il est très dynamique au travail. Afin de s’acheter de nouvelles machines à coudre et mieux équiper son atelier, il sollicite un financement. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Hobly N’Dokpo A. is 57 years old, married and father of eight children. Trained as a tailor, he is very dynamic in his work. He is requesting a loan in order to buy new sewing machines and better equip his workshop. This will allow Mr. A. to increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and work equipment

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 31 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa. Ghada has owned a grocery store for five years. She is an active women, who also sells clothes and flowers. She has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fish because she wants to start a new business. 
This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time.
Her previous loans helped her diversify her merchandise and improve her business. Her clients are people from her region.

loans.use: Ghada will use the loan to purchase fish because she wants to start a new business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana M. is 42 years old. She is married and has six children. Currently three are in school while the remaining three have completed junior high school. Her husband works with a rubber manufacturing company. The family lives together in a rented apartment in the community.

Diana loves selling goods, the business through which she earns a living.  She has been selling yams for four years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy yams from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school. Diana belongs to the village bank called ‘Adom Akyede’ meaning the Gift of Grace. She is grateful for your assistance. She hopes to receive GHS800 to restock her inventory.

loans.use: To buy yams

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: My name is Parveen A. and I am a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 40 years.  I am an uneducated lady because I belong to a poor family and my parents were not in a position to send me to school. My husband died at the age of 60 of a heart attack.  I am a mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters.  My eldest son drives an ox cart for delivering items (crops, fertilizer) from one place to another and my younger son is a loader by profession.  My daughters help me in my thread chain making business.  We collect the orders from the goldsmiths because they used the thread chain to tie up jewelry.  We make 12 dozen thread chains in one week and earn good income.  I have successfully repaid my five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now I am applying for a loan to buy an ox for my younger son so that he will be able to do his loading work easily.

loans.use: Buy an ox for son's loading business.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka S., 45, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public five days per week.

This is her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $83). SPBD loans are Eka’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, weed killer, knives, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares A. lives in Gaza city in Palestine. He is 32 years old, married, and has seven children. He is engaged in sheep-breeding which is the only source of income for Fares and his family. He believes such a business will provide his children a better life and the opportunity for a good education. He has applied for this loan to purchase more sheep and fodder.

loans.use: purchase more sheep and fodder

loans.name: Akpenamawu

texts.fr: Akpenamawu T. est responsable d’une boutique de prêt-à-porter à Wome. Agé de 37 ans, il est mariée et père d’un enfant. Akpenamawu est un bon gestionnaire d’entreprise car il a considérablement augmenté ses recettes en ces derniers temps. Il est bien organisé et très rigoureux. Il espère avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise afin  répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. Il augmentera par la même occasion ses revenus qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akpenamawu T. is the owner of a clothing store in Wome. He is 37 years old, married and the father of a child. Akpenamawu is a good business manager, he has considerably increased his business revenue recently. He is well organized and very thorough. He hopes to use this credit to increase the size of his business to meet customer demand. He plans to use the increased revenue from his growing business to support his family.

Translated from French by Ryan Jones, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Grow his clothing business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 47 years old and married with five children. She sells tailoring materials like zippers, landings, etc.  She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more tailoring materials to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina sells drinks and juice in her shop. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. Justina is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun C., aged 39, is a builder who often travels long distances to find work at a building site. He typically earns an income of US $3.50 per day to cover his family’s expenses. He has to work hard for many hours to ensure a good quality of life for his family. His wife is unemployed, but she is responsible for any household tasks.

They are blessed with four children, two of whom are students, and the rest are employed with reasonable wages. C. plans to purchase a motorbike to operate an additional business of providing transportation services to generate more income, so he really wants to take out a loan of US $1000 to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 28 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. One is schooling and her last-born is breastfeeding. She is a petty trader and trades in salt and bags of rice. She supplies them to food vendors, among others. She travels to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. She buys few bags of salt and rice because she does not have enough money to buy more. This makes her travel frequently to Kumasi, because her capital is not sufficient to buy in bulk.

Philomena spoke to her husband and to some family members for financial assistance but to no avail. She is requesting the loan to buy bulk supplies of salt and bags of rice; this, she believes, will reduce the frequency of travel. She dreams of saving more to cater for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy bulk quantities of salt

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vỳ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1958. ( ID number: 010117130033). She lives in Xom Trong, Uy No, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and her son. She has three children. Her First son and girl were married. Present, she and her husband have to raise a son. They have a store in the market. They sell clothes. They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 vnd. This time, she wants to borrow 4.578.000 vnd ( or 265 USD) to invest in her clothes shop.

loans.use: to invest in her clothes shop.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie N. is from the village of Tagoloan in Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Jovie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovie makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Jovie just started this business.

In 2009, Jovie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Jovie's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
'Success' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Emmanuel S., 31 years old, a high school graduate, married with 3 children aged 3 months-3 years; the older ones are still in nursery (academically). Emmanuel also cares for 2 brothers. He lives and sells on Lynch Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. This community was destroyed by the civil war, so people live in old and burnt houses.

 Emmanuel’s business is brick making. He molds bricks and sells them retail to those that are into renovation, since Lynch street was destroyed by the civil war. 

After making bricks during the daytime, Emmanuel’s night business is operating his little tea shop. He also serves as a photographer to the residents of Lynch Street. Emmanuel started as a brick contractor and raised some money which he used to start up his own business and he has been working at this business for 9 years. He always has goods on hand and sells at an affordable price, so him has a lot of customers.

Emmanuel’s main difficulty is during the rainy season when the rain damages his bricks because he does not have a shelter. Emmanuel needs this loan to purchase more cement in order to produce more bricks that can serve his customers and also to build a shelter to work under and that can also protect his bricks. He hopes to have a big business, if possible a company in the future.

Emmanuel dreams of having access to funds that can help other people through his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cement to produce more bricks and also build a shelter

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Dagvadorj T. is a 62-year-old widower. He currently lives alone in Arhangai, one of the central cities in Mongolia.

Dagvadorj owns an old truck that he uses for his business. He mostly travels to different parts of the province and sells various household products to families in the countryside. He has been in the drive-and-retail business since 2001 and has grown this business into a main source of his income.

Since the start, Dagvadorj has been quite successful and his capital has increased from 220,000 MNT (1 USD = 1,450 MNT) to 800,000 MNT. He hopes to expand his business and would like to open a small store in the most demanded area of the province.

Dagvadorj requests a loan to fix his truck and purchase some household products to sell.

loans.use: To fix his truck and purchase some household products to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La señora Maritza C. tiene 49 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos, dos menores y uno que está estudiando en la universidad. La señora Maritza se dedica a la venta de mercadería general, principalmente ropa, juguetes y zapatos usados. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cobertores, sabanas, colchas y mosquiteros para la época que se acerca, ya que desea aprovechas los precios bajos de estas fechas. Es importante mencionar, que la señora además trabaja como enfermera en el hospital, y también allí ofrece sus mercancías a sus compañeros de trabajo. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que pueda ser atendida por los miembros de su familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza C. is 49 years old, is married with three children -- two young children and one who is studying at a university. Mrs. Maritza sells general merchandise, primarily clothing, toys and used shoes. 21 years ago when she started her business, she began with a small amount of capital and was saving little by little until she had enough clients. The loan will be invested in the purchase of blankets, sheets, quilts and mosquito nets during the upcoming season because she wants to take advantage of the low prices during this time. It is important to mention that the lady also works as a nurse in the hospital, and there she sells her merchandise to her fellow workers. Her goal is to have a variety store that can be maintained by members of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of blankets, sheets, quilts and mosquito nets for sale

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Pedro está ubicado en la parroquia Victoria del Portete  al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, la parroquia lleva este nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en sus campos, sus fiestas patronales se celebran en el mes de Octubre donde se  realizan diferentes actividades como la quema de castillos, juegos pirotécnicos, concursos de danza y música folklórica, su gente es alegre y siempre piensa en surgir personal y económicamente con sus familias.

La señora María  D. vive en Zhizho una comunidad que pertenece  a la Parroquia Victoria del Portete; ella  tiene 45 años de edad se encuentra casada y tiene siete  hijos de 24, 18, 17, 14, 12, 9, 6 años, sus hijos primero, tercero y cuarto  trabajan y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos de la  casa, su segunda hija estudia en el colegio Miguel Moreno, mientras que sus últimos hijos estudian en la escuela San Joaquín y su esposo trabaja como carpintero;  la casa en la que habitan es propia gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo de toda la familia.

María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y comparte con otras actividades como la costura y bordados desde hace diez meses y también a la cría de pollos y cuyes  que son tanto para  el consumo de su hogar  y para la venta cuando se presenta una  necesidad  económica.

Nuestra socia lleva un año y medio trabajando con la fundación y nos asegura que los créditos le han ayudado para mantener su hogar y negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de más animalitos como pollos y cuyes para incrementar su criadero.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos estar estable emocional y económicamente.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank is located in the parish of Victoria del Portete south of the city of Cuenca. The parish has this name in honor of the battle that occurred on its countryside. Its patron celebrations are held in October, with fireworks displays, dance competitions, and folklore music. The people are very happy and always think about moving ahead personally and economically with their families. Mrs. María D. lives in Zhizho, a community that belongs to Victoria del Portete Parish. María is 45 years-old, married, and has seven children, ages 6, 9, 12, 14, 17, 18, and 24. Her first three sons work and help her out with the household costs. Her daughter, the second oldest, studies in Miguel Moreno high school, while her youngest children study at San Joaquín elementary school and her husband works as a carpenter. They own the house they live in, thanks to the effort and work of the whole family. María takes care of household chores and began with other activities such as sewing and embroidery ten months ago. She also works raising chickens and guinea pigs, which are enough to provide for her home and can also be sold in times of economic need. Our member has been working for a year and a half for the foundation and she assures us that previous loans have helped her maintain her home and business. With the new loan funds from ESPOIR she will invest in the purchase of more young animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs, to increase her stock. Her dream is to see her children emotionally and economically stable.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and guinea pigs to increase livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells used clothes at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo State. The demands for her used clothes is high because there are people in her community that cannot afford new clothes.
